story:
The Adam & Eve Experiment

Killing Adam and Eve is no easy task, even if you're God. A fable once forgotten now brought to the big screen. The Adam & Eve Experiment is a comedy based on a true story. At a young age when I was attending Hebrew school every Mondays and Wednesdays, I loved hearing the stories that made the religion what it is. I had this image of God wasted, making foolish decisions and messing with Humans. This project is my twisted version of the universal story known around the world. 

Where Will Your Donation Go?

We cannot complete this film without your help. Your contribution, no matter how small, will make a difference. We have incredibly hard working, talented, and passionate crew to feed, wardrobe to make just right for the time, art to bring the essence of the film to life, actors to keep in zone, locations to get spot on and more.

Budget Breakdown: 

 

Creative Team

We have some incredible people on board to make this film happen.

Ricky Brown, Writer/Director

Ricky Brown has a passion for stand up and comedic writing. He strives to produce original content with bizarre worlds and dramatic outcomes. He is currently attending The New York Film Academy where he has had the opportunity to produce 8 short films, this being the 8th. He has had experience working behind film cameras, specifically 16mm and 8mm film. Striving to tell stories based on the strange ideas he imagines while having trouble falling asleep. 

 

Concha Silveira, Cinematographer

Concha is a 21 year old cinematographer from Lisbon, Portugal. She did 2 years of Cinema College in Portugal and came to New York to specialize in Cinematography. She is currently in New York Film Academy’s Cinematography program. She loves cinema, all kinds of cheese and analog pictures.

 

Kierra Jordan, Production Designer

Kierra grew up always embracing the arts often painting and finding creative forms of expression. She has graduated from Syracuse University with a BFA in Theatrical Design and Technology in 2017. Since entering college Kierra has been busy any spare moment working on a variety of projects conceptualizing spaces that enhance character and story from set dressing and decorating, prop making, production designing on short, feature, commercial and television productions. 

 

Dannielle Rodas, Makeup Artist 

Danielle is a New York transplant who grew up in southern California. Realizing her passion for makeup she decided to move back to California, where she attended the Master MakeUp Artistry Program at Makeup Desiongory Los Angeles to pursue her professional career in special effects and beauty make-up. Since moving back she has had the opportunity to work with many talented photographers, directors and producers.

 

THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Lisa Donmall-Reeve of LDR Creative and I am the Lead Producer fors 'Double Exposure'

I started LDR Creative 2 years ago. We produced a short film called 'Early Mourning' which featured at 21 film festivals, won 5 awards and had 6 further nominations. I am currently mid production for a feature length documentary called 'Transmission - Roots to Branches' and also developing a follow up short film with the director of 'Early Mourning' called 'Free' 

I started LDR Creative to give emerging artists in all creative fields a chance to shine. There are so many fantastic creative professionals with amazing ideas and I love to collaborate with them and make the end product a reality.

Daryl and Austin have been active within the industry for many years and we have worked on this project for over a year to get it right. We are all very excited at the possibility of what it will become. Their combined creative vision and talent will make this a short film to remember.

By contributing to this project and helping us complete this film, you will aiding two very talented writers and an aspiring female director into the world of film. You will also help the possibility of the feature length version become a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $52,000.00 for the short film.

We have a cast of 13 union Actors, as well as dancers and extras. Our crew is a team I have worked with before from On The Rocks Films and 10 people strong. We have 6 different locations in Brooklyn and Manhattan to help us create the world of our leading lady, Dani, over a 4 day shoot.

The budget will be spent on wages, transport, food (very important on set!) music rights, creative fees, post,film festivals and marketing. I always make the budget go as far as it possibly can but I also make sure everyone is paid fairly, fed and treated well.

We have some awesome unique perks for certain donations.

Signed posters (1 of your choice) of Hamilton,Dear Evan Hansen, Greatest Showman and Incredibles 2 by our composer and three time Grammy Award winner ,Alex Lacamoire.

Premiere tickets to the film.(dependant on amount donated - with guests)

Executive Producer Credit

IF the full amount is not raised, we will keep what we raise safe until the full budget is achieved.

Your contribution will ONLY be used for the production of this short film.

Risks & Challenges

Your donation will be one for the arts. With this current political climate, we need the support of the public more than ever.

Short films notoriously do not make money. Which is why this is not a financial investment but a  contribution to the arts. You will  help us create traction and awareness of this wonderful story which will ultimately take us to our end goal -  getting the feature film version made.

Indie films rely on support like yours. And we, as a whole team of cast, crew and creatives are incredibly grateful for your support.

I have been in the business for almost three decades. You don't survive in the world of show unless you are determined, smart, resourceful and have good instincts. Something I pride myself on. With these attributes, your money will be in safe hands and well spent creating a wonderful film.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to help right now, please share this link and all our social media tags. 

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary About The Players

With over 250 film credits to Debbie Rochon's name she brings a solid knowledge of independent film, specifically horror, to the table. She has worked with some of the most talented people in the business - on both sides of the camera. She is also a published writer having had her own column in The Joe Bob Report and Fangoria magazine. She has worked for years in radio co-producing and co-hosting a number of shows, most recently a 4 year stint on Sirius/XM called Fangoria Radio. Model Hunger was her directorial debut. It garnered 18 Film Festival nominations and 10 Festival wins. Torment Road will be writer James Morgart's 7th produced script. He also wrote Model Hunger which became a terrific collaboration between Rochon and Morgart.

See Debbie Rochon's IMDb page right here

See James Morgart's IMDb page right here

See Model Hunger trailer right here

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise 30,000 for the film's budget. This is a micro-budget of course but if we can get to this goal we will be able to complete pre-production, filming and post-production. Within that small budget our funds go to many things including -

-Film Insurance, permits, business costs.

-Professional skeleton crew and post facility.

-Basic art design costs and costuming.

-Talent, actual names can only be given after we raise the money we need, if we happen to raise more - then even more people will be brought on the production.

- This is a Non-SAG film but we will be using Fi-Core members and Non-Union genre talent.

-There are many more costs for example but not limited to - set food and beverages, gas/flight/accommodations, locations etc.

The Impact

Regardless of the amount contributed to the project, like the project itself, it takes numbers. Many numbers of people contributing many numbers of dollars they can afford! If you are doing great in your life and give a large, generous amount - that's amazing! If times are tough and you have just a small amount to give - the love is still felt like a high wattage bulb!

Without this campaign there is no Torment Road. There is no road horror movie. This is happening because of you and your kindness/greatness. Nothing else. A lot of people will be working very hard on this movie. Your hard earned money will enable a number of folks to work diligently to bring you something you'll be happy to have your name on as a supporter and contributor.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Make it super easy and use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!

story:
A Cup Of Coffee With Marilyn

Logline

An audacious Italian journalist, after interviewing the most powerful people on Earth, is sent to Hollywood to chase her most evasive subject yet - Marilyn Monroe.

SINOSSI/SYNOPSIS

Oriana Fallaci, una giornalista sui trent'anni nel fiore della sua carriera, arriva in America per intervistare alcuni fra i divi più conosciuti di Hollywood. Il suo ultimo obiettivo è Marilyn Monroe, che, come Oriana, è al picco della sua fama. Durante la sua "caccia" a Marilyn, Oriana si confronta con diverse persone, tra cui il regista Jean Negulesco, che la mette subito in guardia sulla difficoltà dell'impresa. Testarda, Oriana si reca comunque a New York dove altri colleghi la scoraggeranno prima di offrirle comunque il loro aiuto. Uno di questi le presenterà Irving Hoffman, un famoso pubblicista nel settore che ce la metterà tutta per aiutare Oriana a cercare Marilyn e farle avere un appuntamento con lei. Nell'arco di tre anni, Oriana farà avanti e indietro tra Italia e New York, per cercare di incontrare la famosa diva, sebbene le circostanze non giochino mai a suo favore.

Oriana Fallaci, a well known journalist in her thirties, arrives in America to complete a series of interviews with the best known actors in Hollywood. Her final target is Marilyn Monroe, who, like Oriana, is at the peak of her fame and prime.
In her hunt for Marilyn, Oriana confronts the director Jean Negulesco, who warns her about the difficulty of her pursuit. Unafraid, Oriana travels straight to New York City where other colleagues will also discourage her before offering their help. One of these colleagues will introduce her to Irving Hoffman, a famous publicist who will put a lot of effort into tracking down Marilyn.
In the span of 3 years, Oriana will come back to NYC three times to chase a meeting with the elusive diva, only to be stopped everytime she manages to get close.

DUE DONNE CHE HANNO FATTO LA STORIA, A MODO LORO.

TWO WOMEN WHO MADE HISTORY IN THEIR OWN WAY |

 

Oriana Fallaci

Oriana Fallaci è stata una giornalista italiana famosa in tutto il mondo, la prima donna a fare da reporter sul fronte in Vietnam. Sono ricordate le sue uniche interviste con politici come Kissinger, Gheddafi, l'Ayatollah Khomeini e altre celebrità internazionali. Viene ricordata come un carattere indomito, difficile, una donna emancipata che ha segnato il giornalismo italiano e anche la letteratura, dagli anni ‘50 fino alla sua morte, nel 2006. Oriana iniziò la sua carriera come giornalista già durante l'adolescenza, dopo la guerra, scrivendo sui giornali locali articoli di cronaca nera, sempre con una vena politica e polemica. Venendo da una famiglia di antifascisti, l'esperienza della Resistenza segnò sempre i suoi scritti e i suoi pensieri. Negli anni '50 iniziò a scrivere per l'Europeo, che la mandò spesso in giro per il mondo a completare reportage di diversa natura. Uno di questi si trasformò nel suo primo libro, "I sette peccati di Hollywood", che racconta le sue esperienze alle prese con il mondo degli attori e delle dive, molto lontano dai suoi valori e dai suoi interessi. La prefazione fu scritta da Orson Welles, che, complice il fatto di avere una moglie italiana, diventò subito amico della giornalista e la paragonò a Mata Hari per la sua arguzia nel ricavare le informazioni, uscendone "senza un graffio".

Oriana Fallaci was a world-renowed journalist, the first Italian woman to report from the war
front in Vietnam.
Famous are her unique interviews with politicians like Kissinger, Gaddafi, Ayatollah Khomeini and
many international celebrities. She is remembered as a fierce character, a prominent female journalist - from the 50s until her death in 2006, wearing trousers and living “like a man” back when it was very unusual, especially in Italy.
Oriana started her career as a journalist straight after the Second World War by writing in local press in Florence.
The experience of the war will have a huge impact on her strong opinionated character.
In the 50s she wrote for the Europeo newspaper, which assigned her many jobs around the
world. One of these was a collection of interviews with the big stars of Hollywood, which she transformed in a minutious, honest and funny report in her first book, Seven Sins of Hollywood
(1958). The preface is written by Orson Welles, who befriended her very quickly upon her arrival to Hollywood and who compared her to Mata Hari for her sharp eye, ability to sneak in, get the information she wanted and yet blend in without being noticed as an outsider.

 

I PERSONAGGI | Marilyn Monroe

Marilyn Monroe, d'altra parte, stava vivendo il suo ultimo decennio, pieno di successi e ostacoli. Dopo aver rotto con la Fox, si avvicinò molto al fotografo Milton Greene, con cui fondò la casa di produzione MMP. Si spostò dunque dalla California a New York e decise di dedicarsi al suo miglioramento come attrice e al cambiamento di alcune persone chiave intorno a sè. Dopo il divorzio da Joe Di Maggio, si fidanzò subito con lo scrittore Arthur Miller. All'inizio del 1956 si risposò e riuscì ad ottenere un contratto più vantaggioso con la Fox. La stessa stampa che l'aveva affossata e ridicolizzata per il suo forte desiderio di cambiare l'immagine di se stessa come un'attrice frivola, iniziò a lodarla per il suo successo e la sua tenacia. Decise di dedicarsi quasi completamente alla vita matrimoniale con il suo nuovo marito, vivendo tra Connecticut e New York. Gli aborti spontanei e l'uso di droghe da parte sua deteriorarono molto il suo rapporto con Arthur, che terminò durante o poco dopo le riprese di "The Misfits". Morì da sola, nel 1962, nella sua casa di Los Angeles, dopo il suo terzo divorzio, senza figli o altri membri della famiglia ad occuparsi di lei. Diventò un'icona di Hollywood.

Marilyn Monroe, on the other hand, was living through the last successful yet tumoultuos decade
of her life.
After fighting with Fox and breaking her contract, she became very close to the photographer
Milton Greene, with whom she founded the production company MMP.
She moved from California to NYC and decided to dedicate her time to studying her craft and
changed a lot of the people around her. Already divorced from Joe DiMaggio, she then became
engaged to Arthur Miller.
By the beginning of 1956, She was newly married, had won the battle with Fox and
managed to get a fairer contract for herself.
The same press that was undermining her dispute with Fox, ridiculng her prerogative of changing
the perception of herself as a frivolous actress, was now praising her success and her strength.
Troubled by this lifestyle and up and downs, she decided to dedicate herself to a quiet family life
with her new husband Arthur Miller between Connecticut and New York.
Marilyn will face a couple of miscarriages during her marriage, which will deteriorate heavily
during the filming of The Misfits, also due to a more and more increasing addiction to drugs.
She’ll die in 1962 in her house in Los Angeles, after her third divorce, without any kids. She is now considered a Hollywood icon.

 

GENERE E STILE | GENRE AND STYLE

La storia vuole essere comica, tagliente e ironica. I continui colpi di scena faranno incuriosire l'audience, facendolo simpatizzare con Oriana e la sua disperata e comica ricerca di Marilyn.

The story is comical, sharp, ironic. The constant twists in the plot will engage with the audience, making it symphatise with Oriana while she's desperately looking for Marilyn.

AUDIENCE ENGAGEMENT

E' una storia vera. Come tutte le storie vere che sembrano assurde, ti prende.

It's a real story. Like all real stories that sounds bizarre, it's catchy.

VISUAL REFERENCES

LOCATION MOODBOARD

Gli aborti spontanei e l'uso di droghe da parte sua deteriorarono molto il suo rapporto con Arthur, che terminò durante o poco dopo le riprese di "The Misfits". Morì da sola, nel 1962, nella sua casa di Los Angeles, dopo il suo terzo divorzio, senza figli o altri membri della famiglia ad occuparsi di lei. Diventò un'icona di Hollywood.
Marilyn Monroe, on the other hand, was living through the last successful yet tumoultuos decadeof her life.After fighting with Fox and breaking her contract, she became very close to the photographerMilton Greene, with whom she founded the production company MMP.She moved from California to NYC and decided to dedicate her time to studying her craft andchanged a lot of the people around her. Already divorced from Joe DiMaggio, she then becameengaged to Arthur Miller.By the beginning of 1956, She was newly married, had won the battle with Fox andmanaged to get a fairer contract for herself.The same press that was undermining her dispute with Fox, ridiculng her prerogative of changingthe perception of herself as a frivolous actress, was now praising her success and her strength.Troubled by this lifestyle and up and downs, she decided to dedicate herself to a quiet family lifewith her new husband Arthur Miller between Connecticut and New York.Marilyn will face a couple of miscarriages during her marriage, which will deteriorate heavilyduring the filming of The Misfits, also due to a more and more increasing addiction to drugs.She’ll die in 1962 in her house in Los Angeles, after her third divorce, without any kids. She is now considered a Hollywood icon.
 



GENERE E STILE | GENRE AND STYLE
La storia vuole essere comica, tagliente e ironica. I continui colpi di scena faranno incuriosire l'audience, facendolo simpatizzare con Oriana e la sua disperata e comica ricerca di Marilyn.
The story is comical, sharp, ironic. The constant twists in the plot will engage with the audience, making it symphatise with Oriana while she's desperately looking for Marilyn.
AUDIENCE ENGAGEMENTE' una storia vera. Come tutte le storie vere che sembrano assurde, ti prende.It's a real story. Like all real stories that sounds bizarre, it's catchy.VISUAL REFERENCESLOCATION MOODBOARD

story:
Level 3 is set in a world where a group of underground assassins called The Order has control of the entire world. Every year, a tournament is held to follow their ancient tradition of martial arts, and to determine who is Number One, the highest honor anyone can attain. The protagonist, Gen, became number one, and decides to leave The Order to start a family. However, one cannot simply leave because in order to become Number One, he must either be defeated in unarmed combat, or die.

 
Hi guys!

Thank you so much for checking out Level 3. My name is Mike Le and I have always known what I wanted to be: an entertainer like my idols. Jackie Chan, Bruce Lee, Jet Li, and Donnie Yen were people I aspired to be. I became a martial artist, and majored in acting. I have landed multiple roles, but they were all background, nothing in the lead or speaking. As a Vietnamese-American, it is hard to land roles that would lead me to my dreams. Once again, I looked at my idols, and decided to create my own films to showcase not only myself, but to inspire others. I also met many different actors that are just like me, so I want to give them the opportunities that were never given to me.

Level 3 is a passion project that started with my company, Le Era Entertainment LLC. It is a film that will show men and women that are very talented who are never given the opportunity to shine their amazing talent on the big screen. We have an actor who is the fourth generation under Ip Man, the master of Bruce Lee. We have a stunt coordinator who knows practically knows every martial arts ever conceived, and can make some of the sickest moves you will ever see. This gives the martial arts enthusiasts the film that they truly deserve.

 

 

This film will influence other people to do the same. We want to pave the way for other filmmakers to be able to make martial arts films that showcase people of different races speaking in different languages, and have it shot here in America. No one has seen a Vietnamese kicking ass on screen, and if they did, not one that speaks actual Vietnamese dialogue. At the same time, we are showcasing people of different races and styles. They have been training their entire lives for a moment like this. Now it is the time to truly show the world that they can be the best possible martial arts actors that anyone seen. We are here to prove that it can be done.

 

 

The funding will go primarily to lock locations, and buy insurance. Being a very stunt heavy film, we need to cover our cast and crew. We don’t want anyone to break a bone, and not able to afford it. The locations will cost some money to shoot, but we do have alternate locations that are willing to do it for free. The problem is that they are too small, and do not allow room to create epic fight sequences. Last thing we need on set is someone losing an arm in a bad location.

The funding will also go towards feeding cast and crew and purchasing/renting the best equipment. Currently, we have the Black Magic Ursa Mini 4.6K, but once we meet our first stretch goal, we will be able to afford the Arri Alexa Mini. It is one of the most advanced camera used in the film industry. It was used in such films as "Guardians of the Galaxy," "Captain America: Winter Soldier," "Iron Man 3," and "Transformers: Age of Extinction." This camera will give the film that wow factor just like the films you could only see in the theaters. The money will also allow us to take the film on the road, going to film festivals, and to distribute it nationally. We want to show not only Hollywood, but the world that this film can be done thanks to enthusiastic fans of Bruce Lee and the martial arts world like you.

 

However, if we do not meet the funding goal, we will still shoot the film. This is a passion project. We all will make this film the best film possible. It will take longer, but no matter what, our blood, sweat, and tears will pour all over the screen. It will be epic, it will be amazing, and it will be inspiring. We cannot do it alone. We want to share this passionately and astronomically influential project with you and the world.

If you can’t afford any more money, please share this amongs friends, especially those who are into martial arts films. You can find us on (twitter, facebook, whatever social media site). Just letting people be aware that this is happening is just as valuable as getting one dollar from you.

story:
THE STORY

Mozzy is a queer black boy whose identity is divided between his relationships with his friends DJ, Mou, Sasha, Noah, and Jamey. Certain aspects of each of these relationships bring Mozzy’s compartmentalized identities into conflict. As his friends continue to be oblivious to his internal struggle, Mozzy discovers what he is not and who he wants to be.

 

THE TEAM

 

THE PLAN

 

 

THE ASK

Making films is a long and expensive process. We are so close to our final cut of OTHER BLACK BOYS, but we need the final push to put us over the finish line. We turn to you, our community of friends, family, and filmmakers to help us reach our goal.

Funds from this campaign will go directly to paying the hardworking post-production team who make this movie as great as it can be. We will be paying our editor for the months of hard work and passion he has put into this project, as well as paying a sound designer to come on board and create the auditory world of the film.

Working closely with our sound designer will be our composer, who will create original music to score the short. Finally, the film will go through finishing with a colorist and sound mixer to prepare it for the festival circuit. These final steps are what give our underdog film a fighting chance at festival viewership.

We love this movie and want to make sure everyone gets a chance to see it, but the festivals we respect and strive to premiere in often charge fees for submissions. A portion of the funds raised here will go towards festival entries for the finished film, with the goal of a 2019 premiere date.

We understand that not everyone can donate financial to our project. If you would like to support us in other ways, please share this campaign online and help our community grow!

If you have any questions, or would like to get involved in a way not listed above, please contact our producer.

 

THANK YOU

story:
Short Summary

 I am a 21-year-old aspiring filmmaker and college student living in Denton, Texas. This campaign is important to me, because it is my debut as not only a writer, but also a director. I am very excited to embark on this journey and I hope you'll come along with me.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise a total of $5000. This money will go toward paying a cast, crew, renting equipment,  marketing, merchandising, and everything else needed to make this film successful.

Check out our perks! 

The Impact

This film fits into the horror genre in the sense that it follows modern trends of the genre, as well as maintains enough of a classic influence to interest even the most knowledgeable of horror movie fans. 

Risks & Challenges

When someone says they're making a movie, it's hard to take them seriously. Especially, in a day where you have the capability to make a film with a device that fits in your pocket.  With so much content coming out on a weekly basis, it can be difficult to navigate the waters of film, especially independent film. But there are good stories to be captured out there.  With a little bit of money, a good storyteller can turn their story on a piece of paper to a cinematic adventure.  I believe the story that I have written is important enough to be captured on film and live cinematically. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, I appreciate you for stopping by anyway.  The second most important thing to this campaign is spreading the word  about this film and getting other people excited about it.  So by all means, tell a friend, make a post, do something to help reach a new audience. 

 I thank each and every one of you for taking the time.

story:
The Film

More Than a Feeling is a dark comedy set at a funeral. It is about ego and insecurity and how we often forget that even though we think everyone is judging us all the time, the truth is that everyone is mostly selfish and thinking almost exclusively about themself.

Nowadays, when somebody dies people post to social media with a picture of themself and the deceased person. It isn't enough to honor the dead, but we must honor the dead along with ourselves to make sure that we are effectively broadcasting to the world that we're sad because we were friends with the dead person and we want to remind everyone of that. Our intentions are good, but our subconscious need for constant affirmation can get the best of us.

This short film is a dark, comedic examination of this weakness.

The Cast

Budd Diaz (Buddy & Co-Writer) is a member of the comedy collective Power Violence, Budd starred on Bravo's The People's Couch, voiced "Bug" on FX's Stone Quackers, and has starred in all of Power Violence's short films, several of which have been featured as Vimeo Staff Picks.

Molly Mitchell (Sarah) is an LA-based actor and comedian best known for her roles on Comedy
Central's The Coach Who Clothed Them, and over a dozen Super Deluxe shorts and livestreams. She is a member of UCB's "The Colin Kaepernicks" and most importantly, is from Philadelphia.

Anthony "Fat Tony" Obi (Dave) is a Nigerian-American artist who has played an integral role in shaping the Houston rap scene. Pitchfork has described him as "a reliably funny, incisive, trend-dodging alt-rapper." He has toured internationally and performed with ASAP Rocky and Das Racist.

Johnny Pemberton (Chris) is a comedian, actor, writer, mildly knowledgeable gardener,
reggae enthusiast, and friend to both insects and mammals. He is the voice of "Peanut" on the Disney XD program Pickle and Peanut and can be seen in the films 21 Jump Street, 22 Jump Street, Neighbors 2, The Watch, Ant Man and Oscar-nominated film In the Loop.

The Crew

Callum Hanlon (Co-Writer & Director) is a filmmaker who started making skate videos in his parents' driveway in South Jersey and hasn't really stopped since then. While teaching ESL in Spain, Callum started making and selling spec commercials to companies likes Chevy, Pepsi & HTC, through London-based agency Mofilm. Then he came to Los Angeles where he made videos for ATTN, Fullscreen & Super Deluxe, the most notable of which is the Joanne the Scammer series, co-written and directed with Jason Richards. Now he has cut loose and is trying to take the next step in his filmmaking "journey."

Julia Grimm (Producer) is an LA-based Producer and Videographer with Jersey blood and a California vibe (wears crop tops). After receiving a degree in Film and Television from Boston University, she launched her career as a producer at Sundance award-winning Interloper Films. She's shot documentaries in Beijing and coordinated commercials in Australia. She currently works as a Production Manager at Super Deluxe, and continues to produce side projects big and small because it’s FUN. She also likes to do headstands while her cats watch judgmentally.

Hayden Mason (DP) is a talented DP who never sent in his bio, so now it is being written for him. Hailing from Chattanooga, Tennessee, Hayden did his undergrad at Harvard, graduate work at Stanford and did his doctorate at MIT before throwing it all away to pursue the film industry.

Lily Escobar (Art) is an artist and budget wizard. Cal first had Lily as a PA at Super Deluxe and after working with her once, requested that she be on every single shoot of his. She quickly moved up to Art Director for Super Deluxe Live and now works as the Design Coordinator for Fusina Designs, working on music videos for artists like YG, Ariana Grande, Nicki Minaj and more.

Jonathan Hinman (AD) is a comedy writer and producer from New York with a degree in drama and a background in assistant directing. His recent work includes Brandon Rogers's 20-episode series Stuff & Sam for Facebook Watch, and two season of the Fullscreen original series Magic Funhouse. Jonathan doesn't do much AD'ing anymore, but Cal begged him and he was generous enough to make a gallant return.

Jacob Cox (Editor) is a producer and editor for TV, Web, and Film in Los Angeles, New York City, and New Orleans, with 11 years of experience. Jacob has worked with clients ranging from Disney, Discovery, A&E, Oxygen, Rockstar Games, and more.  He's a funny person who doesn't like hugging. 

Risks & Challenges

We took a big risk. We could have stopped production when the financing disappeared, but we were already in too deep. The entire crew was on board, locations booked and rehearsals had begun. So Callum put it on his credit card and his lovely girlfriend supported him in his very irresponsible decision.

A lot of the expenses are on a credit card and then the crew is "Net-30" which means that we have 30 days to from the date of the shoot to pay them. This campaign is short so that hopefully we can raise enough money quickly enough to pay everyone on time.

There are other costs that continue to build up as we get through post ($), get the film mixed ($$), colored ($$$) and submitted to festivals ($$$$).

Anything helps. If you're still reading, this is almost over!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know there are much greater causes out there like RAICES and Planed Parenthood that are much more deserving of donations, but if you can spare any money to help out with this project, it is very appreciated. If you can't but you still want to help, please share this on Facebook, Instagram, etc. Or if you just don't fuck with this at all, but then you see the short film eventually and you really like it, or just kinda like it, tell your friends about it. But it won't be available to the public for a little while because we are sending it out to film festivals and a lot of them require that the submissions have not yet been made public.

story:
Short Summary

RJ Nevens, Jr. is a multi-award winning screenwriter, director, and producer with over 30 awards to date including  feature films , documentaries , and shorts.   He and his wife, Chelsea, run Black 17 Productions.  WALKING POINT IS HIS PASSION PROJECT.  He wrote the feature screenplay in 2014.  It has achieved accolades around the globe.  He followed it up by adapting it into a novel a few years later.   To date, RJ has donated nearly all the proceeds from the sale of the book to various military working dog or police K9 charities.   His love for dogs, particularly the Doberman breed, has been part of his inspiration behind Walking Point.  This project is about bringing the story of The Greatest Generation and the dedication and sacrifices made, not only by soldiers during WWII, but also by the many families that donated their beloved best friends to the Armed Forces.   Black 17 has partnered with the National Museum of the Pacific War  with the common goal of bringing Walking Point to life.   

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

WALKING POINT CAST

 

SCREENPLAY AWARDS FOR WALKING POINT

 

RJ with Lexie Belle Starr at the MWD National Monument at Lackland AFB

  

By contributing to this short film, you will help pave the way to bringing the story to life and forever memorialize our four legged companions, our soldiers, and their heroic deeds and sacrifices.   We can do this with your help!  

 

You can also join the thousands of Walking Point followers and see the history and the project updates on Facebook via this link: https://www.facebook.com/WalkingPointTheMovie/ 

We will be forever grateful for any amount of donation!  

What We Need

Making a historical war drama is costly.   Our budget includes costs for the following:

  • Camera, lighting, and grip equipment
  • War re-enactment facilities (National Museum of the Pacific War)
  • Other location rentals
  • Onsite catering
  • Housing of cast and crew (including our lovable animal actors!)
  • Set decor, wardrobe, etc.
  • Pay for cast and crew
  • Insurance
  • Post-production efforts (editing, music licensing, visual effects)
  • Marketing efforts

We believe our budget goal will allow us to make the most special film we can - One that will  bring world wide attention to the military working dog community - One that will make way for a feature film - and one that will win awards!

What You Get

Our perk packages are mainly focused on providing our backers with Walking Point memorabilia, movie credits, and social media recognition.   There are also perks available for those that seek to be a bit more involved in the project like producer credits and VIP passes to a Private Screening event.  We even have opportunities for corporate sponsors that include product placement in the film!   Those that donate at the Producer level and above will have the opportunity to spend a few hours on set and watch the filming process!   If you have inquiries about donation amounts not listed, collaboration, or providing services in lieu of a donation, please contact us.  We would love to hear from you!

The Impact

Your contributions will help bring to the silver screen the noble actions of the WWII military working dogs, our soldiers, and the undying patriotism of those families that donated their beloved canine companions to the Armed Forces.   This is a film that doesn't shy away from faith, family, or patriotism.  In fact, the film focuses on these core values and our hope is that those values shine through for the world to see.  

During the liberation of Guam, 25 military working dogs died in combat.  Their bodies were buried on the island in a small cemetery.  These dogs saved many lives and help free the island of Guam and the Chamorro natives from the clutches of the Japanese Empire.   The acclaimed sculptor, Susan Bahary (who also wrote the foreword for Walking Point) commissioned the first Military Working Dog Memorial in honor of these heroic canines.  Her masterpiece still remains on the island today. 

After Susan read the first four manuscript chapters she remarked, "I read the manuscript today and loved it. It made me cry a few times already! I appreciated its sensitivity and way of teaching a bit of this important history. A story like this brings back some of the treasured ideals of our country and our patriotism. It brings to mind life's simple pleasures and the hard work of everyday people who we can all thank for our freedom and the country we enjoy today."

Your contributions will help younger generations gain a better appreciation of our past history.  

Susan Bahary's Always Faithful Memorial in Guam

War Dog Cemetery on Guam

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't help financially.  We still love you!  You can help us out by spreading the word, sharing this page, sharing the Walking Point Facebook page, following our Instagram @Walkingpointthemovie and using #Walkingpoint in you social media posts......thanking a veteran, flying the American Flag, and just being a patriotic American!  God bless and thanks for your support!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
RJ Nevens, Jr. is a multi-award winning screenwriter, director, and producer with over 30 awards to date including  feature films , documentaries , and shorts.   He and his wife, Chelsea, run Black 17 Productions.  WALKING POINT IS HIS PASSION PROJECT.  He wrote the feature screenplay in 2014.  It has achieved accolades around the globe.  He followed it up by adapting it into a novel a few years later.   To date, RJ has donated nearly all the proceeds from the sale of the book to various military working dog or police K9 charities.   His love for dogs, particularly the Doberman breed, has been part of his inspiration behind Walking Point.  This project is about bringing the story of The Greatest Generation and the dedication and sacrifices made, not only by soldiers during WWII, but also by the many families that donated their beloved best friends to the Armed Forces.   Black 17 has partnered with the National Museum of the Pacific War  with the common goal of bringing Walking Point to life.   
 

 

 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
WALKING POINT CAST

 
SCREENPLAY AWARDS FOR WALKING POINT

 
RJ with Lexie Belle Starr at the MWD National Monument at Lackland AFB
  
By contributing to this short film, you will help pave the way to bringing the story to life and forever memorialize our four legged companions, our soldiers, and their heroic deeds and sacrifices.   We can do this with your help!  
 
You can also join the thousands of Walking Point followers and see the history and the project updates on Facebook via this link: https://www.facebook.com/WalkingPointTheMovie/ 
We will be forever grateful for any amount of donation!  

What We Need
Making a historical war drama is costly.   Our budget includes costs for the following:

Camera, lighting, and grip equipment
War re-enactment facilities (National Museum of the Pacific War)
Other location rentals
Onsite catering
Housing of cast and crew (including our lovable animal actors!)
Set decor, wardrobe, etc.
Pay for cast and crew
Insurance
Post-production efforts (editing, music licensing, visual effects)
Marketing efforts

We believe our budget goal will allow us to make the most special film we can - One that will  bring world wide attention to the military working dog community - One that will make way for a feature film - and one that will win awards!
What You Get
Our perk packages are mainly focused on providing our backers with Walking Point memorabilia, movie credits, and social media recognition.   There are also perks available for those that seek to be a bit more involved in the project like producer credits and VIP passes to a Private Screening event.  We even have opportunities for corporate sponsors that include product placement in the film!   Those that donate at the Producer level and above will have the opportunity to spend a few hours on set and watch the filming process!   If you have inquiries about donation amounts not listed, collaboration, or providing services in lieu of a donation, please contact us.  We would love to hear from you!

The Impact
Your contributions will help bring to the silver screen the noble actions of the WWII military working dogs, our soldiers, and the undying patriotism of those families that donated their beloved canine companions to the Armed Forces.   This is a film that doesn't shy away from faith, family, or patriotism.  In fact, the film focuses on these core values and our hope is that those values shine through for the world to see.  
During the liberation of Guam, 25 military working dogs died in combat.  Their bodies were buried on the island in a small cemetery.  These dogs saved many lives and help free the island of Guam and the Chamorro natives from the clutches of the Japanese Empire.   The acclaimed sculptor, Susan Bahary (who also wrote the foreword for Walking Point) commissioned the first Military Working Dog Memorial in honor of these heroic canines.  Her masterpiece still remains on the island today. 
After Susan read the first four manuscript chapters she remarked, "I read the manuscript today and loved it. It made me cry a few times already! I appreciated its sensitivity and way of teaching a bit of this important history. A story like this brings back some of the treasured ideals of our country and our patriotism. It brings to mind life's simple pleasures and the hard work of everyday people who we can all thank for our freedom and the country we enjoy today."
Your contributions will help younger generations gain a better appreciation of our past history.  
Susan Bahary's Always Faithful Memorial in Guam

War Dog Cemetery on Guam

 

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if you can't help financially.  We still love you!  You can help us out by spreading the word, sharing this page, sharing the Walking Point Facebook page, following our Instagram @Walkingpointthemovie and using #Walkingpoint in you social media posts......thanking a veteran, flying the American Flag, and just being a patriotic American!  God bless and thanks for your support!!!

story:
About the Creators:

Anna Rose is a contemporary dancer, choreographer, and singer, hailing from the Shawangunk mountains of New York.  She received her early dance training in a variety of classical, folk, and percussive dance forms, and has performed and taught extensively at festivals and venues across the U.S. with The Vanaver Caravan dance company.  In 2016, Rose graduated with her BFA in dance from NYU Tisch School of the Arts where she choreographed, presented, and performed numerous works.  Rose is currently based in Berlin, where she freelances as a dancer and choreographer, and has had the pleasure of enriching her own practice through continued study and exchange with a variety of international dance artists and companies.

Katie Sadler is a documentary, narrative, and short-form storyteller who graduated from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts in 2017. With a BFA in film & television production and a minor in dance, she practices multiple artistic disciplines and combines them in any way that she can. Sadler has worked with companies including Columbia Records, Red Bull, MacGuffin Films, PBS, Nylon, NBC and is now working as a producer at Buzzfeed. While directing documentaries and music videos is her main passion, Katie also edits, produces, and shoots a variety of projects and is a lover of all forms of storytelling.

Why we are asking for your help/ A note from the creators:

In Between is a passion project, and the first independent artistic endeavor undertaken by the two of us after graduating from University.  We are interested in exploring different methods of storytelling, and the unique possibilities to do this that can be found by way of fusing film and dance.  Venturing into these waters, we hope to bring the two art forms into conversation in a way that is fresh, and provides a new type of viewing experience for our audience.

Out of sheer determination to bring this work to fruition, we have managed to cover all production costs thus far out-of-pocket, and are essentially aiming to break even by the end of the project.  Coming out of this without financial loss will mean that we are both able to continue creating and investing in future projects.

It is incredibly important to us that we are able to properly compensate the other artists who have been involved, and so a very significant portion of funds raised will be allocated to this.

Your help means the world to us, and no donation or amount of help is too small!   We are incredibly grateful for all forms of support, whether what you are able to offer is a financial contribution or a share.

Thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign, and we really hope you'll consider lending your support!

With gratitude,

Anna and Katie

 

Where will the money go?

The money raised will be allocated to the following areas:

  • Artist Fees for the Dancers, Film and Sound Artists, and all other Artists and Technicians involved.

Production Costs:

  • Liability Insurance
  • Film Equipment Rental
  • Venue Rental
  • Transportation
  • Post Production/ Editing
  • Festival Submission Fees

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS NOW MOVED TO GO FUND ME.

Join the Tulsi Community with us and become a part of the filmmaking process! The initial $27,000 goal for this campaign will pay for script and film development (see below). If we can reach our stretch goal of $54,000 we’ll be able to start filming in India, Europe and the USA. 

​Your perks, in the right-hand column, are categorised under the 8 names of Tulsi: Tulasi, Puspasara, Vrinda, Vrindavani, Nandini, Krishna-Jivani, Visvapujita, Visvapavani.

We’d like to hear about your experiences with Tulsi and to see pictures of your Tulsi plants. Please reach out to us anytime.

 

THE FILM

Tulsi, Queen of Herbs draws us deep into a relationship with the green world, where plant beings are not metaphors, they are a daily reality. In rural India, Tulsi has lived and worked with the earth, animals and people since the beginning of time. 

Who is this extraordinary being? Tulsi has enjoyed many lives, travelling from the ancient realms of the gods into the plant kingdom. She brings many gifts. As a healer, Tulsi is the supreme herb of Ayurvedic and Indian folk medicine. She heals illnesses from coughs, colds and headaches to malaria and diabetes, heart disease and radiation sickness. As an ecologist she purifies the air and soil. As a virtuous goddess, she was swept up in the power struggles of warring deities. She lived with Krishna in Vrindavan. 

The myths, legends and stories of Tulsi, the Goddess, are full of drama and romance. They give us vital insights on how to take care of ourselves and our planet. Today, in her incarnation as a plant, Tulsi is venturing forth from her native India, inspiring people all over the world to restore the health of individuals, communities, and the planet, by working in partnership with the plants. 

With stunning visuals, Tulsi’s story is told through poetic interpretations of the myths, and through the people with whom she has chosen to work - herbalists, doctors, vets, Ayurveds, farmers, mothers, dancers, priests. The interweaving of myth and lyrical documentary creates a sense of magical realism, affirming our interconnectedness, and transforming our consciousness.

 

MYTHOLOGICAL SCENES 

Novelist and poet, Chitra Divakaruni (Mistress of Spices, The Palace of Illusions), is writing a short story based on the myths and legends of Tulasi Devi, specially for this film. As in her novels, Chitra is weaving history, myth and magic into her story, in such a way as to illuminate their relevance to the present. I am thrilled and honoured to be working with Chitra.

 

DOCUMENTARY SCENES 

Some of the people working with Tulsi are: 

Kailash Singh, a farmer in Uttar Pradesh, who was almost ruined by Monsanto's pesticides and seeds, but is now a thriving organic Tulsi grower. 

Pratabi Bai, a herbalist in Rajasthan who is using Tulsi to treat communities suffering from industrial toxins. 

Dr Narendra Singh, an Ayurvedic doctor who has spent more than 40 years researching the science of Tulsi's phyto-chemical compounds. 

Birbal Bishnoi, a herbalist, lawyer and member of the Rajasthani Bishnoi tribe, whose ancestor Amrita, gave her life to protect the trees. 

Sri Sharma, a Hindu priest, working to reforest the sacred Tulsi groves of Vrindavan, Lakshmikutty and other herbalists from Kerala, Rajasthan and Maharashtra, Usha Swamy, teacher and mother in New Jersey, USA, who daily worships Tulsi in her suburban home. 

David Winston, Vasant Lad, David Frawley, David Crow, Pam Montgomery, Anne McIntyre, Deb Soule, Isla Burgess, Prashanti de Jager and other herbalists and Ayurvedic Practitioners from the USA, Europe and India.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

FILM CREW

Tish Streeten: Producer, Director 

Chitra Divakaruni: Writer   

Abigail Wright: Co-Producer 

Erin Henry:  Associate Producer 

Ashish Maurya: Cinematographer 

Sarah Plant:  Composer 

Sanjeev Sivan: Co-Producer in India 

Deepti Sivan: Co-Producer in India

Stephanie Zetah: Web Designer

 

WHY THIS FILM NOW?

For thousands of years Tulsi has lived in the courtyards of Hindu homes, receiving daily offerings of song, flowers and holy water. In return she purifies the air and gives her leaves for healing. In times past, such partnerships encouraged a reverence for plants, respect for our environment, and good health for people.

Today, cement, cars and computers isolate us from the natural world. Humans are no longer in daily communion with other living species. This separation from nature is at the root of unprecedented levels of suffering and disease for the poorest people.

To address this profound crisis we need to make a quantum leap into a world-view where we see ourselves as part of Nature, not apart from Nature. Tulsi, Queen of Herbs helps us to make that leap. The film draws us into the realm of a remarkable healing plant who captivates us with her story. It gives us a chance to hear the voices of the plants and of those people who haven’t forgotten how to listen to them. 

Through Tulsi’s story, together with the stories of people she has inspired, we come to understand the particular solutions that she offers and the urgent necessity for establishing symbiotic relationships with plants.

As a herbalist who has been working with and inspired by plants for most of my life, I want others to see, to feel and to understand a world in which plants are our ancestors, our friends and our teachers.

 

GOAL AND IMPACT

When I first started to imagine this film, few people in America had even heard of Tulsi, let alone discovered her healing properties. Now, more than fifteen years later, Tulsi can be found in shops, supermarkets and cafes. She is grown on farms and and in most herbalists' homes all across America. Thousands, if not millions, in the USA have felt her healing powers. People are now curious to learn more of Tulsi’s background, her origins and how she can help us heal.

We are finally recognising the devastation our disconnection with Nature has wrought - climate change, pesticide damage, nature deficit disorder, the over-exploitation of the Earth's resources. Too often such recognition brings feelings of fear, of being overwhelmed and paralysed.

Now is the time to offer hope and inspiration, and to remind viewers that we can so easily re-connect and restore healthy relationships with the plants. 

 

TISH’s PERSONAL CONNECTION TO TULSI

I was first introduced to Tulsi in Rajasthan by herbal healers who gave me Tulsi seeds to bring home. This was in the year 2000. I planted them and have had Tulsi growing near me ever since. I have come to know her powers as a medicine, which I’ve made many times from her leaves, flowers and seeds, but she has impacted my life in other ways too.

A year after I first met Tulsi the plant, I adopted my baby daughter from India. Before I even knew of her, the orphanage had named her Tulsi and matched her with me! In her honour, I began to delve into the myths and stories of Tulsi, the Goddess, and into the songs and healing properties of Tulsi, the plant. I began reading and questioning herbalists and Indians about her medicinal, ecological and spiritual properties. I began developing the concept for this film.

 

WHAT WE NEED

For this initial Pre-Production phase, we need $27,000. This will allow Chitra to write the story, and Tish to adapt her story into a screenplay. It will also fund some travel and research, further fundraising, the Indiegogo fees, and the creation of a full web site devoted to the film. If we're careful and lucky we will have some funds left to pay a nominal fee to the crew who have been working so hard to get the film off the ground.

If, with your INCREDIBLE support, we can reach our stretch goal of $54,000 we will be able to begin filming (we’ll send you some sneak previews) as early as next Spring.

 

BUDGET

The total budget for the film, which will take three years to make, is $600,000. With your support of $27,000 (and hopefully $54,000) we can get Tulsi, Queen of Herbs off to a flying start.

Pre-Production & Documentary Production: $108,000 

$27,000 - Script & Film Development, Research, Fundraising, Web Site

$27,000 - Initial Documentary Filming in India, Europe & USA

$27,000 - Transcriptions, Translations, Creation of Sample Trailer

$27,000 - Complete Documentary Filming in India, Europe & USA

Mythological Production for Scripted Scenes with Actors: $200,000

Post-Production & Finishing Costs: $300,000

 

MANY THANKS TO OUR SUPPORT NETWORK

Initial filming in India and subsequent work have been possible due to the support and in-kind services of the following:

  • Jagran Jan Vikas Samiti hosted us at their Guni (traditional healers) gathering in Delhi and introduced us to Pratabi Bai, Birbal Bishnoi and other herbalists.
  •  Prashanti de Jager and the Organic India team hosted us at their Tulsi Mahotsva (festival), introduced us to Tulsi farmer, Kailash Singh, and Tulsi researcher, Dr. Narendra Singh. 
  • Ashish Maurya donated in-kind services as cinematographer, sound recordist, gaffer, translator and more.
  • Abigail Wright and Erin Henry have donated weeks of their time and energy to many producing tasks.
  • NYSCA (New York State Council on the Arts) awarded a grant to composer Sarah Plant to score a sample video of Tulsi, Queen of Herbs.
  • All the generous people and companies who have donated perks (see below).

Donations of $500 or more can be made tax deductible through our nonprofit fiscal sponsor, DER (Documentary Educational Resources). For more information, please email: tish@streeten.net

 

WHY YOU ARE ESSENTIAL 

After this initial Indiegogo campaign, we plan to raise money from grants, foundations, companies as well as from more individuals like you. We’ll put on fund-raising events (involving a Tulsi workshop, a talk, a dinner). This unusual kind of film will mainly be supported by individuals like you who care about plants, people, animals and the planet.

This is not your typical social issue documentary although - of course - it does address urgent social concerns. We want this film to inspire people now and in the future, and to do this we must step outside of convention and reach deep into the creative world. The beauty and the challenge of this film is that it does not fit neatly, or even messily, into any category or box. This makes it much more difficult to get foundation and television grants. Thus, YOU are absolutely VITAL to getting this film made.

 

WHAT YOU GET - PERKS

As you can see, we have divided the Perks into the 8 names of Tulasi:

TULASI - She who has no comparison, she who balances

PUSPASARA - She who is the essence of all flowers 

VRINDA - She who is the goddess of all plants and trees

VRINDAVANI - She who never leaves Vrindavan    

NANDINI - She who gives happiness to everyone

KRISHNA-JIVANI - She who is the life and soul of Krishna

VISVAPUJITA - She whom the whole universe worships

VISVAPAVANI - She who purifies the three worlds

We are really happy to have such good friends and companies who believe in and are supporting the film. These people have donated their Tulsi products, their books, their films and other exciting perks which we are offering as a thank you for your pledge of support. We wholeheartedly support the work of these individuals and companies. Like all of us, they are working with and for the plants, people and planet. If you don’t already know of these people and companies, please check out their web sites (below). We’ll be posting more information on all our sponsors on our Facebook page.

 

RISKS and CHALLENGES

For me, Tish, there are two huge challenges in making this film. These happen also to be what is most exhilarating about the project. The first challenge is the fact that never before has there been a film with a plant as the main character. We are going into unknown and unexplored territory. Will we be able to truly create a sense of magical realism, in which we hear the voice of the plants, in which we have a visceral sense of the unseen? Will we be able to make the invisible  felt and experienced?

The second challenge for me as a long-time documentary filmmaker will be in creating the fiction/mythological scenes. I have never written or worked from a script, I have never directed actors, nor produced all the other elements of a non-documentary film. However, because I will be working with such luminaries like Chitra Divakaruni and veteran Malayalam filmmakers Sanjeev Sivan and all the Sivan filmmaking family, I am looking forward to expanding my horizons.

A last, minor challenge, will be integrating the documentary and mythological scenes during the editing process. As an editor by trade and by love, this too presents a new adventure to be met with all the excitement I feel when travelling to new places and meeting people who offer new perspectives.

 

PRODUCTION SCHEDULE

November 2017 - May 2018: Fundraising, Script & Film Development.​

June - August 2018: Research & Initial Filming in India, USA and UK

September - December 2018: Fundraising, Edit of Trailer

January - March 2019: Documentary Production in India, UK and USA

April - August 2019: Edit Rough Cut & further fundraising.

September - October 2019: Production of Mythological Scenes in India.

November 2019 - May 2020: Edit to fine cut, compose music.

March - July 2020: Fundraising for finishing costs, pick-up filming.

August - October 2020: Sound mix, colour grade, subtitles.

November 2020: Release of Tulsi, Queen of Herbs.

 

OTHER WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE and join the Tulsi Community

We completely understand that not everyone can contribute financially. There are many other ways you can contribute (see below). In doing so you too will become part of the Tulsi community.

  • Share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends, your networks, through e-mails, on Facebook and other social media.

  • Share with us and on our Facebook page your stories about Tulsi, your experiences, your pictures, and especially your dreams, in which Tulsi appears.

  • Plant some Tulsi seeds.

  • Get to know Tulsi - sit with a Tulsi plant and listen, drink Tulsi tea, take a few drops of Tulsi tincture. Each person has their own unique relationship with Tulsi. What is yours?

 

Thanks to all our sponsors.

https://us.organicindia.com

http://www.floracopeia.com

http://www.herbalist-alchemist.com

https://www.banyanbotanicals.com

https://strictlymedicinalseeds.com

https://www.mountainroseherbs.com

http://companionplants.com

http://www.barefootbotanicals.net

http://www.numenfilm.com

https://ourcommonroots.com

https://www.mabfilms.org

http://www.sarahplantmusic.com

http://www.chitradivakaruni.com

https://www.sagemountain.com

http://ashtreepublishing.com

http://www.susunweed.com

https://learningherbs.com

https://avivaromm.com

https://jagranjan.org

 

Pratabi Bai - Herbalist from Rajasthan

 

 

 

 

Usha Swamy offering a Tulsi Vivah puja at her home in New Jersey

Painting by Manish Verma

Deb Soule of Avena Botanicals in Maine gathering Tulsi

Vrinda Devi by Lila Shravani

 

Photo Credits:

Alden Pellet: Melanie and Jeff Carpenter in their fields of Tulsi.

The interweaving of myth and lyrical documentary creates a sense of magical realism, affirming our interconnectedness, and transforming our consciousness. MYTHOLOGICAL SCENES Novelist and poet, Chitra Divakaruni (Mistress of Spices, The Palace of Illusions), is writing a short story based on the myths and legends of Tulasi Devi, specially for this film. As in her novels, Chitra is weaving history, myth and magic into her story, in such a way as to illuminate their relevance to the present. I am thrilled and honoured to be working with Chitra. DOCUMENTARY SCENES Some of the people working with Tulsi are: Kailash Singh, a farmer in Uttar Pradesh, who was almost ruined by Monsanto's pesticides and seeds, but is now a thriving organic Tulsi grower. Pratabi Bai, a herbalist in Rajasthan who is using Tulsi to treat communities suffering from industrial toxins. Dr Narendra Singh, an Ayurvedic doctor who has spent more than 40 years researching the science of Tulsi's phyto-chemical compounds. Birbal Bishnoi, a herbalist, lawyer and member of the Rajasthani Bishnoi tribe, whose ancestor Amrita, gave her life to protect the trees. Sri Sharma, a Hindu priest, working to reforest the sacred Tulsi groves of Vrindavan, Lakshmikutty and other herbalists from Kerala, Rajasthan and Maharashtra, Usha Swamy, teacher and mother in New Jersey, USA, who daily worships Tulsi in her suburban home. David Winston, Vasant Lad, David Frawley, David Crow, Pam Montgomery, Anne McIntyre, Deb Soule, Isla Burgess, Prashanti de Jager and other herbalists and Ayurvedic Practitioners from the USA, Europe and India.       FILM CREWTish Streeten: Producer, Director Chitra Divakaruni: Writer   Abigail Wright: Co-Producer Erin Henry:  Associate Producer Ashish Maurya: Cinematographer Sarah Plant:  Composer Sanjeev Sivan: Co-Producer in India Deepti Sivan: Co-Producer in IndiaStephanie Zetah: Web Designer WHY THIS FILM NOW?For thousands of years Tulsi has lived in the courtyards of Hindu homes, receiving daily offerings of song, flowers and holy water. In return she purifies the air and gives her leaves for healing. In times past, such partnerships encouraged a reverence for plants, respect for our environment, and good health for people.Today, cement, cars and computers isolate us from the natural world. Humans are no longer in daily communion with other living species. This separation from nature is at the root of unprecedented levels of suffering and disease for the poorest people.To address this profound crisis we need to make a quantum leap into a world-view where we see ourselves as part of Nature, not apart from Nature. Tulsi, Queen of Herbs helps us to make that leap. The film draws us into the realm of a remarkable healing plant who captivates us with her story. It gives us a chance to hear the voices of the plants and of those people who haven’t forgotten how to listen to them. Through Tulsi’s story, together with the stories of people she has inspired, we come to understand the particular solutions that she offers and the urgent necessity for establishing symbiotic relationships with plants.As a herbalist who has been working with and inspired by plants for most of my life, I want others to see, to feel and to understand a world in which plants are our ancestors, our friends and our teachers. GOAL AND IMPACTWhen I first started to imagine this film, few people in America had even heard of Tulsi, let alone discovered her healing properties. Now, more than fifteen years later, Tulsi can be found in shops, supermarkets and cafes. She is grown on farms and and in most herbalists' homes all across America. Thousands, if not millions, in the USA have felt her healing powers. People are now curious to learn more of Tulsi’s background, her origins and how she can help us heal.We are finally recognising the devastation our disconnection with Nature has wrought - climate change, pesticide damage, nature deficit disorder, the over-exploitation of the Earth's resources. Too often such recognition brings feelings of fear, of being overwhelmed and paralysed.Now is the time to offer hope and inspiration, and to remind viewers that we can so easily re-connect and restore healthy relationships with the plants.  TISH’s PERSONAL CONNECTION TO TULSII was first introduced to Tulsi in Rajasthan by herbal healers who gave me Tulsi seeds to bring home. This was in the year 2000. I planted them and have had Tulsi growing near me ever since. I have come to know her powers as a medicine, which I’ve made many times from her leaves, flowers and seeds, but she has impacted my life in other ways too.A year after I first met Tulsi the plant, I adopted my baby daughter from India. Before I even knew of her, the orphanage had named her Tulsi and matched her with me! In her honour, I began to delve into the myths and stories of Tulsi, the Goddess, and into the songs and healing properties of Tulsi, the plant. I began reading and questioning herbalists and Indians about her medicinal, ecological and spiritual properties. I began developing the concept for this film. WHAT WE NEEDFor this initial Pre-Production phase, we need $27,000. This will allow Chitra to write the story, and Tish to adapt her story into a screenplay. It will also fund some travel and research, further fundraising, the Indiegogo fees, and the creation of a full web site devoted to the film. If we're careful and lucky we will have some funds left to pay a nominal fee to the crew who have been working so hard to get the film off the ground.If, with your INCREDIBLE support, we can reach our stretch goal of $54,000 we will be able to begin filming (we’ll send you some sneak previews) as early as next Spring. BUDGETThe total budget for the film, which will take three years to make, is $600,000. With your support of $27,000 (and hopefully $54,000) we can get Tulsi, Queen of Herbs off to a flying start.Pre-Production & Documentary Production: $108,000 $27,000 - Script & Film Development, Research, Fundraising, Web Site$27,000 - Initial Documentary Filming in India, Europe & USA$27,000 - Transcriptions, Translations, Creation of Sample Trailer$27,000 - Complete Documentary Filming in India, Europe & USAMythological Production for Scripted Scenes with Actors: $200,000Post-Production & Finishing Costs: $300,000 MANY THANKS TO OUR SUPPORT NETWORKInitial filming in India and subsequent work have been possible due to the support and in-kind services of the following:

Jagran Jan Vikas Samiti hosted us at their Guni (traditional healers) gathering in Delhi and introduced us to Pratabi Bai, Birbal Bishnoi and other herbalists.
 Prashanti de Jager and the Organic India team hosted us at their Tulsi Mahotsva (festival), introduced us to Tulsi farmer, Kailash Singh, and Tulsi researcher, Dr. Narendra Singh. 

Ashish Maurya donated in-kind services as cinematographer, sound recordist, gaffer, translator and more.

Abigail Wright and Erin Henry have donated weeks of their time and energy to many producing tasks.

NYSCA (New York State Council on the Arts) awarded a grant to composer Sarah Plant to score a sample video of Tulsi, Queen of Herbs.
All the generous people and companies who have donated perks (see below).
Donations of $500 or more can be made tax deductible through our nonprofit fiscal sponsor, DER (Documentary Educational Resources). For more information, please email: tish@streeten.net WHY YOU ARE ESSENTIAL After this initial Indiegogo campaign, we plan to raise money from grants, foundations, companies as well as from more individuals like you. We’ll put on fund-raising events (involving a Tulsi workshop, a talk, a dinner). This unusual kind of film will mainly be supported by individuals like you who care about plants, people, animals and the planet.This is not your typical social issue documentary although - of course - it does address urgent social concerns. We want this film to inspire people now and in the future, and to do this we must step outside of convention and reach deep into the creative world. The beauty and the challenge of this film is that it does not fit neatly, or even messily, into any category or box. This makes it much more difficult to get foundation and television grants. Thus, YOU are absolutely VITAL to getting this film made. WHAT YOU GET - PERKSAs you can see, we have divided the Perks into the 8 names of Tulasi:TULASI - She who has no comparison, she who balancesPUSPASARA - She who is the essence of all flowers VRINDA - She who is the goddess of all plants and treesVRINDAVANI - She who never leaves Vrindavan    NANDINI - She who gives happiness to everyoneKRISHNA-JIVANI - She who is the life and soul of KrishnaVISVAPUJITA - She whom the whole universe worshipsVISVAPAVANI - She who purifies the three worldsWe are really happy to have such good friends and companies who believe in and are supporting the film. These people have donated their Tulsi products, their books, their films and other exciting perks which we are offering as a thank you for your pledge of support. We wholeheartedly support the work of these individuals and companies. Like all of us, they are working with and for the plants, people and planet. If you don’t already know of these people and companies, please check out their web sites (below). We’ll be posting more information on all our sponsors on our Facebook page. RISKS and CHALLENGESFor me, Tish, there are two huge challenges in making this film. These happen also to be what is most exhilarating about the project. The first challenge is the fact that never before has there been a film with a plant as the main character. We are going into unknown and unexplored territory. Will we be able to truly create a sense of magical realism, in which we hear the voice of the plants, in which we have a visceral sense of the unseen? Will we be able to make the invisible  felt and experienced?The second challenge for me as a long-time documentary filmmaker will be in creating the fiction/mythological scenes. I have never written or worked from a script, I have never directed actors, nor produced all the other elements of a non-documentary film. However, because I will be working with such luminaries like Chitra Divakaruni and veteran Malayalam filmmakers Sanjeev Sivan and all the Sivan filmmaking family, I am looking forward to expanding my horizons.A last, minor challenge, will be integrating the documentary and mythological scenes during the editing process. As an editor by trade and by love, this too presents a new adventure to be met with all the excitement I feel when travelling to new places and meeting people who offer new perspectives. PRODUCTION SCHEDULENovember 2017 - May 2018: Fundraising, Script & Film Development.​June - August 2018: Research & Initial Filming in India, USA and UKSeptember - December 2018: Fundraising, Edit of TrailerJanuary - March 2019: Documentary Production in India, UK and USAApril - August 2019: Edit Rough Cut & further fundraising.September - October 2019: Production of Mythological Scenes in India.November 2019 - May 2020: Edit to fine cut, compose music.March - July 2020: Fundraising for finishing costs, pick-up filming.August - October 2020: Sound mix, colour grade, subtitles.November 2020: Release of Tulsi, Queen of Herbs. OTHER WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE and join the Tulsi CommunityWe completely understand that not everyone can contribute financially. There are many other ways you can contribute (see below). In doing so you too will become part of the Tulsi community.
Share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends, your networks, through e-mails, on Facebook and other social media.
Share with us and on our Facebook page your stories about Tulsi, your experiences, your pictures, and especially your dreams, in which Tulsi appears.
Plant some Tulsi seeds.
Get to know Tulsi - sit with a Tulsi plant and listen, drink Tulsi tea, take a few drops of Tulsi tincture. Each person has their own unique relationship with Tulsi. What is yours?
 Thanks to all our sponsors.https://us.organicindia.comhttp://www.floracopeia.comhttp://www.herbalist-alchemist.comhttps://www.banyanbotanicals.comhttps://strictlymedicinalseeds.comhttps://www.mountainroseherbs.comhttp://companionplants.comhttp://www.barefootbotanicals.nethttp://www.numenfilm.comhttps://ourcommonroots.comhttps://www.mabfilms.orghttp://www.sarahplantmusic.comhttp://www.chitradivakaruni.comhttps://www.sagemountain.comhttp://ashtreepublishing.comhttp://www.susunweed.comhttps://learningherbs.comhttps://avivaromm.comhttps://jagranjan.org Pratabi Bai - Herbalist from Rajasthan    Usha Swamy offering a Tulsi Vivah puja at her home in New JerseyPainting by Manish VermaDeb Soule of Avena Botanicals in Maine gathering TulsiVrinda Devi by Lila Shravani Photo Credits:Alden Pellet: Melanie and Jeff Carpenter in their fields of Tulsi.

story:
Delt

Delt is an hour-long drama pilot written, produced, and directed by Shane Galante.

It is the story of a schizophrenic brother in a polarizing fraternity on a fictional city college's campus.

It was shot in a style never used before in film or television -- self titled as 'Ghost', every scene is a single continuous shot with an 'invisible' camera operator holding a prosumer camera. Ghost was inspired by Found Footage and Dogme 95 filmmaking, Site-Specific Theatre, as well as the constant change in visual communication across all formats we see on a day-to-day basis.

Indie TV

Delt is an hour-long independent drama pilot that functions as a 'proof of concept' as well as a piece on its own.

A proof of concept is a piece created to show a studio or network what an actual final product of a television show or feature film might look like. Instead of just a script they see the idea, and a filmmaker.

Independent Television is a rapidly growing community where filmmakers are creating content on their own in an attempt to get picked up in an industry that nearly fundamentally changes season by season. 

Post Production

Here is what donated funds would go toward:

  • Private Screening: $600

    • A private screening to be held in NYC to let cast, crew, friends, and family get a first look of the product -- also, seats reserved for industry decision makers.

  • Composer: $300

    • An original score created for the title and end credits of Delt.

  • Branding: $500

    • A customized website and business cards, to come across in the right way when it matters.

  • Marketing: $1000

    • One of the main strategies in getting Delt out there is using social media paid posts to spread the teaser and trailer of Delt.

  • Submissions: $1000

    • Maybe the most important part of the process is submissions. Delt will be submitted to multiple different festivals as both a Pilot and a Feature.

Total: $3400

story:
DGW Films, Inc. is seeking to raise $30,000 to fully fund the production process of "Dying to Be Bootyful." Please read film information below:

Produced by: Gather Williams II and Co-Produced by L.T. Clayton
Written by: Gather Williams II and Directed by: King Hollis

This is a documentary that takes a very revealing behind-the-scenes look into the world of butt enhancements. There has never been a time in our history that the desire to have the perceived "perfect booty" been more prevalent than it is now! Never before seen interviews with women who have received these services and the doctors who perform them. This documentary will also investigate the underground practices of those who offer unsafe services, where, both customer and provider have faced horrific consequences! We interview celebrities and question their influence on this present "booty preoccupation" and the role Hollywood plays in it. We also reveal how millions of dollars are spent each year on everything from booty pads to injections, all in an effort to create "the perfect booty."
