story:
About Me

Safiyah Chiniere Smith is a self-proclaimed director and writer. Born November 8, 1991 and originally from Virginia Beach, VA, where the Chesapeake Bay meets the Atlantic Ocean, Smith moved to New York to attend The Art Institute of New York City to study fashion design. She was in love with the idea of creating new, innovative clothing looks but while living in the Big Apple, Smith wanted to pick up some sort of hobby, and so she decided to save enough money (from her part-time job at the time) to purchase her first photo/video camera. No one would have ever thought that making this one purchase would change her whole career choice forever.

 

Safiyah went from doing photography work for individual artists, to doing work for well-known designers at New York’s “Fashion Week”. She then started to venture off into making music videos that told a story, but soon realized that she wasn’t satisfied with creating just three-minute “movies” and needed to express her creative juices in a different format. 

The love of film was than born.  

 

Safiyah C. Smith has filmed projects for a number of people. Working on set brought joy to her heart and motivated her to create her own online episodic series. “BROTHERZ", The project did well with great responses from the community.

Safiyah wants to continue her journey as a writer/ director to tell compelling stories in its true form. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

$25K is a lot of money, we know. But this is what we need to complete this amazing story. 

Equipment rental - we plan on filming the documentary with quality equipment so you can see and hear  clearly

Production Team payments - From the Director of Photography to the lighting technicians, from sound engineers .. Everyone needs to be paid for their hard work!

Filming locations - Traveling to different locations with crew 

Craft services - food for shooting days and lots and lots of coffee

Post-production costs - editors, sound designers, and festival entries !

What you Get

Your contribution guarantees a spot in our credits/acknowledgements.

If you contribute $250, your name will be featured in the closing credits of the film as a contributor to this documentary.

If you contribute $1,000, you will You receive you name in the closing credits of the film as a contributor, name in the opening credits as an associate producer

If you contribute over $2,000 or more, you will receive your name in the closing credits as a contributor, name in the opening credits as a co-executive producer, and two free tickets to ABFF 2019

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to help us financially, we would be grateful for your help in a number of forms. You can:

Spread the word about our campaign to folks you think might be interested! Share our link or email your database. Sharing is caring - please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
WHO WE ARE

 

We are a group of student filmmakers, and after three years of study, creating multiple projects, learning invaluable lessons from each project, and perfecting our storytelling, A Nightingale Sang is the culmination of our study and will be presented as our thesis project. We are so grateful for the opportunity to present a story that has been long in the making. Here are a few bios of the core team involved in the project.

 

 

Nicholas Willey--Writer and Director

Nicholas was born and raised in England until he moved to the states in 2015 and began pursuing a degree in film making at John Paul the Great Catholic University. His love for film stems from a busy imagination and the desire to create experiences in which people can receive the full impact of truth. He has written and directed multiple short films, many of them in cooperation with the core team of A Nightingale Sang. This short film is his senior thesis project and represents the culmination of the skills he has been honing over the past three years.

 

Claire Phillips--Head Producer

Claire is a producer, director, screenwriter, fan girl (not necessarily in that order). An Ohio native, Claire ventured to sunny California to pursue filmmaking. Her favorite pastimes include telling Nick and Michael they cannot do something, eating ice cream to de-stress because they do it anyways, pretending her phone isn’t always going off, and binge-watching her favorite shows when she gets three seconds of free time (in that order). She would like to thank her parents, Professor Nathan Scoggins, Jesus, coffee, and all of the wonderful people contributing to this project. None of this would be possible without them, and she’s incredibly grateful for all their support.

 

 

Michael Uyehata--Director of Photography

Michael is a student of cinematography and former home schooled, military BRAT who loves observing and capturing beautiful things. He currently works as a professional grip or gaffer and plans to continue after graduation from film school this year. Among his favorite artists and creative influences are C.S. Lewis, Frank Capra, Gene Roddenberry, and Jordan Cronenweth.

 

Katelyn Slater--Financial Producer

Katelyn is a recent graduate from John Paul the Great Catholic University. She majored in acting, but discovered a love for producing while in school. She has produced and co-produced many short films throughout her time in school, and continues to enjoy collaborating with her friends at the university. She is passionate about storytelling that creates community and engages each audience member. Apart from producing, Katelyn has  worked at North Coast Repertory Theatre and will be acting at Trinity Theatre Company in San Diego this summer.

 

OUR FUNDRAISING GOAL

 

Our fundraising goal with this Indiegogo campaign is $6500. All the money received will be put towards a) Food for cast and crew, b) payment/hotels for actors, c) locations, and d) costumes and set decorations. Because the story partially takes place in 1941, costumes, particularly soldier uniforms, will be a large part of the budget. We plan on renting US Army uniforms. The scene with the soldiers takes place in a dance hall, and that will be the most expensive location to rent and decorate as well. Keeping our cast and crew fed over our four day shoot is also a top priority. We thank everyone in advance for your generosity and help in creating this short film!

 

                                                            OTHER WAYS TO HELP

 

Although important, money is not the only means to help collaborate with us in the making of A Nightingale Sang.  Please like us on Facebook and Instagram, and invite your friends to do the same! We want more than anything to share this story throughout the process of production until the final product, and the likes and shares are invaluable. Thank you all!

 

Facebook Link: https://www.facebook.com/ANightingaleSangShortF...

Instagram Link: https://www.instagram.com/nightingalesangfilm/

story:
The Man and The Hare is a short film being made by a group of year 13 Film and Media Production students at the BRIT School in London. The film follows the story of Chris, a man in his late twenties, who is dealing with grief and goes to a secluded manor to escape it all, however, he finds himself facing the truth more than he would have liked to. The film’s unique qualities are in the ways it explores such a universal experience, through an exaggerated and horrific lens. Exploring the true extent of which loss can distort the human psyche. Having such a heavy topic illustrated by young people brings a real and visceral quality to the film, looking at it from a whole new perspective.   

 

Our Inspiration:

Hereditary is a  tale of family tragedy that curdles into a full-bore nightmare ride through hell. This film translates grief as a moment of extreme vulnerability of the human psyche, which provides the hole form which madness and paranoia may seep in. An idea which forms some of the basic foundation for our plot.

Another similar aspect of Hereditary is the guessing game the movies play with the audience, making us guess if it’s really a demon or some illness we are not aware of. In this same way we play with reality and place the audience in this in-between that complicates our relationship with the protagonist and with the narrative.

 

Dealing with Grief:

The subject of grief is one that a lot of people experience throughout their lives. It's an important and relatable process. Grief comes in five stages: denial, anger, bargaining, depression and acceptance, each stage as vital as the next.The film joins Chris in the stage of bargaining, he has retreated to the manor in an attempt to try and escape the consequences of a death back at home. Throughout the course of the film Chris falls into the next stage which is depression. We believe that this is a relatable topic that will connect with most people. 

 

Where The Money Goes:

All of the crew are experienced in video production in multiple genres and we want to challenge ourselves to take our production value to next level, this cannot be done without a budget. We are aiming to raise at least £2,000 as this will allow us access to facilities that will help bring our films to life. So the most important thing is, where will your hard earned cash be going?

 

Equipment -  We want to make sure the story is done justice be using the best video,audio and lighting equipment we can get.

Actors - We hope to cast semi-professional actors, As this shoot takes place over 4 day we will need to cover travelling cost and also to reward our actors for their hard work.

Props and Costumes - This film in particular relies heavily on costume, makeup and art supplies to bring our story to life and to absorb our audience into this world that we have created.

Showcasing the Film - After all the heavy lifting is done we hope to premiere our film at a London location and share it with as many people as we can, celebrating our hard work.

 

Impact:

The Man And The Hare is valuable project to support as it is a film that displays the delicacy of the human mind. This film is an example of young people pushing themselves to create pieces of work that is meaningful and speaks to their experiences. It is a project that perfectly encapsulates the beauty and the universality of film as an art to tell stories with the aim of making what is personal universal. Supporting this project  means supporting the future of British cinema, helping to provide a voice and platform for young people to tell their own stories.

 

Challenges:

As with anything worth perusing there is always a risk element. This film is one of the biggest productions that many of us have ever worked on. Overall we acknowledged that the best way to avoid problems is prevention. That is why we have broken our script down to it's bare bone to ensure that each element can be done. Another method we intend to use are test shoots. These will allow is to identify further practical issues that may occur and to rectify them before they become a problem.

No Money? No Worry:

Apart from money there are other ways you could help us to make this film the best it can be. The most important being spreading the word. We all know the power of social media and so it makes sense to use it to our advantage. Share the news on every  social media site wither that be Instagram, Facebook or Twitter. Follow our Instagram and keep up with the development of the film. Let's generate a buzz around 'The Man And The Hare'.

 

Production Timeline:

With the first draft of the script completed early July we are now going in to more intense pre-production. We have been having script workshops, promotional shoots and meetings about where the film is headed. All of this is very exciting and motivating us to make the best productions we can.

 

With a break we summer we aim to go into full pre-production in September and shoot the film at the end of the month over the course of four days. Prior to production we will ensure we have planned every last aspect of the film, everything from the sound and shots we want to the designing and creation of all visual effects and props.

 

We will then spend a couple of weeks perfecting the rough edits put together on set during filming. Our expected delivery is in November 2018. This will be delivered in the form of a premiere at a London based cinema.

 

Meet (some of) the Crew:

story:
SYNOPSIS:

In a ravaged future-Australia, a solitary hermit guarding a priceless treasure is forced to offer sanctuary to a young girl who is fleeing murderous scavengers. With danger around every corner, can they learn to survive together?

 

BACKGROUND:

Hello, and thanks so much for taking the time to visit our campaign! 

Brolga is an atmospheric, emotional and thought-provoking post-apocalyptic science fiction story, and an examination of the role and power of stories in our lives and in our world. It is also a love letter to Indigenous Australian culture and storytelling in their many varied forms, and features breathtaking paintings from Indigenous artist Michael Connolly (Munda-gutta Kulliwari) of Dreamtime Kullilla Art.

 

 

With initial photography commencing all the way back in 2011 in Australia, further shooting and VFX work that has spanned the decade, additional 2018 photography in the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone in Ukraine and final pickups wrapping in May of 2019, Brolga represents an eight year adventure for Writer/Director/Editor Adrian Powers (Forbidden Ground), stars James Saunders and Tiarne Coupland (Back of the Net), producer J.J. Todd, composer Matt Rudduck (Rough Stuff) and the entire cast and crew. 

 

 

Paid for out-of-pocket so far, Brolga has been painstakingly put together out of love, and we couldn’t be more delighted that we have secured our Australian Premiere at the Opening Night of the Sci-Fi Film Festival, to be held at the Event Cinemas George St multiplex, Sydney on Friday, September 6! The film will then screen in festivals across the world before being released online.

Now that the end is in sight, additional funds are needed to give the film the sound, music and colour treatment it deserves. We have secured a team of top-tier, international professionals at Fox Studios, Australia to handle the work, and the results will be worth every cent. We are using a flexible campaign to ensure that all contributions will be processed and go towards the post-production. Please consider helping us finally bring this film to the screen!

 

 

FUNDING BREAKDOWN:

We need $20,000 AUD to complete the project. These are the elements needed to finish the film:

TOTAL: $20,000

  • Sound Design + Mix: $12,500

  • Music + Mix: $2,000

  • Colour Grade: $5,000

  • DCP: $500

The sound design and music are essential to bring the film to life, as is the colour grade (which gives the film its look). Finally, the DCP is the file format in which movies are screened on cinema projectors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to make a contribution, thanks for your time all the same! Please consider sharing this campaign to help us get the word out.

From everyone on the Brolga team, thanks so much for stopping by!

 

External Links

vimeo.com/adrianpowers

imdb.me/adrianpowers

adrianpowers.com

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of student filmmakers from Vancouver Film School who are looking to make their first short film. We have the pleasure of working with a wonderful writer, Eduardo Basile who is a VFS alumni. He has worked hard to create a wonderful script from concept to final draft, and with a title like that, how can anyone resist?

Beyond the catchy title and punchy characters the Biannual Meeting of the Owners of the World (BMOW as we have come to nickname it) holds an important message about the institutions that control our world and the power it gives the people in charge of them. It's a sci-fi politcal satire, think Dr. Strangelove meets Star Trek. 

BMOW has something for everyone, with a strong female lead, important social-political commentary and some very interesting characters, its a meeting worth attending. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are excited about this project not only for the important message it provides but because it provides us, as students, with a lot of creative challenges. One of the biggest has been the character design as we are creating unique and individual aliens. Not only has this taken time from our creative team but we've also brought on four incredible make-up artists to help shape our vision and bring it to life. Make-up however is expensive, especially when you want exciting wigs and prosthetics to create "realistic" aliens. Much of the money raised will go towards the creation of these alien figures, but don't worry we want you to be part of this process, which is why you can receive the concept work done by the make-up artists showing the character's progression from script to film.

Another expensive element is our set build. This is a story like no other, therefore it can't take place just anywhere. We will be creating a futuristic octagon room  as the octagon has been seen as representing infinity and the coming together of the circle and square. The circle represents the heavens, while the square represents the earth, making the octagon the transitional place of the two. This fits with our story as Dawn represents the earth and must meet with creatures from above to come together to make decisions in this isolated space. While this set will add immensely to a story that mostly occurs in one room, it will require time and money. That's where you come in, and if you really want to be special you can be one of the portraits in the hall of relics. 

The Impact

Our short film is a satirical look on the real powers who control our world and we really believe in it. So we are asking you to believe in it too, but more than just believing in the project, we are asking you to believe in us. Yes, your money will help get the short made, but more than that you are investing in our futures. We will use this short as part of our demo reels to prove to other investors in the future that we are worthy of their time and money. 

Help make the Biannual Meeting of the Owners of the World and shape our future as filmmakers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't everything, other ways you can help support our project is by sharing it with others!

story:
About Tom Weidlinger

I am a documentary filmmaker whose subjects include World War I, Czechoslovakia following the Velvet Revolution, the life of Native American athlete Jim Thorpe, and the dilemma of humanitarian aid in the Congo. Twenty-five films I wrote, produced, and directed have aired nationally on U.S. public television.

Reviews at https://www.moiraproductions.com/.

I received honors at international film festivals and was awarded the William Benton Fellowship in Broadcast Journalism at the University of Chicago.

 

The Film’s Story

After a lifetime of filmmaking, The Restless Hungarian is my most personal and important work.  It is about my father, Paul Weidlinger.  He was an architect and one of the most innovative structural engineers of the 20th century. As a young man he apprenticed to pioneers in the Modernist movement. In 1939 he fled the Holocaust, emigrating to Bolivia where he made and lost a fortune.   Coming to the United States in 1943, he built churches, museums and skyscrapers with the great architects of the mid-20th century.

My father’s story is marked by startling paradoxes. The idealistic teenager who was arrested as a communist in Hungary in the 1930s built nuclear missile silos for the U.S. Air Force during the Cold War. For fifty years he hid his identity as a Jew.

When I embarked on this project it was not to pay tribute to him, but to discover what I could not understand as a child. Tracing the unacknowledged pieces of his identity, I have visited and cleaned the graves of my ancestors in Hungary, and learned what happened to my family during the Holocaust. I have spoken with relatives I never knew existed.  I learned truths that are common to many Central European Jews who left home and made their mark upon the world: a fearful denial of origins, guilt over the fate of family, a certain restlessness, brilliant achievement and tragedy.

Visit https://restlesshungarian.com/ for blog videos, photographs, and essays about the making of The Restless Hungarian

 

What this Campaign Supports

Your contribution will pay for the shooting of twenty-five scenes to be filmed with actors in Hungary.  They are evocative vignettes based on letters, journals, and an interview I did with Paul late in his life.  Portraying his childhood as well as my own, they complete the production.  They tie together archive film, photographs, interviews, and location footage already acquired for the film. 

My Hungarian producer has put together a highly talented team in Budapest.  I am very fortunate to be working with them.   A cast of sixteen actors (children and adults) and a production crew of twenty will be working for nine, twelve-hour days, to produce the vignettes.  Everyone has committed to work for below-scale wages to support The Restless Hungarian, a universal story of an immigrant told by his son. The budget is $82,000. The Hungarian Government Film Fund, in recognition of the film’s cultural relevance, will pay a rebate of $24,000, resulting in a net cost of $58,000.  

 

Donor Gifts

I am asking supporters to contribute $35,000.  Gifts include:

—The Restless Hungarian film—streaming access—when it is completed.

—A sheet of 25 Restless Hungarian stamps made by Burning Man artist James Cline

—A signed copy of my book, The Restless Hungarian, Madness, Modernism, and The American Dream

—A T-shirt with the words:  May Truth and Love Prevail Over Lies and Hatred.  This quote is from Václav Havel, the leader of the 1989 Velvet Revolution in Czechoslovakia

—A Restless Hungarian T-shirt with Paul Weidlinger’s self-portrait, circa 1936

—A set of four of my award winning documentary films

—An invitation to a launch party

—A private creative consultation with the filmmaker

—A range of screen credits and gift packages for donors, key supporters, and major donors.

—A day of sailing on San Francisco Bay with the filmmaker.

 

If the $35K Goal is Not Reached  

The shoot will happen.  I am committed to completing the film. After investing years of my time and money, I have taken this project too far not to bring it into the world. I am deeply grateful to those who have already given their support on this journey.

 

The Impact of Your Contribution

Your contribution brings the production of the Restless Hungarian to a tipping point.  Following the shooting of the vignettes I will spend about six months editing the film, weaving together all of the elements.   Several drafts of the film, called rough-cuts, will be honed through the editing process.  Feedback from a panel of veteran filmmakers at work-in-progress screenings will help to guide me in shaping the final cut of the film, estimated to be done by September 2020.

 

Value of The Restless Hungarian in the World

On the deepest and broadest level The Restless Hungarian is for people who are interested in family origins, how culture and history shape the people who are our grandparents, parents and ultimately, ourselves.  Here is what people are saying about the book, from which the film is distilled.

 

[A] story of the visionary upheavals of the 20th century. . . . An immersive and well-told account of a father and his legacy. ―Kirkus Reviews

The Restless Hungarian is a warm, heartfelt family memoir revolving around complicated relationships defined by world events.―Foreword Reviews

The Restless Hungarian is a touching discovery of buried family history. The engaging journey, which seeks out the dormant past, is harrowing and revealing. . . . This is a biography-history book that readers will find entrancing.―Manhattan Book Review, 5/5 stars

Weidlinger’s story of his father’s incredible life is both emotionally and intellectually satisfying. Historically pertinent and deeply personal, it is told with searing candor. It is poignant, tragic, and wise. ―Kati Marton, author of  Wallenberg: The Incredible True Story of the Man Who Saved the Jews of Budapest 

There is a cinematic sweep in the way Weidlinger brings alive the story―and secrets―of his remarkable father. ―Adam Hochschild, author of King Leopold’s Ghost

 A tender and deeply moving memoir, The Restless Hungarian explores the complicated and, at times, mysterious narratives of Paul Weidlinger’s life as they intersect with the currents of twentieth-century history. Engrossing, affecting, and beautifully written, the book offers important insights into the complexities of memory, Jewish identity, loss, intergenerational trauma, and―most essentially―family, that most luminous structure composed of both pain and love.―Nina Pick, Fellow, Yiddish Book Center’s Oral History Project

In excavating the mysterious background of his titanic father, Weidlinger deploys the kind of compressed storytelling he has honed as a documentary filmmaker: deftly intercutting between past and present, revealing tantalizing clues that he follows across continents and epochs, and providing lively context that enriches his family’s saga. It’s a deeply affecting journey. ―Peter L. Stein, executive director (emeritus), San Francisco Jewish Film Festival

 

Risks & Challenges

Every film project presents unique challenges.  The Restless Hungarian is no exception.  I have had to earn the trust of interview subjects, not only in the U.S., but also in Europe and South America.  I have driven thousands of miles crisscrossing the United States.  I  struggled with altitude sickness in Bolivia.  I have written twenty drafts of the Restless Hungarian manuscript as I crafted the vision that will be presented in the film.  There will continue to be challenges as we work towards completion, but I am a veteran of twenty-five films.  I have seen them all through to fruition and distribution, as I will The Restless Hungarian.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Support The Restless Hungarian by spreading the word.  Specifically…

—Write a few words of recommendation in a post on Facebook and be sure to include this proejct’s Indiegogo link.

—Use IndiGogo’s share tools.

—Send a direct email to ten people whom you believe would resonate with the project and encourage them to support it.  Be sure to include the Indiegogo Link.

—Order copies of the book from Amazon and have them sent to friends with an invitation to support the campaign.

—Remember, the campaign only lasts thirty days, so don’t wait.  Time is of the essence.

—If you’ve already read the book or listened to the audio book, write a 5 star review on Amazon or Audible.  

Thank you for your support.

The budget is $82,000. The Hungarian Government Film Fund, in recognition of the film’s cultural relevance, will pay a rebate of $24,000, resulting in a net cost of $58,000.   Donor GiftsI am asking supporters to contribute $35,000.  Gifts include:—The Restless Hungarian film—streaming access—when it is completed.—A sheet of 25 Restless Hungarian stamps made by Burning Man artist James Cline—A signed copy of my book, The Restless Hungarian, Madness, Modernism, and The American Dream—A T-shirt with the words:  May Truth and Love Prevail Over Lies and Hatred.  This quote is from Václav Havel, the leader of the 1989 Velvet Revolution in Czechoslovakia—A Restless Hungarian T-shirt with Paul Weidlinger’s self-portrait, circa 1936—A set of four of my award winning documentary films—An invitation to a launch party—A private creative consultation with the filmmaker—A range of screen credits and gift packages for donors, key supporters, and major donors.—A day of sailing on San Francisco Bay with the filmmaker. If the $35K Goal is Not Reached  
The shoot will happen.  I am committed to completing the film. After investing years of my time and money, I have taken this project too far not to bring it into the world. I am deeply grateful to those who have already given their support on this journey. The Impact of Your ContributionYour contribution brings the production of the Restless Hungarian to a tipping point.  Following the shooting of the vignettes I will spend about six months editing the film, weaving together all of the elements.   Several drafts of the film, called rough-cuts, will be honed through the editing process.  Feedback from a panel of veteran filmmakers at work-in-progress screenings will help to guide me in shaping the final cut of the film, estimated to be done by September 2020. Value of The Restless Hungarian in the WorldOn the deepest and broadest level The Restless Hungarian is for people who are interested in family origins, how culture and history shape the people who are our grandparents, parents and ultimately, ourselves.  Here is what people are saying about the book, from which the film is distilled. [A] story of the visionary upheavals of the 20th century. . . . An immersive and well-told account of a father and his legacy. ―Kirkus ReviewsThe Restless Hungarian is a warm, heartfelt family memoir revolving around complicated relationships defined by world events.―Foreword ReviewsThe Restless Hungarian is a touching discovery of buried family history. The engaging journey, which seeks out the dormant past, is harrowing and revealing. . . . This is a biography-history book that readers will find entrancing.―Manhattan Book Review, 5/5 starsWeidlinger’s story of his father’s incredible life is both emotionally and intellectually satisfying. Historically pertinent and deeply personal, it is told with searing candor. It is poignant, tragic, and wise. ―Kati Marton, author of  Wallenberg: The Incredible True Story of the Man Who Saved the Jews of Budapest There is a cinematic sweep in the way Weidlinger brings alive the story―and secrets―of his remarkable father. ―Adam Hochschild, author of King Leopold’s Ghost A tender and deeply moving memoir, The Restless Hungarian explores the complicated and, at times, mysterious narratives of Paul Weidlinger’s life as they intersect with the currents of twentieth-century history. Engrossing, affecting, and beautifully written, the book offers important insights into the complexities of memory, Jewish identity, loss, intergenerational trauma, and―most essentially―family, that most luminous structure composed of both pain and love.―Nina Pick, Fellow, Yiddish Book Center’s Oral History ProjectIn excavating the mysterious background of his titanic father, Weidlinger deploys the kind of compressed storytelling he has honed as a documentary filmmaker: deftly intercutting between past and present, revealing tantalizing clues that he follows across continents and epochs, and providing lively context that enriches his family’s saga. It’s a deeply affecting journey. ―Peter L. Stein, executive director (emeritus), San Francisco Jewish Film Festival Risks & ChallengesEvery film project presents unique challenges.  The Restless Hungarian is no exception.  I have had to earn the trust of interview subjects, not only in the U.S., but also in Europe and South America.  I have driven thousands of miles crisscrossing the United States.  I  struggled with altitude sickness in Bolivia.  I have written twenty drafts of the Restless Hungarian manuscript as I crafted the vision that will be presented in the film.  There will continue to be challenges as we work towards completion, but I am a veteran of twenty-five films.  I have seen them all through to fruition and distribution, as I will The Restless Hungarian. Other Ways You Can HelpSupport The Restless Hungarian by spreading the word.  Specifically…—Write a few words of recommendation in a post on Facebook and be sure to include this proejct’s Indiegogo link.—Use IndiGogo’s share tools.—Send a direct email to ten people whom you believe would resonate with the project and encourage them to support it.  Be sure to include the Indiegogo Link.—Order copies of the book from Amazon and have them sent to friends with an invitation to support the campaign.—Remember, the campaign only lasts thirty days, so don’t wait.  Time is of the essence.—If you’ve already read the book or listened to the audio book, write a 5 star review on Amazon or Audible.  Thank you for your support.

story:
Hey Horror Fans!

 

We are a mix of people from all different backgrounds that have a passion for creating content. Based in Atlanta, Georgia, we range from people who have spent years doing this to those who have never done anything like this before. Our group is full of fresh ideas and new concepts that we are hoping to showcase with this short horror film.

The key to a successful horror film is to target the current fears and anxieties of those amongst us. In The Devils Room we explore the anxieties surrounding stability and building a home. When we finally get a chance to purchase a home (unheard of for this generation) there may be unforeseen horrors that can push us out. In the Devils Room the horrors are literal. Demonic entities, possession, cult neighbors, you name it. In this short horror, “Get Out” meets “The Grudge” meets “The Exorcist” and you don’t want to miss it.

 

Please Help Us, We’re Poor

 

Horror films are nothing without their creepy sounds and believable makeup. Trust me, have you ever tried to watch a horror film muted? So much easier to watch for those of you terrified of scary movies. With that said, we aim to raise $3000 through this campaign to make sure that our sound and make-up teams are as good as they can get!  

With your help, we will be able to compensate our actors, hire exceptional sound designers and make-up artists, and feed the rumbly tummies of our crew. Because we are an indie production, most of our crew members are doing it for the love, however, the best way to keep a crew happy and productive is to keep them well fed and that’s exactly how we plan to woo them.

We understand that you can’t get something for nothing so we’ve created some awesome perks for our donors including tickets to the first screening, Devils Room merch, social media shoutouts, film credits, and access to behind the scenes footage.

Regardless of what you can contribute, you will be greatly appreciated. Anything helps!

 

Seriously, It Would Mean A Lot

 

Your contribution will not only help us get this film made, but will also open the door for future projects from this great team. We are extremely proud of the film we’re creating and can’t wait to continue make more. Your contribution will be helping a group of young filmmakers with a bunch of ideas to get the ball rolling on our futures.  

 

Let’s Be Real

 

In an effort to be fully transparent, we are a ragtag team ranging in experience from totally green to years in the industry. Those of us who have done this before, are extremely passionate about passing on our knowledge to those who want to receive it. Everyone on this team is keen, ready, and talented. We want to make this happen and we can’t do it without your help!

 

No $$$ No Problem

 

On a tight budget right now? We definitely understand! If you are unable to make a financial contribution you can still help us by giving us a shoutout on social media, sharing our social media and Indiegogo page, and putting in a good word to anyone who might want to get involved. We appreciate any level of contribution!

story:
__________________________________________________________

E C L O S I O N

The Beauty Beneath The Skin

__________________________________________________________

 

__________________________________________________________

WHAT

__________________________________________________________

The Story

A girl who dreams of being seen by the world spends her days in loneliness as she lacks the confidence to truly put herself out there.

With the passing of her 20th birthday, something in her changes. She starts to realize that she is more than what society pegs her as. 

She starts to realize that she does not need to conform to the standards set upon her by the world. She becomes her own person. 

She emerges.

__________________________________________________________

HOW

__________________________________________________________

Merging Waltz with Contemporary Dance, Eclosion will tell its story through the growth of Ann.

Ann lives through music and dance. Her movements are precise but natural. 

Her story will be told through dance as she moves through different stages of realization on her way to becoming what she is meant to be. 

Proud to be herself.

Dance will be used to capture her emotions

Close ups on her eyes will capture her vulnerability

Silk, gauze and bubble wrap will capture her transformation

Wings projected onto her body will capture her eclosion

__________________________________________________________

WHO

__________________________________________________________

Jenny Ni
Director

Coming from a different cultural background, Jenny believes her
vision in film can speak to a diverse group. She enjoys the
process of filmmaking but most importantly the messages conveyed throughout
this art form. She finds it spectacular how one film can change one
person’s perspective. Although it is still under debate whether female
filmmakers are emerging, she wants to be one of the international
female directors in the Canadian film industry.

__________________________________________________________

WHY

__________________________________________________________

"Inspired by ,"破茧成蝶", an old saying in Chinese literature, I
want to redefine the term beauty and critique the illusory world
that we live in. The term means to break the cocoon and turn
into a butterfly. Growing up in China, the society had different
expectations and understandings of beauty for women. We get
judged if we're showing off too much skin when men could be
shirtless. More and more girls choose to do plastic surgery
because they're not as "perfect" as celebrities. Even if your body
looks fit, there still will be people coming at you saying you could
be thinner."

"This story is a reflection of myself.  Whenever
you're asked "How are you?" by one of your friends, most of the
time, you'll give the same response, "I'm doing good". It's
overwhelming that even if some of us are not in a good mood,
we still pretend like everything's fine. I made sure to make myself look the
finest so that people wouldn't judge  me. Even though I wasn't
feeling well, I'd still force myself to smile. But now I know faking
who you are will only lead to losing your identity.
I'm sure I'm not the only one that feels this way and it's hard to
get the words out of our mouths. That's why I chose to use
dancing to tell this story."

- Jenny Ni

story:
Project Summary

First, thank you to everyone involved in the production of this work to date, cast, crew and friends/supporters.  I never would have made it this far without you.  And thank YOU for your interest in making a campaign contribution.

My adolescent dreams of becoming an actor were tanked in part by the psychotic behavior of someone I considered a trusted educator and friend.  These events coupled with awakening to my innate depressive alien nature served to open my eyes in a fascinatingly horrified way to how the human brain wields such incredible potential to love or destroy other human brains.  This is a lot of what my work is concerned with: fear, abuse, betrayal, corruption of power, busted good intentions and nervous crackling laughter.

Some shade of these themes repeat, central and present in every concert I've ever performed, any song I've ever written and any film I've made.  And though I may eventually try my hand at something purely light and joyful, WRETCH is a synthesis of my awareness of the more chaotic and darkly obscure/un-hip life-things, a study of hope, health, superstition, and spirituality.

  • Introduce yourself and your background:

My name is Matthew Dunehoo.  I've written music in bands since Cobainism peaked and have never made a steady income from music, acting or film.  I want to make artwork that makes others feel as thankful as I do when I experience the artwork (albums, films, paintings) made by others that I adore, that resonates big in my heart.  This is all I've ever wanted to accomplish.  I am very grateful for my freedom and fortune to explore playing artist.

  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.

Trying to make a feature film of any value without having gone to film school or logging many more years working in independent film, networking and forging a proper career is plum goofy.  I feel like a poseur and experience a ton of insecurity to the tune of: "If you were really meant to be a filmmaker, you would have gone to film school or you'd be one of those kids who was "always filming everything."  But I've worked very hard to do all this as RIGHT as possible, following a vision, and am unflinching in my intention to share the hard work of my cast and crew with the world in the form of a fierce first feature film.  I cannot afford the costs necessary to finish the job and must appeal to you to help me in this, thank you.

  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

This film would not have been at all possible without the hard work and inspired creative contributions of the many many many people who I was fortunate in discovering, who lent their time, talent and exhaustion in realizing the many visions for the film, from pre-production assistance, planning, feedback, to the logistical campaign of our 19 consecutive day film shoot, and who will continue to play a role in the film as we get it out into the world. 

Contributions to this campaign will help me represent all of their work as well the best parts of what I've been able to manifest, to the world.  I have always tried to be a good arts patron and am humbly looking for it now, big time.

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.

The funds earned through this campaign will go towards all remaining post-production expenses (editing, coloring, sound design, score, licenses, film festival submission fees and travel expenses) needed to finish the film. 

My hope is that WRETCH gets welcomed into film festivals and I am afforded the opportunity to travel to represent the film where it goes as needed.  I will seek international distribution for the work and try best I can to recoup my expenses wherever possible.

I am also working on my next feature film scripts and outlines so that I can pick up immediately wherever WRETCH leaves off, and keep making work, hopefully better, stronger and more informed work.

  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!

Tier 1 - $1 - GRATITUDE - Shout Out on Instagram/Facebook/Inclusion on wretchfilm.com's Hall of Heroes

Tier 2 - $10 - DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF WRETCH Paying it forward at the Tier 2 contribution incentive, once the film is complete you will receive a digital download for your archives.

Tier 3 - $25- ENCELADIC SPELL OF WELLNESS written just for you by an anonymous High Enceladic Prophet, based on your name and favorite color and mailed in an envelope to wherever you exist, plus tier #2 incentive.

Tier 4 - $100 - FILM POSTER PRINT & LIMITED EDITION DVD - A high quality full color print of painter Benjamin Parks' movie poster for the film WRETCH, plus your very own limited edition DVD with original artwork/inserts and digital download (My campaign will reach its goal if I can find 200 individuals willing to support me at the $100 level, how's that for mathematics!!!)

Tier 5 - $1,000- ELK'S PRIDE PICTURES VIDEOGRAPHY SERVICES - Director Matthew Dunehoo will come to you and film and produce a video document of the event of your choice: anniversary party, fashion show, America's Got Talent audition, acting reel, play performance, charity gold tournament, basket weaving seminar, the possibilities are endless.  Filmed, edited and remitted to you in the form of a shareable, post-able, video file and DVD.

Tier 6 - $5,000 - PORTRAIT COMMISSION BY THE PAINTER BENJAMIN PARKS (and ASSOCIATE PRODUCER credit) - Benjamin Parks is one of Kansas City's finest fine artists, his large scale portraits have stunned the art world locally and it is only a matter of time before his work receives international acclaim.  Here is your chance to contribute at tier 6 and have Ben paint either yourself or a loved on, on a large scale 4 x 4 canvas, from a photo of your submission, or if you are in the Kansas City area, Elk's Pride will take the photo that Ben will use to paint from.  This incentive is sure to appreciate over time, and I tremendously appreciate this level of support, at which you will have officially become an associate producer and as such will be listed in all film related media and resources, with your blessing.   Ben Parks, thank you man.

  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The goal represents a combination of those services and resources that still need to be purchased in order to finish the actual film.  I was planning to launch an ALL OR NOTHING campaign but the reality of the situation demands that I position this campaign to be of significant assistance even if I don't reach the main numerical goal.  

ALL funds received absolutely go directly into the effort to finish the film.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.

This work is unsettling in ways that hopefully will inspire you as much as disturb you.

  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).

I am 100% dedicated to my work.  I've produced 5 shorts prior to tackling a feature.  I've traveled to film festivals to support and represent my work and will promote this work, this feature, throughout the world as vigorously as possible. 

  • Make it real for people and build trust.

WRETCH is the first in what I hope will be a series of feature film works, produced here in Kansas City and hopefully if I'm lucky someday elsewhere in the giant world.  I am always looking ahead to new productions and I love being able to interact with the formidable base of talented actors, crew technicians and film artists here in KC.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.

There is a possibility that the film will not find an audience, will not ever recoup any of the expenses, will not be viewed favorably by the majority of the people who do get to experience it, wherever it winds up.  But I believe it has a better chance of finding its place in the world and thriving there.  I do believe that there is an audience for the film out there who will appreciate it.  This is always an innate risk in putting a piece of art in the world.

  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

My planning for these challenges began when I first started formulating the plan and vision for the film.  As early as April of 2016 I was holding get togethers with valued peers who were generous enough of their time to come and listen to me labor aloud through the film's outline, before there was even a script.  I was trying to do the diligence to make sure that the plot held interest, that the characters made sense, that the vision of the film seemed to people who were listening to the general gist of the story, made sense.  "Does this seem like it could be a cool movie to you, if written well?"

Then I spent the time needed, and exercised the discipline needed, I think, to craft a functional screenplay.  I read up on structure guidelines, read other screenplays, and continued to vet versions of the script with anyone who would read and offer feedback.  

It was only when I had a script that I felt had had enough critical feedback and evaluation in my hands, that I was also happy with artistically, that I began pre-production in earnest.  So I was mindful of the challenges from the onset.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you are not able to contribute financially, sharing the campaign is greatly appreciated, thank you.

ALL funds received absolutely go directly into the effort to finish the film.

The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:
Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
This work is unsettling in ways that hopefully will inspire you as much as disturb you.
Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
I am 100% dedicated to my work.  I've produced 5 shorts prior to tackling a feature.  I've traveled to film festivals to support and represent my work and will promote this work, this feature, throughout the world as vigorously as possible. 
Make it real for people and build trust.
WRETCH is the first in what I hope will be a series of feature film works, produced here in Kansas City and hopefully if I'm lucky someday elsewhere in the giant world.  I am always looking ahead to new productions and I love being able to interact with the formidable base of talented actors, crew technicians and film artists here in KC.

Risks & Challenges
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.
Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
There is a possibility that the film will not find an audience, will not ever recoup any of the expenses, will not be viewed favorably by the majority of the people who do get to experience it, wherever it winds up.  But I believe it has a better chance of finding its place in the world and thriving there.  I do believe that there is an audience for the film out there who will appreciate it.  This is always an innate risk in putting a piece of art in the world.
Describe your plan for solving these challenges.
My planning for these challenges began when I first started formulating the plan and vision for the film.  As early as April of 2016 I was holding get togethers with valued peers who were generous enough of their time to come and listen to me labor aloud through the film's outline, before there was even a script.  I was trying to do the diligence to make sure that the plot held interest, that the characters made sense, that the vision of the film seemed to people who were listening to the general gist of the story, made sense.  "Does this seem like it could be a cool movie to you, if written well?"
Then I spent the time needed, and exercised the discipline needed, I think, to craft a functional screenplay.  I read up on structure guidelines, read other screenplays, and continued to vet versions of the script with anyone who would read and offer feedback.  
It was only when I had a script that I felt had had enough critical feedback and evaluation in my hands, that I was also happy with artistically, that I began pre-production in earnest.  So I was mindful of the challenges from the onset.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you are not able to contribute financially, sharing the campaign is greatly appreciated, thank you.

story:
Who am I? Why I'm doing this film?

My name is José Thormann. I was born and raised in Dominican Republic and I'm a 3rd year MFA film student at Rochester Institute of Technology. To finish off my graduate studies, I have the responsibility to make an industry standard short film. I want to create work that will launch my career and help me move into the media and entertainment business world.

After coming with many ideas of films that could be doable, films that would be easier to digest and people can enjoy and feel identified, I arrived at this idea based on a story that my best friend told me, the influence of my Hispanic background and my own views on life.

My premise is that we are all humans, we are all beings and we don’t need language to bond with other humans. Language is something we take for granted. The strings of syllables, sounds and pauses, which all mesh together to form thoughts that can be transferred directly from one person’s cerebral cloud to another, is nothing short of a phenomenon. When face-to-face, we can’t mind-read, but we can mind-speak. But what happens when this ability is lost? Is there something more to us humans than our vocabulary to express our trails of brain dust? Music is an universal language that unites us all and can help us communicate with everyone without the need of words.

WHY I need help ($$_$$)

Film is an amazing way to express an emotion and share a story, and I love to work in this field. I have the crew, and I have the story, but now I need help from you. Film has the unfortunate characteristic of being a really really expensive art form, and this even applies to small short film productions. Already most of the film has been funded by myself, but we still need help to make it all the way. Just a little bit of help will go a long way towards the sorts of things a production needs like:

 

Actors: Arguably the most important gear in a well rendered story, and good actors should be paid.

Food: We'll be working 8-12 hour days every day of production, and so cast and crew needs to be kept fed.

Gear: A lot of the film will be produced at night and outdoors, so we need to make sure our crew can stay mobile and warm, requiring a lot of specialized equipment. 

Props: To really bring the story to life the world should be believable. It's the little details that matter, and details in film are aplenty. 

 

To any and all who contributes or shares, thank you. It means the absolute world to me. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. If you can't donate, that's ok! You can still really help out by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or simply spreading word of mouth.

story:
The Team



Who We Are

As the writer and director of this film, I'm excited to be introducing you to our project and the incredible people who are volunteering their time and talent to create a compelling story that isn't your run-of-the-mill post-apocalyptic survival tale. Some of us are film students and others of us just want to tell unique stories.

After several years of waiting around for the perfect project to land in my lap, as a very new actor, I decided that the only way I was truly going to get the chance to be a part of something that I really loved sooner rather than later was to write my own stories. I'm joined by a passionate team of student filmmakers who have much more experience than I do, so needless to say, I'm fortunate to have them on my side. 

We are all very excited about this film and want to make it something that we can all be proud of. It's a project that I want everyone who is involved to be able to grow in their abilities as well as grow as collaborators. Its important to me that we all learn something new about ourselves during this process. We are investing our time and talent without a promise of anything in return, which is a testament of the great passion each one of us has for this film and for film making in general.

We are relying on the generosity of others to fuel our passion by donating to our campaign. We can't promise a film that everyone will love. We can only promise that our hearts will be completely invested into this project and we will all be growing and learning together to make something awesome.
 

    What We Need & What You Get

    Your contribution will allow us to:

    • Submit the film to local and national film festivals
    • Create a more intricate and compelling story with a higher quality of production (Better equipment, lighting, costumes, sets, make-up, etc)
    • Hire post-production talent including a film score composer, editor, and color grader.
    • Feed ourselves on set - because food is good and we need it on long shoot days!

    You can contribute by selecting a perk that includes a set contribution amount or you can donate any amount you want just because you're crazy and don't want one of our awesome perks.
     

    The Impact

    Ultimately, our plan is to build a solid team of like-minded film makers to continue creating original stories that pull heart strings and dazzle the mind. Your contribution will not only get us through this film, but it could jump-start a new film production venture. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Whether you would like to donate or not, we would most certainly love for you to follow us on Facebook and Instagram! We will be sharing all sorts of fun looks into our entire production.

story:
My name is Emmi Shockley: the writer, director, and lead actor in J-1. I am currently completing my final semester as a Film and Television major at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts. I first stepped onto the independent film scene as a high schooler when I was cast in Michael Tully’s Sundance feature, Ping Pong Summer. After this incredible experience on set and traveling through the festival circuit, I was inspired to start writing and directing. I enrolled at Fordham University as a Visual Arts major, where I wrote and directed a short film entitled We Regret To Inform You for the 2016 Campus MovieFest. The film was selected as a finalist at the international level of this competition, taking us all the way to the 2017 Cannes International Film Festival. Since I landed at NYU, I have worked nonstop on various student productions, most notably writing, directing, and starring in my last short, Don’t Be a Baby. In addition to these student productions, my ongoing position at the female-led independent production company, Invisible Pictures, has propelled my career and further incited my commitment to unexpected stories told through socially conscious filmmaking. While my training and work has shaped me as an artist, my upbringing has shaped me as a person and equipped me to tell a story as unique as J-1. 

    This film is not autobiographical, but it is so deeply personal. Growing up in Ocean City, a place so close-knit and small during the off season yet so international and vibrant in the summers was incredibly formative for me. I worked in the same restaurant, Shenanigans Irish Pub, every summer season from the time I turned fourteen until I was twenty and this restaurant relied heavily on the seasonal workers employed on the J-1 Exchange Visitor Visa. This story is inspired by my own friendships at home and my summers spent working and forming close bonds with J-1ers, some of which remain my close friends today. Their excitement about this project, as well as the support I’ve received from so many people back home, is truly what inspires me to push through every challenge of making this film and make it the absolute best it can be.

    This campaign is raising money for the budget of J-1. Filmmaking is expensive, especially for a college student, and especially when that college student needs to transport a cast and crew of over twenty people from New York City to her hometown in Maryland. Thanks to the generosity of my friends and family in Ocean City, we do not have to pay for accommodations or location fees, but there is still a lot more to be covered. The funds I raise in this campaign will allow me to pay for the hefty costs of transportation and meals for the cast and crew during our shoot, as well as the expenses of equipment rentals, box truck rental, and all art, wardrobe, hair, and makeup department purchases. Shooting in Ocean City is absolutely imperative to the vision of J-1 and integral to the story as well as a dream come true for me. Your contributions will help make that dream a reality. 

    This is not an all-or-nothing campaign, so every part of this goal that we raise will go towards our production. Every contribution, no matter how big or how small, matters so much to me and my team. Even if you aren’t able to financially contribute, sharing this page and spreading the word about our efforts is so valuable too! I thank you for taking the time to learn about J-1, and I hope you’ll come onboard.

story:
Short Summary

 My name is Nick Rosario, I'm a jazz trombonist and composers. For over a decade, I have been living with the awareness of my own anxiety and depression. In the beginning of this time, I found myself believing I was alone in my struggles. Statistically, this is untrue,

According to the Center for Disease Control, “in 2016, 63,632 drug overdose deaths occurred in the United States, the age-adjusted rate of overdose deaths increased significantly by 21.5% from 2015 (16.3 (per 100,000) to 2016 (19.8 per 100,000)” and in that, on average,

Both of these statistics are preventable with the continuous effort to destigmatize and spread awareness of mental health issues. Luckily, with the advent of social media, we now live in a time where we can start to freely discuss mental health without intense fear of scrutiny.

Inspired by this new found open forum, I have written four pieces for Trombone. Saxophone, Piano, Bass and Drums. These pieces are designed to express the feelings associated with anxiety, depression, lashing out against your family and friends who you believe don't understand and challenging yourself to accept your own personal demons. 

In between tracks, I will be speaking with a counselor on each of these subjects to make the concepts more concrete. Thereby allowing the audience member to absorb the information in a more concrete manner.

Art is a great way for someone to express a feeling they have trouble putting into words. This project is an example of a healthier alternative than drug abuse and self harm. The interviews give the audience an opportunity to start conversations they previously found taboo or even slightly uncomfortable. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have already acquired $1000 from grant funding, but this only pays for recording studio time. 

I still need $3500 to pay for filming, editing, distribution, equipment rental and promotion. Not to mention I have some amazing musicians and filmmakers agreeing to work on this and I would like to pay them what they deserve to be paid. 

Perks:

if you donate $10 you get a pre-release digital and physical copy of the music.

$25 will get a copy of the film and cd in advance of the official release.

$50 will get you a copy of the film and cd in advance and I will donate the film to school's health or music department starting with my hometown LA county and spreading to the rest of the country.

Risks & Challenges

Recording will start in early May as this is the best time to book the recording space and when my selected musicians and engineers are most available. The interviews will be filmed a week or two after recording so the counselor can hear a fully mixed version (likely unmastered). This means the project won't be completed in time to submit to any film or music festivals. However, I am aiming for the launch of the film to be on youtube sometime in Fall 2019. It will be released in weekly segments at first in an attempt to create serial intrigue.

This also requires some personal baggage of mine to be made public. I can assure you in the process of making this project a reality, I have found myself to be an 'open book' when it comes to my experiences with mental health.

Lastly, I am not new to recording but I am new to filming. Fortunately, my friend Ethan Fulton is a professional filmmaker and a perfectionist. He's the one who made my idiegogo video and it looks great!

Other Ways You Can Help

The easiest thing to do is spread the word!

Share share share! Discuss, discuss, discuss! 

Something else you can do, if you are comfortable, is contact me with interview questions or any personal experiences you would like addressed in the film. I am but one person with one life, there might be some aspect of anxiety and depression that I don't focus on as much that could be missed. Any and all rapport on the subject is helpful.

story:
Based on a script by Kath Leroy, Dracula's Raven House https://www.imdb.com/title/tt7003818/ is a co-directing project between Stephen Southouse and Jason Croot who have over 250 IMDB credits combined,

They are now ready to take things to the next level at Raven House. This project would not happen without the support and contributions of you indiegogoer's and we thank you in advance, hoping to see you at the premiere.  

We need £23,864 to give the film high production values, this will pay for things like Filming, Food, Equipment hire, locations, insurance, make up, costume, art department, post production, travel and accommodation, for cast and crew and even things light lighting, sound,transport, stunts and editing, plus Blood... lots of Blood.


Meet Co-Director: Jason Croot

Jason Croot's Acting career started back in 2000, Jason moved down to London in 2002 to pursue his acting career, training at the Poor School His early stage performances included Demetrius in Midsummer's Nights Dream, Edmund Tyrone in Long Days Journey into Night, Biff in Death of a Salesman & Jerry in Pinter's Betrayal. Jason’s acting career includes Roles such as Gilles De Rais, in Death of Love Cradle of Filth Jason also appeared alongside Tamzin Outhwaite as Bulgarian Hitman Popov in the ITV production The Fixer (2008)  Jason was Screen Tested for Barry Levinson in the same year. Jason moved in to directing in 2010 his debut Le Fear a comedy horror feature film was filmed in just 3 days and has received some very good film reviews available on [Amazon Video], Croot waited two years to make a Follow up Le Sequel. Croot has directed 20 Films to date.

 

Meet Co-Director Stephen Southouse:

Stephen Southouse started filmmaking in 2002, originally his main passion was photography, but his love for films and great directors such as Alfred Hitchcock, Stanley Kubrick,  Micheal Powell and and Ingmar Bergman inspired Stephen to turn to moving images. Song of King Solomon is considered by many to be his best film (available on Amazon Prime Video), a poetic drama based wholly on the biblical text, He often writes and edits his projects, but this time is working from a script by Kath Leroy.

 

Meet the Writer: Kath Leroy

Kath's artistic journey began at the age of 9 when she began writing her own poems. She started writing stories at the age of 12. Her favourite genre is fantasy but she writes other genres as well. She has acting experience from film, TV, theatre, web series and voice-over.Kath loves acting and likes to take on various roles, especially those challenging to her but she believes that every part can be made into something remarkable. When she is not acting or writing, she dances, sings, works as a photo model, studies foreign languages (French, Russian, German, Spanish), travels, spends time with her friends and family and is exercising or doing sports. She also works as a journalist and is constantly writing screenplays.

Morgan Ziva is helping us  produce the film here is here cool video

 

Meet the Cast: TBC

Casting for the film is in the early stages and with a successful crowdfunding campaign it will bring in well established actors from every continent including the United States, Europe and the rest of the world. Zelica films always welcome new upcoming talent, from the U.K and internationally.

Names attached so far are

Jessica Cameron https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2781723/?ref_=tt_rv_t0 

Nick Mancuso IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0541576/?ref_=tt_rv_t1

Sabrina Culver IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0191747/?ref_=tt_rv_t3

Neb Chupin IMDB:  https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6437695/

Debra Tennant IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5710017/?ref_=nv_sr_2

Tralee Dunn IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm10037741/?ref_=nv_sr_1

Elizabeth Knight IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3015098/?ref_=nv_sr_3

Leah Wright UMDB: https://m.imdb.com/user/ur94707606/?ref_=m_nv_u...

Janette Hutton IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8263134/?ref_=nv_sr_1

 

We are on facebook group come and join us 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/193702598146973/

Like us on facebook

 https://www.facebook.com/pg/Draculas-Raven-Hous...

It would great if you can contribute and help us make this happen, if you can't share our crowdfunding page and facebook pages and youtube videos.

Love DRH team

This project would not happen without the support and contributions of you indiegogoer's and we thank you in advance, hoping to see you at the premiere.  We need £23,864 to give the film high production values, this will pay for things like Filming, Food, Equipment hire, locations, insurance, make up, costume, art department, post production, travel and accommodation, for cast and crew and even things light lighting, sound,transport, stunts and editing, plus Blood... lots of Blood.Meet Co-Director: Jason CrootJason Croot's Acting career started back in 2000, Jason moved down to London in 2002 to pursue his acting career, training at the Poor School His early stage performances included Demetrius in Midsummer's Nights Dream, Edmund Tyrone in Long Days Journey into Night, Biff in Death of a Salesman & Jerry in Pinter's Betrayal. Jason’s acting career includes Roles such as Gilles De Rais, in Death of Love Cradle of Filth Jason also appeared alongside Tamzin Outhwaite as Bulgarian Hitman Popov in the ITV production The Fixer (2008)  Jason was Screen Tested for Barry Levinson in the same year. Jason moved in to directing in 2010 his debut Le Fear a comedy horror feature film was filmed in just 3 days and has received some very good film reviews available on [Amazon Video], Croot waited two years to make a Follow up Le Sequel. Croot has directed 20 Films to date. Meet Co-Director Stephen Southouse:Stephen Southouse started filmmaking in 2002, originally his main passion was photography, but his love for films and great directors such as Alfred Hitchcock, Stanley Kubrick,  Micheal Powell and and Ingmar Bergman inspired Stephen to turn to moving images. Song of King Solomon is considered by many to be his best film (available on Amazon Prime Video), a poetic drama based wholly on the biblical text, He often writes and edits his projects, but this time is working from a script by Kath Leroy. Meet the Writer: Kath LeroyKath's artistic journey began at the age of 9 when she began writing her own poems. She started writing stories at the age of 12. Her favourite genre is fantasy but she writes other genres as well. She has acting experience from film, TV, theatre, web series and voice-over.Kath loves acting and likes to take on various roles, especially those challenging to her but she believes that every part can be made into something remarkable. When she is not acting or writing, she dances, sings, works as a photo model, studies foreign languages (French, Russian, German, Spanish), travels, spends time with her friends and family and is exercising or doing sports. She also works as a journalist and is constantly writing screenplays.Morgan Ziva is helping us  produce the film here is here cool video Meet the Cast: TBCCasting for the film is in the early stages and with a successful crowdfunding campaign it will bring in well established actors from every continent including the United States, Europe and the rest of the world. Zelica films always welcome new upcoming talent, from the U.K and internationally.Names attached so far areJessica Cameron https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2781723/?ref_=tt_rv_t0 Nick Mancuso IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0541576/?ref_=tt_rv_t1Sabrina Culver IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0191747/?ref_=tt_rv_t3Neb Chupin IMDB:  https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6437695/Debra Tennant IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5710017/?ref_=nv_sr_2Tralee Dunn IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm10037741/?ref_=nv_sr_1Elizabeth Knight IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3015098/?ref_=nv_sr_3Leah Wright UMDB: https://m.imdb.com/user/ur94707606/?ref_=m_nv_u...Janette Hutton IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8263134/?ref_=nv_sr_1 We are on facebook group come and join us https://www.facebook.com/groups/193702598146973/Like us on facebook https://www.facebook.com/pg/Draculas-Raven-Hous...It would great if you can contribute and help us make this happen, if you can't share our crowdfunding page and facebook pages and youtube videos.Love DRH team

story:
Music has the power to inspire. No matter the language being spoken, a song that is sung with joy, spreads happiness; a song that is sung with sadness, spreads empathy; a song that is sung with passion, spreads hope. Jay Denton, founder of Endure Studios, is setting out on a mission to bring hope to struggling communities around the world through the power of music. He will be traveling to parts of the globe where there has been conflict, where people have been afflicted by war, terror, and persecution. The first place visited will be Lebanon, a country that has allowed more than 1.2 million Syrian refugees to enter. However, despite this act of kindness by the Lebanese government, the Syrians’ living situations are often bleak at best, and their future is perpetually uncertain.
 

        Jay will partner with refugee musicians and singers to create and professionally produce music, giving them a platform for their art. The songs they make will tell their stories and bring to life the hopes, dreams, loves, and plights of those that have experienced life under much darker circumstances than most people. While Jay may be the instigator, it is these musicians whose stories will be told. When all else fails, hope remains.

 

The Director

Jake Green

 
  • I have directed documentaries in 35+ countries.
  • I have never been more excited about a project than the one you are reading about right now.
  • You are what makes this whole thing work. Without you, I'm just a guy with a dream. I would be honored and humbled to receive your support and partnership in any way that you can give it.

 

The Instigator

Jay Denton

 
  • His skills are innumerable. He is a music producer, a singer/songwriter, a black belt Krav Maga instructor, a marathon runner, a business owner, and has been called "Blonde Rambo" by some who know him.
  • We believe he is the perfect person to take on a project like the one he has set forth and we plan to be there to document the entire thing.
  • We asked each interviewee what Jay's biggest weaknesses are. The worst thing that came out of it was that he can be too focused and passionate. Those really don't sound like weaknesses to us.

Here are Spotify links to some of the songs and albums produced by Jay and ENDURE Studios:

Locked - Album

Call My Own - Single

Fireworks - Single

Summer Again - Single

 

Where the Money Goes

        Jake is no stranger to filming overseas. He has shot documentaries on five continents. He has done so on shoestring budgets and minimal crew. So you can be assured that the money will be going to right places.

        We have four categories of expenses: Gear/Equipment (all film and travel gear), Travel (flights, buses, cars, documents), Living (food, accommodation), and Emergency (medical, insurance). The breakdown is as follows:

  • Gear and Equipment - $3,000 - All film and travel-related supplies that we will need, including cameras, lenses, lights, tripods, etc.
  • Travel - $1,500 - Normally the most expensive thing about traveling abroad, however we were able to book relatively inexpensive flights and rental cars.
  • Living - $3,000 - Accommodation and food are the big ones here, though a portion of this will be used as wages.
  • Emergency - $1,000 - Weird stuff happens. There's always something unexpected that comes out of nowhere on a trip like this. Sometimes it's a good thing, sometimes it's food poisoning. Either way, we want to be prepared with medical supplies and insurance.

        Our budget isn't the only place your money goes. It also goes to some GREAT perks, including Giving Keys, and world rings, as well as posters, IMDb credit, executive producer status, hugs, a trip to the world premiere, and the ever-comforting feeling of putting good out into the world :)

 

The Impact

        I'm not sure this section of the campaign needs an explanation, but we should probably spell it out anyway:

  • Refugees, child soldiers, survivors of genocide, these people have endured unfathomable pain and uncertainty in their lives which most of the rest of the world doesn't know about. Jay will give them a platform to voice their stories, hopes, dreams, and struggles in a way to which everyone can connect. This will not only produce some wonderful music, but give hope and opportunity to these victims.
  • And that's part two of the major goal here, to impact people who do not live in destabilized areas, to help them understand the humanity behind the tragedies that they glance over while reading or watching the news. It's a way to bridge the gap between cultures, religions, and world views.
  • Like Jay, we have a proven track record of delivering products that we promise. Jake has directed dozens of short documentaries from around the world, teaching people how to travel without breaking the bank and what to see, eat, and experience while you're there.
 

Risks & Challenges

        The challenges are many. The whole point of Jay's project is that it is something difficult but important. All of the struggles that Jay will face, we will face as well.

  • Language barriers could provide some issues, however we do have translators lined up for this first trip to Lebanon.
  • Though Lebanon is a relatively safe country, it does border Israel and Syria, which are areas of conflict.
  • Refugee camps have been labeled as unpredictable, but after talking with people who have spent years working in them it has been made clear that they are mostly very peaceful.
  • One of the most challenging aspects will be something that Jay will face alone, conveying the stories of these individuals through music. But that is what you're backing here- to see how this will unfold.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share. Share. Share. Share.

If you can't contribute, light up the bat signal!

  • Documentaries are not the most viewed movies around but they certainly should be! You can help us out tremendously if you just share our campaign through social media and word of mouth.
  • IndieGoGo has it set up perfectly to share through all of your social media accounts! It will take you less than a minute to spread the word about this project. So what are you waiting for? Quit reading! Share!!!

 

Testimonials about Jay Denton
