If you can't contribute, light up the bat signal!

Documentaries are not the most viewed movies around but they certainly should be! You can help us out tremendously if you just share our campaign through social media and word of mouth.
IndieGoGo has it set up perfectly to share through all of your social media accounts! It will take you less than a minute to spread the word about this project. So what are you waiting for? Quit reading! Share!!!

 
Testimonials about Jay Denton

story:
Meet the team.

Stefan Linhares, Writer/Director

When I was in middle school I got this huge book that explained all the special effects that go into movies. Though this was pretty much taking the mystery out of lots of films, it increased my interest in filmmaking because it all seemed so magical and so unbelievable that this was a real thing people did for a career. Now I’m about to start my final year in film school and over the past few years I’ve worked various roles on nearly 20 Film and TV projects. I’ve been lucky enough to have spent the majority of my time at Emerson working on sets, learning from mistakes and meeting talented people. My love for movies has grown immensely, and I still owe it to that book.

Sam Stenson, Producer

I've been making movies with my friends since I was in elementary school, but I didn't know it was something I wanted to do for the rest of my life until I went to the theater to see Guardians of the Galaxy. I was so purely entertained, I laughed and cried, and I realized eventually I wanted to inspire that same feeling in people. I'm so excited that I'm able to pursue that goal every day by working on bringing one-of-a-kind, entertaining projects like Bert Nondorf, Psychic to life. As a producer, I'll be working closely with Stefan every day to do just that, and gain valuable experience and knowledge along the way.

Alice Dettmer, Producer

My two biggest passions are comedy and film, and being able to write and produce comedic films and TV at emerson has been a dream come true. As I enter my junior year, ive worked on a total of over 15 productions that take all shapes and sizes. I love the absolute absurdity that Bert presents and am so thrilled to be a part of the team, helping make this production a reality. The hilarity of the story is absolutely refreshing and the cast and crew are radiant! 

Abigail Karl, Producer

I’m a producer on Bert and I’ve been making films since I was 11. But I didn’t get really into filmmaking until I made a short about Hurricane Sandy’s effect on my town. Making that little movie helped me realize the major emotional impact you can make through film, and I’ve been in love ever since. I’ve worked on two professional sets, the feature Low Tide and the show Impractical Jokers, as well as numerous Emerson student productions, and I can’t wait to get on set for Bert Nondorf! 

Kiril Palaveev, Director of Photography

After brief spells where I dreamed of going to space and driving a garbage truck, I found my passion for film at the movie Hanna. I was so enamored with how you could tell a story with where you put the camera and what you point it at and that fascination pushed me into filmmaking. I’ve been making movies since I was 13 and since arriving at Emerson as a transfer a year ago I’ve spent pretty much every weekend on one set or another. It’s never a boring time, and it’s a different job each week. I love getting to live a new life every time I work and that’s what draws me to film.

Where is the money going?

$6,000? What are they doing with that? Well, your donations are going to help us in a number of critical areas. These include production design - everything from a skunk puppet, stylized costumes, and props to make these character's homes look distinct to their personalities.

This will also cover locations. We want our film to have a small, suburban feel away from the bustle of the city. These characters live in their own world that feels slightly off from the one we live in. We'll be looking for home's that have that classic, lived in 1960's-feel.

Equipment and crew transportation is a big one, since we have several locations to shoot in, many crew members and a whole slew of equipment to lug around. We'll need to rent a truck and use rideshare services to get to and from set.

Next up is food! We can't make a film on an empty stomach, can we? We want to make sure everyone is fed happily and healthily. 

Another expense is festival distribution. We've put in lots of work during pre-production, and we can't wait to give it our all during shooting and post, so sending the final cut off to festivals for others to enjoy our hard work is a priority.

There are more expenses, but these were a few we wanted to highlight.

The Takeaway.

At the core of this project stands a team of students eager to learn the ins and outs of filmmaking from each other. None of us are required to do this and none of us are profiting from it either. We're all here because we believe in creating this project and want to gain experience doing so. The story we're working with is one that Stefan wrote his Sophomore year of college with the help of his friend Max Lichtenstein. They took a news headline involving a skunk and a psychic and let their imagination’s run wild. Now, we're making this unlikely story come to life and hope to entertain and inspire others to create stories of their own!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone has money to give. But that's ok, you can still help us! By sharing this page and spreading the word about the project, you can help us gain traction.

 

Thank you for looking into our project. We hope to gather your support, and we can't wait to share Bert Nondorf, Psychic. with you.

- The Bert Crew

story:
Bakgrund

Ölkulturen i Sverige har växt under de senaste åren och hantverksbryggerier blir allt mer populära. Bryggare experimenterar med färger såväl som smaker för att få fram sin unika öl. Allt fler kvinnor intresserar sig för öl, något som annars alltid varit förknippat med män. Men hur jämställd är branschen idag och hur ser branschen på jämställdhet?

En brittisk undersökning visar att många kvinnor väljer bort öl av rädslan för att bli dömda av andra öldrickare. 2017 startades Facebookgruppen Ölgäris (“gäri” är slang för tjej) av Josefine Törnqvist som ett forum för kvinnor och ickebinära. Där kan de dela ölintresset utan risk att dömas av män. Idag har gruppen över 7000 medlemmar och fortsätter växa. Det ordnas olika tillställningar som seminarier, ölbryggning och ölhäng för medlemmarna. Det är alltså ingen tvekan om att öl intresserar fler än bara män.

 

Om Filmen

Malt, Humle, Jäst & GÄRIS är en dokumentärfilm som kommer visa upp hur det är att vara kvinna mitt i en växande ölkultur. Genom ett samtal mellan tre vänner på en bar behandlar vi frågor om den svenska ölkulturen och jämställdhet. Vilka fördomar möter man som kvinnlig bryggare? Vem riktar sig marknadsföringen till? Görs det överhuvudtaget några satsningar för att få en mer jämställd kultur?

Vi får även följa med kvinnorna, som alla jobbar inom ölindustrin, under deras vardag genom egenfilmat vloggmaterial där vi kommer närmare dem personligt. 

Med denna kombination kommer vi att få se, höra och uppleva hur dessa tre kvinnor brinner för och, på tre individuella sätt, jobbar för en mer jämställd kultur.

 

Vad Vi Behöver

När filmen sedan är klar är vårt mål att nå en stor publik, vilket vi gör genom marknadsföring distribution till filmfestivaler.

För att göra detta behöver vi pengar. Närmare bestämt $900 där 80% går till distribution i form av anmälningsavgifter till filmfestivaler och 20% går till att marknadsföra filmen.

Därför behöver vi din hjälp för att kunna genomföra denna film!

 

Vad Du Får

Vi har flera förmåner, eller perks som de heter här, som du kan få om du bidrar till Malt, Humle, Jäst & GÄRIS!

Förmånerna är:

  • Tack på Sociala Medier
  • Tack Till i Eftertexten
  • Inbjudan till Förhandsvisning och Mingel i Örebro 
  • Exekutiv Producent

 

Påverkan

Malt, Humle, Jäst & GÄRIS är en dokumentär som fokuserar på kvinnor i en mansdominerad industri och kultur. Genom att visa hur kvinnor bryter sig fram i ölbranschen är vår förhoppning att inspirera kvinnor att följa sina drömmar och intressen även om de går emot könsnormer.

 

Andra Sätt Du Kan Bidra

Om du vill stödja Malt, Humle, Jäst & GÄRIS men känner att du inte kan bidra ekonomiskt kan du hjälpa oss enormt mycket genom att följa och dela våra sociala medier! Låt andra höra om filmen och denna Indiegogo-kampanj!

Det ordnas olika tillställningar som seminarier, ölbryggning och ölhäng för medlemmarna. Det är alltså ingen tvekan om att öl intresserar fler än bara män. Om FilmenMalt, Humle, Jäst & GÄRIS är en dokumentärfilm som kommer visa upp hur det är att vara kvinna mitt i en växande ölkultur. Genom ett samtal mellan tre vänner på en bar behandlar vi frågor om den svenska ölkulturen och jämställdhet. Vilka fördomar möter man som kvinnlig bryggare? Vem riktar sig marknadsföringen till? Görs det överhuvudtaget några satsningar för att få en mer jämställd kultur?Vi får även följa med kvinnorna, som alla jobbar inom ölindustrin, under deras vardag genom egenfilmat vloggmaterial där vi kommer närmare dem personligt. Med denna kombination kommer vi att få se, höra och uppleva hur dessa tre kvinnor brinner för och, på tre individuella sätt, jobbar för en mer jämställd kultur. Vad Vi BehöverNär filmen sedan är klar är vårt mål att nå en stor publik, vilket vi gör genom marknadsföring distribution till filmfestivaler.För att göra detta behöver vi pengar. Närmare bestämt $900 där 80% går till distribution i form av anmälningsavgifter till filmfestivaler och 20% går till att marknadsföra filmen.Därför behöver vi din hjälp för att kunna genomföra denna film! Vad Du FårVi har flera förmåner, eller perks som de heter här, som du kan få om du bidrar till Malt, Humle, Jäst & GÄRIS!Förmånerna är:
Tack på Sociala Medier
Tack Till i Eftertexten
Inbjudan till Förhandsvisning och Mingel i Örebro 
Exekutiv Producent
 PåverkanMalt, Humle, Jäst & GÄRIS är en dokumentär som fokuserar på kvinnor i en mansdominerad industri och kultur. Genom att visa hur kvinnor bryter sig fram i ölbranschen är vår förhoppning att inspirera kvinnor att följa sina drömmar och intressen även om de går emot könsnormer. Andra Sätt Du Kan BidraOm du vill stödja Malt, Humle, Jäst & GÄRIS men känner att du inte kan bidra ekonomiskt kan du hjälpa oss enormt mycket genom att följa och dela våra sociala medier! Låt andra höra om filmen och denna Indiegogo-kampanj!

story:
The Story

Rob is a young farmer struggling under the relentless pressures of the Australian drought. Rob and his wife Sophie are both strong characters. As their livelihood is threatened, their relationship begins to suffer. Throughout their struggle Rob always seems to remain positive and constantly tries to support his wife. However the pressure is slowly getting to him and he is left with a choice that no one should have to face.

 

The Crew

WRITER/DIRECTOR

Nathan Colquhoun

Nathan is an award winning director and has nearly 10 years of experience behind the camera. He is the creator of the Web Series Abandoned, which is winning numerous awards around world. Nathan believes in the power of storytelling. He is a passionate and well developed director who will stop at nothing to get his ideas out there.

 

PRODUCER

Matthew Phillips

Matthew is a film producer in Sydney and has been working on award-winning film & web series productions. He is driven by bring authentic humane stories to our screen. He maintains his profession in film and series productions and is a current member of the Aust. Cinematographers Society (ASC) and the Aust. Film Institute (AFI).

 

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Masayoshi Ishii

Masayoshi is an award winning cinematographer and has experience from all around the world. Though born in Japan he now calls Australia home. He is passionate about creating visually dramatic stories that capture audiences from all classes.

 

 

We have also had a great deal of support from Cinematic Motion (Mathew Harwood) & VA hire.

Cinematic Motion is an agile team of creatives, with over 50 years of combined film, photography and piloting experience.Sydney based Aerial and Drone Cinematography｜TVC, Automotive and Film specialists｜Flying the world's best aerial platforms.

 

 

The Cast

LEAD ACTOR

Matt Oxley

Matt is an awarded actor of stage and screen. He has starred in a variety of feature films. His latest credits include Torvald in a Doll’s House at Bondi Pavilion presented by Bard on the Beach and lead actor Robert in the Sci-fi feature Other World. Along with various productions credits he is passionate about the Arts and enjoys creating new and meaningful projects.

 

LEAD ACTRESS

Jacqui Buchanan

Jacqui Buchanan is an experienced actor and model with over ten years in the industry and has played lead roles in television campaigns. She featured as the 'love interest' in Country Music singer, Craig Heath's latest music video, 'How do you do it' and starred in her first lead role in the short film, 'Stranded', directed by Nathan Colquhoun.

 

The Mission 

Mental health is a serious issue and even more so in the rural communities.  The film’s objective is to bring light to the issue of depression and suicide. We will see how the slow build of pressure can leave someone feeling hopeless and with no other option. The film will show that even the most positive people can be suffering on the inside.

It is the creators vision that the film will resonate with audiences to educate society on how mental health effects even our rural family and friends. The team envisage the film will be screened at approved film festivals around the nation, and even reaching out to the broader remote communities to share this purposeful message. 

 

Funding

We have officially wrapped the production of the film but still need funds to get us over the edge in post-production. To create the best version of this story we require to invest in:

- Music: We already have a brilliant composer interested in coming on board however he requires many man hours to create the music that is needed for a film of this caliber. 

- Sound Design/Mixing: We want you to have the best experience when you watch Drought, for that we need your help to ensure the sound is perfectly done.

- Colour Grade: We want the colours in this film to portray the changes of the environment. To go from vibrant and fresh to dull and lifeless.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone wants, or is capable of helping us financially, however that isn't the only way you can help. If you could take the time to share this through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or any of your social media outlets. Word of mouth is always another option, and we appreciate any support of any kind.

story:
Why this film?

Secret Agent Dingledorf and His Trusty Dog Splat is the first in the series of films that we will produce to Entertain and Inspire kids of all ages. 

Entertainment is key to getting kids to watch but we believe in entertainment with a purpose. Secret Agent Dingledorf, like our coming films, utilizes creative storytelling in order to instill the foundational traits of Love, Joy, Peace, Patience, Kindness, Goodness, Faithfulness, Gentleness and Self Control. We believe that these are the building blocks of strong, happy and world changing kids.

Your support of this campaign will help ensure that the quality of this film will allow us to continue creating projects that entertain and speak positively in to the hearts and minds of children.
 

The Film: Secret Agent Dingledorf (Filming Now)

Secret Agent Dingledorf is a riotous non-stop adventure where even a kid can save the world and remind us that while we are all different we all have eternal value and can have an important impact on our world.

  • Bringing this book to the big screen is a BIG task.
  • Additional funding helps our production crew bring this story to life in the best way possible.
  • Our production team is grateful for all of the additional support so we can create a captivating film that competes with box office hits.

 

JOIN us on a film making Journey!

Here's how you can help: 

  • We are hoping to raise an additional $20,000 to add to our film budget.
  • Each contribution gives you a little peek into the world of movie making.
  • All funds raised will go directly to taking the production up a notch, helping us make a film that can compete with other box office hits.

Meet our Executive Producer & Director

Bill Myers - Writer/Executive Producer

As a writer/producer of 40 years Bill’s work has won over 70 national and international awards including three N.Y. Film Festivals and the C.S. Lewis Honor Award. Besides co-creating and writing the original McGEE and ME, Bill has published over 80 children and teen books including such successes as THE INCREDIBLE WORLDS OF WALLY McDOOGLE (2.2 million books), written / directed for Focus on the Family’s ADVENTURES IN ODYSSEY (1,100 stations), and produced, written or directed nearly two dozen films.

 

Billy Dickson - Director

As a member of both the American Society of Cinematographers and the Director’s Guild of America, Billy is a seasoned industry vet of 35 years. He is best known as director and full time cinematographer of the multi-award TV series “Ally McBeal” which earned him 2 Emmy and 4 American Society of Cinematography nominations. The feature film, “Believe”, widely released in December 2016 with Smith Global Media and Sony was written, directed and shot by Billy. "Believe" was named the 2016 Film of the Year by Christian Film Review.

 

Meet our Cast

Zackary Arthur age twelve, has worked in every genre of film and television. He has worked with James Franco, Nicolas Cage, Selma Blair and Liev Schrieber. Zackary made his major motion picture debut as Sam Sullivan in The 5th Wave, starring opposite Chloë Grace Moretz as her little brother. Zackary is featured on the Golden Globe winning Amazon television series Transparent starring Jeffrey Tambor. Coincidentally, he plays Tambour's grandson named Zack Pfefferman, (Amy Landecker and Rob Hubel's son) on the award-winning series. Acting since the age of six, Zackary has learned to master various accents for various projects. Zackary enjoys filming in the U.S.A. as well as Internationally. Recently, Zackary was one of the leading actors in a film that was filmed in Switzerland. He enjoys historical fiction as much as action films. Arthur has dozens of short films and commercials to his credit, including spots for Honda, Best Buy, and voice-over for Build-A-Bear. Zack continues to study acting and has been in acting classes since the beginning of his acting career. Zackary's other talents include; all sports, singing, break dancing, climbing trees, and drawing. He is a voracious reader, enjoys world travel, roller coasters, horseback riding and hiking. The youngest of three children, Arthur lives in Southern California with his family including his singer mom, firefighter dad, and thirteen-year old brother Aiden Arthur, also a working actor. His sister works in advertising and production. Zack aspires to become a filmmaker making films that inspire people to make a difference in the world. 

Cooper Friedman an American actor most famous for his television roles, including Dewey on Girl Meets World, Hudson on Colony and Lucas on Shameless. He made his feature film debut in the 2016 thriller The Thinning.

Shiloh Nelson is an actress, known for Tomorrowland (2015), Annabelle (2014) and Moms' Night Out (2014).

Paul Johansson was born on January 26, 1964 in Spokane, Washington, USA as Paul Joseph Otto Johansson. He is an actor and director, known for One Tree Hill (2003), The Boondock Saints II: All Saints Day (2009) and Atlas Shrugged: Part I (2011). Johansson is frequently cast in Nick Cassavetes films. Paul currently stars in the TV Series, Van Helsing.

Jason Dolley  was born on July 5, 1991 in Los Angeles California. When he turned 11 he landed the lead role in the short film Chasing Daylight (2004) playing a boy who is having to cope with the loss of his best friend. That same year, he was picked up by Mel Gibson who was going to direct a show called Complete Savages(2004) where he starred as the youngest of the five Savage brothers, T.J. In 2006, Jason starred in the direct to video release movie, Saving Shiloh (2006), Disney Channel's original movie, Read It and Weep (2006), and in a small role for The Air I Breathe (2007) as Young Pleasure. In 2007 Jason starred in Disney Channel's  Original series Cory in the House (2007), a spin-off series from Disney Channel's original series That's So Raven (2002), as Newton "Newt" Livingston. From 2010 to 2014 Jason starred in the Disney Channel hit Good Luck Charlie playing the role of PJ Duncan.

Kevin Sizemore was raised in Princeton, WV and studied at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts, CA. On the small screen, Sizemore is known as Anthony, the US Air Marshall on the Emmy nominated series Fear the Walking Dead: Flight 462 (2015), as well as the hot headed Gary Humphrey on the series Resurrection (2014). He's created many memorable characters on shows such as Rizzoli & Isles (2010), Under the Dome (2013), Drop Dead Diva (2009), Weeds (2005) and Coach Jerry Stearns from the movie Woodlawn (2015). Over the years, Kevin has gained a reputation for playing characters with a checkered past.

In 2017, Trew Calling (2017) marked the first feature that he co-produced under GKg Productions. Since then, he has co-produced the action adventure indie film Intensive Care (2018) and the holiday film Believe (2016).

Kevin is married to Gina Lombardi Celebrity Personal Trainer, Author of the Deadline Fitness and TV Host. Their son, actor Gunnar Sizemore is known for his role as Micah Brenner on Nashville (2012) and many voice characters for cartoons.

Tony Snegoff was born in Hollywood, into a family of film makers. His grandfather, father, mother, and brother were, and are in the film business. At seventeen, and just graduating Mammoth Mtn. High School, Tony decided to utilize all his talents, and started training to become a stuntman.

He started training in acrobatics at the world famous "Muscle Beach" in Santa Monica, California. At the same time, also doing stunt training at a gym, run by a well known stunt coordinator. After winning an audition for a TV pilot, about a day in the life of a stuntman, Tony has been working steadily ever since.

After stunt coordinating his first show in 1984, Tony realized that coordinating stunts was even more enjoyable. To add to his repertoire, Tony started manufacturing his own stunt equipment and now owns "Action Equipment International," a stunt equipment manufacturing and rental business. Tony has also worked with the California state fire marshal for five years, coordinating the stunts for special effects seminars that are given to industry people, to help them have a higher rate of safety on the set.

Tommy Primeau is known for his work on Get Smart's Bruce and Lloyd Out of Control(2008), Lasso (2018) and Blood Lake: Attack of the Killer Lampreys (2014).

story:
"Softboy" is a narrative short by Director Elliot Fish and Producer Tristan Kim. Based on the director's own experience as a teen father, the film tells the story of Thomas Reeves, a rebel without a cause seventeen-year-old whose nearly year-long kept secret is finally catching up to him: he is the father of a newborn child as a result of a one night stand. Our story begins with Thomas, his mother, and brother idling outside the girl's family home while Thomas musters the courage to meet his son for the first time. 

100% SCAD.  100% dedicated.

Elliot Fish, Writer/Director: Elliot Fish is a sophomore film student and passionate writer from Toronto, Canada. He hopes Softboy will help facilitate a conversation around teen fatherhood and help those who find themselves in the same situation he found himself in three years ago.

Tristan Kim, Producer: Tristan Kim is a senior film and television student at the Savannah College of Art and Design with a focus in producing and cinematography. After establishing Kimson Productions in 2015, he's had the opportunity to work with dozens of established brands and artists to produce award-winning creative content. Tristan's experience on smaller commercial sets, where it is sometimes necessary to fill numerous roles, has gifted him the ability to work closely with each department and guide every project from start to finish.

Rocco Salerno, Director of Photography: Rocco Salerno is a cinematographer based in Savannah, Georgia. Salerno is currently pursuing a degree in Film and Television in the Savannah College of Art and Design. Originally, from Italy and Colombia Salerno has professional experience in the film industry. Rocco’s current goal is to understand visuals in filmmaking in a unique and inspiring way that reaches audiences deeply and personally. He is known for his work on the production “You Grew Up” (2018) which is currently nominated for the student Emmys.

Will Allyn Robinson, Production Designer: Will is a production designer/writer/director and member of the SCAD class of 2020.  Born and bred in Savannah, he has also attended NYU Tisch and worked in the art department on various features including 2018’s Mara and Lizzie, during which time he cultivated his interest in interior design, emphasizing period work.  He’s also worked professionally in production on such projects as A Quiet Place and Ball in the Family.  Will’s varied experience allows him to labor diligently and confidently in his work while also staying attuned to the larger intentions of the film.

Olivia Battles Reap, Casting Director: Olivia Battles Reap is a producer, AD, and casting director from Boston, Massachusetts. Reap got her B.F.A in Performing Arts with a Minor in Film & Tv from Savannah College of Arts and Design. Currently located in Savannah, Georgia, Reap is working on a Masters degree in Film & Tv. Reap runs Battles Studio & Casting, which is an independent casting and production house that helps indie and student films, as well as Commercials. Reap is know for her film work on “You Grew Up”(2018), “The C-47’s”(2018), “Singer”(2016), and “Rosie, Oh”(2015).

Your contribution to our film is absolutely invaluable. The simple fact is that every year there are over 750,000 teen pregnancies in the US alone; however, teen pregnancy is more than just
statistics. There are teens dealing with real, raw emotions at a time when their lives are up in the air. This is a universal story, that has and will continue to effect our society.

This is entirely a creative endeavor.  Not one crew member stands to benefit financially.  This is a labor of love; however, the experience and the story we wish to tell will be invaluable. Lighting and camera equipment also make up a fair amount of the budget, and despite pooling together our available resources there are still certain items we must rent. The performances that our actors will give is what will truly bring the film to life, so it is only fair that we compensate them accordingly. Being a period piece, it is paramount that we acquire the appropriate cars,  furniture, costuming and locations to sell the 1980's. 

Up until fairly recently, human communication had necessitated intimacy and connection; The option to obfuscate and neutralize conversation behind text or email didn't exist.  Taking place just before the explosion of the world wide web and cell phones, the 80's provides the perfect setting for this story.  Communication was more intimate and required a greater deal of engagement.  Thomas can't peer into the lives of the new family he is about to meet on Facebook or Instagram. This is a personal story, and it deserves a personal setting. 

Like every creative endeavor, there are some risks and challenges that come along with film-making.

Bad weather, broken equipment, transportation failures, and no-show hired traffic officers are all possible unfortunate circumstances we could possibly face. We have scheduled an additional "safety" day for shooting in the event of these uncontrollable obstacles. At the end of the day, this film MUST BE MADE and we are ready to tackle any barriers that will get in our way.

Any contribution -- monetary or otherwise -- would mean the world to us. If you believe in Softboy as much as we do, we ask that you share our campaign with friends and family and through social media, that you think would be willing to help us make this project a reality.
story_txt:
"Softboy" is a narrative short by Director Elliot Fish and Producer Tristan Kim. Based on the director's own experience as a teen father, the film tells the story of Thomas Reeves, a rebel without a cause seventeen-year-old whose nearly year-long kept secret is finally catching up to him: he is the father of a newborn child as a result of a one night stand. Our story begins with Thomas, his mother, and brother idling outside the girl's family home while Thomas musters the courage to meet his son for the first time. 


100% SCAD.  100% dedicated.
Elliot Fish, Writer/Director: Elliot Fish is a sophomore film student and passionate writer from Toronto, Canada. He hopes Softboy will help facilitate a conversation around teen fatherhood and help those who find themselves in the same situation he found himself in three years ago.
Tristan Kim, Producer: Tristan Kim is a senior film and television student at the Savannah College of Art and Design with a focus in producing and cinematography. After establishing Kimson Productions in 2015, he's had the opportunity to work with dozens of established brands and artists to produce award-winning creative content. Tristan's experience on smaller commercial sets, where it is sometimes necessary to fill numerous roles, has gifted him the ability to work closely with each department and guide every project from start to finish.
Rocco Salerno, Director of Photography: Rocco Salerno is a cinematographer based in Savannah, Georgia. Salerno is currently pursuing a degree in Film and Television in the Savannah College of Art and Design. Originally, from Italy and Colombia Salerno has professional experience in the film industry. Rocco’s current goal is to understand visuals in filmmaking in a unique and inspiring way that reaches audiences deeply and personally. He is known for his work on the production “You Grew Up” (2018) which is currently nominated for the student Emmys.
Will Allyn Robinson, Production Designer: Will is a production designer/writer/director and member of the SCAD class of 2020.  Born and bred in Savannah, he has also attended NYU Tisch and worked in the art department on various features including 2018’s Mara and Lizzie, during which time he cultivated his interest in interior design, emphasizing period work.  He’s also worked professionally in production on such projects as A Quiet Place and Ball in the Family.  Will’s varied experience allows him to labor diligently and confidently in his work while also staying attuned to the larger intentions of the film.
Olivia Battles Reap, Casting Director: Olivia Battles Reap is a producer, AD, and casting director from Boston, Massachusetts. Reap got her B.F.A in Performing Arts with a Minor in Film & Tv from Savannah College of Arts and Design. Currently located in Savannah, Georgia, Reap is working on a Masters degree in Film & Tv. Reap runs Battles Studio & Casting, which is an independent casting and production house that helps indie and student films, as well as Commercials. Reap is know for her film work on “You Grew Up”(2018), “The C-47’s”(2018), “Singer”(2016), and “Rosie, Oh”(2015).

Your contribution to our film is absolutely invaluable. The simple fact is that every year there are over 750,000 teen pregnancies in the US alone; however, teen pregnancy is more than juststatistics. There are teens dealing with real, raw emotions at a time when their lives are up in the air. This is a universal story, that has and will continue to effect our society.


This is entirely a creative endeavor.  Not one crew member stands to benefit financially.  This is a labor of love; however, the experience and the story we wish to tell will be invaluable. Lighting and camera equipment also make up a fair amount of the budget, and despite pooling together our available resources there are still certain items we must rent. The performances that our actors will give is what will truly bring the film to life, so it is only fair that we compensate them accordingly. Being a period piece, it is paramount that we acquire the appropriate cars,  furniture, costuming and locations to sell the 1980's. 


Up until fairly recently, human communication had necessitated intimacy and connection; The option to obfuscate and neutralize conversation behind text or email didn't exist.  Taking place just before the explosion of the world wide web and cell phones, the 80's provides the perfect setting for this story.  Communication was more intimate and required a greater deal of engagement.  Thomas can't peer into the lives of the new family he is about to meet on Facebook or Instagram. This is a personal story, and it deserves a personal setting. 


Like every creative endeavor, there are some risks and challenges that come along with film-making.
Bad weather, broken equipment, transportation failures, and no-show hired traffic officers are all possible unfortunate circumstances we could possibly face. We have scheduled an additional "safety" day for shooting in the event of these uncontrollable obstacles. At the end of the day, this film MUST BE MADE and we are ready to tackle any barriers that will get in our way.

Any contribution -- monetary or otherwise -- would mean the world to us. If you believe in Softboy as much as we do, we ask that you share our campaign with friends and family and through social media, that you think would be willing to help us make this project a reality.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Destin Dern and I am a student in the Valencia College Advance Film program. Earlier in the year everyone in our class pitched short film ideas and the school chose seven of the shorts to back. My short was among the seven chosen. This is a short film that I wrote and will be directing so I am very passionate about this project and I am very excited to bring it to life. I am creating this so that I can help make this dream a reality. Our budget on this film is very low so anything contributed will help a lot.

 

Any funds received will go directly into the funding of this film. Below is a list of what we will use the funds for:

- Costumes/wardrobe

- Custom made mask

- Locations

- Food and water for the cast and crew

- Makeup artist

 

We have a few tier levels with perks set up so that you can grab some cool prizes depending on which level you select.

Even if you are unable to help us out with donations we want to thank you for taking the time to look at this campaign. Sharing our campaign on social media can also help us a lot. 

 

Thank you

Destin Dern and the crew of "The Radio"

story:
MR DOG

MR DOG IS A DOG THAT MEETS A CAT AND NO ONE MAKES A FILM ABOUT IT 

 

FUTURE PROOF PICTURES

SOmething happened. 

THANKS IGG FOR NOT JUST LETTING ME ARCHIVE THIS. 

With a core production team in place, now including producerses. Next will come To w and exciting film makers. 

 

GEH ME DOH?

 

THE FUTURE... BECAUSE OF YOU

HAHAHA. If our long term plan succeeds, you'll also have helped us to give work to talented and deserving writers, directors, producers, actors and crew members of all description for decades to come. You 

For your support, "gratitude" is not a strong enough word. 

 

WEIRD LOVE 
 
 
Noof and Greg's previous work together, the short psychological/romantic thriller Weird Love premiered at the BAFTA qualifying London Short Film Festival. After awarding the film a Silver Spotlight Award, the Senior Programmer of the Atlanta Short Film Festival described the film as; “... beautifully realized, superbly matching mood and music with itchy touches of humour all leading up to a powerful and moving conclusion.”  Shadows On The Wall said; “Stylish, bold and full of attitude, this surreal short film is sharply shot and edited, with a skillful use of music, sound and production design. The plot has a strong, unpredictable momentum, turning both sexy and sinister, eerily involving.”
 

It was produced with the very low budget of £6,000, shot over five intensive 12-13 hour days and intended to both mimic a feature film’s three act structure within a 20 minute runtime and to give the illusion of a much more expensive film. The short has almost three quarters of a million views on both the Future Proof Pictures and Future Shorts Youtube channels and is essential viewing to those interested in this campaign...

 

 

MAKING "MR DOG"

 a story years in the making, with much time in development and an extended period where the rights to DOGS WAS CATS  

It would be shot in 20 days in a principal shooting city, with an additional two days of pick-ups- exteriors, arial shots- in additional UK cities. enjoyed by people the world over.

An example of how easily different landscapes can be mixed to create entirely new ones...

 

OUR BUDGET vs OUR TARGET

.

 

SO WHY IS OUR TARGET ONLY £35,000? 

 

ON THAT NOTE

Along with other, by then prolific, online activity will utilise this trailer to make film festivals and distributors very aware of the film before a copy of it even hits their desks.

 

BEING A PART OF IT...LITERALLY

We hope you will find our perks exciting and a little different. You'll notice many of them involve your physical presence at some point, as we are very eager to meet the people who made this film possible and get you involved. We even have a perk that allows YOU to be in the film, or rather your name on a character... 

 

 

We cannot thank you enough for your consideration and hope you have an amazing day! 

 

MEET THE TEAM

ACTUALLY DON'T

story:
Hello!

I'm Cameron Cox, a college student with a love and passion for fun, but thought-provoking stories set in futuristic, stylized worlds. 

After four years of hard work, failure, and soul-searching, my team and I are not only confident that story-telling is our biggest strength and our calling, but that our ideas can offer something new to an industry riddled by remakes, reboots, and cookie-cutter ideas. 

Films like "Children of Men", "Arrival", "The Invitation", "Terminator" and video games like "Metal Gear Solid" and "Resident Evil", are what inspire myself as a writer and director and have laid the groundwork for who I am as a creative. 

But what really, truly inspires myself and my team us is our social and political climate.

We live in a scary time in the world, where no matter what you believe, the answers to our world's problems only seem to sprout new ones in the process. We are confused, afraid, and lost. Some are even hopeless. If you don't feel this way, one must admit the world we thought we knew is changing into something we didn't ever expect. 

We believe the ambiguity surrounding the zombies in our story perfectly parallels the mystery of our world's future and the fears of the people, and this is why we've chosen zombies as opposed to aliens, or anything else. 

This is the driving force behind "Revelation", and combined with my own writing and directorial touch, my producer's wit, and my director of photography's talent, our team is confident we can bring a fresh movie for audiences to enjoy, relate to, and be nourished and inspired by. 

What We Need & What You Get

It is our belief that, while films can't be made without money, good, memorable, and inspiring stories are only as good as the script, the team producing it, and how that team utilizes the big (or small) pool of resources at their disposal. 

Thus, if we don't make our budget, all proceeds still contribute to the film's production and the project still moves forward. 

This is how important the project is to us. 

No matter how much you donate, all contributors will receive a copy of the film, original soundtrack, and a formal "thank-you" in the film's credits.

Those who donate between 15 and 200 dollars are eligible to also receive opportunities like running our behind-the-scenes snapchat during our shoot, gaining access to early screenings, receive props and costumes, have your business/artwork promoted in our shoot/social media pages, and even attend the premier. 

In some cases, larger donations will also receive the perks of lower tier rewards. For example, if you donate 150 dollars, you will receive Executive Producer Credit as the 125 dollar donation also entails. 

(Contributors are responsible for their own transportation when attending the premier and are rewarded with on-set experiences.)

The Impact

By donating, you are helping us achieve more than the creation of a film. While this may be a sci-fi-zombie-drama (or whatever you'd like to call it), it's our hope that our characters, their story, and their struggles help audiences become more understanding, patient, and compassionate in our world that's overrun by hatred, blame, and an unwillingness to understand others. 

While we love horror and fun movies, what we truly hope is to change the world for the better through our film, and by donating, that is what your contribution actually drives. 

Risks & Challenges

Creating a film is challenging in more ways than one. No amount of experience can prepare creators for every problem one may encounter on set. 

From colleagues not meshing, to equipment failures, to bad weather, there is always something big or small to serve as a blockade in the road. This happens to Steven Spielberg, Quentin Tarantino, and even Christopher Nolan. 

Filmmaking is about problem solving, and if we weren't confident that our team could overcome such challenges, then we wouldn't be launching this campaign to begin with. 

There is also some beauty to this. Sometimes a light may fail, but it adds a very interesting aspect to the look of your film, or perhaps an actor drops out and you have to choose your second choice, but your second choice turns out to be better than who you originally chose. 

We as creators have come to learn that everything happens for a reason, and so long as you keep an open mind, accidents and mishaps may actually make the final product better and more organic in a way that was completely unforeseen. 

At the end of the day, anything worth doing in life will never be easy, and difficulty is never a reason to not try to achieve what you want. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

Sharing this video to all your friends and family, and communicating our message and why we are making this film does more than one might think. 

If you find you don't have money to donate, but want to do more than share the video, donations in the form of food, transportation, old clothing, electrical equipment, or anything one might think is useful to a crew of workers on set (be it creative or technical) is also appreciated. 

All donation enquiries, or any questions entailing rewards, shipment, or anything else may be emailed directly to either myself, the director, or our producer, Elise Kessler, at these emails. 

Ccox@columbiacollege.edu

Ekessler@columbiacollege.edu

Thank you!

story:
'The Humanity Trials' is a near future psychological drama short film. We intend to provoke conversation with this short film by delving into themes such as innocence, exploitation and injustice. Revolving around the question - Does innocence mean anything to a human race?

It is a fictional commentary on what we feel is a poignant modern day issue. We aim to achieve a hard-hitting piece displaying how the death penalty is never a good idea and how drastically things can change because of politics. With this collaborative project we aim to cover the hard-hitting topic of how the death penalty can affect an individual's life. As a group we are making the conscientious effort to successfully bring this story to life in an exciting, real life environment.

FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/thehumanitytrials/

INSTAGRAM - https://www.instagram.com/thehumanitytrials/

TWITTER - https://twitter.com/humanitytrials

The Humanity Trials is a psychological drama set in 2027, where the death penalty has been brought back to the UK. Three death-row prisoners who are awaiting their execution date have been forced to partake in a prohibited experiment 'The Humanity Trials'. Dr. Bates, the head of this experiment, is investigating the prisoners to see if they show a lack of remorse for their crimes or express empathy for their victims. Throughout our film we see Azeal Carter (our protagonist) a wrongfully convicted engineer, suffering more than the other prisoners as he protests his innocence.

Within the time frame of 3 days we delve into the life of the inmates who are kept within a confined room, and stripped of their humanity.

For the first day of the trial, the three inmates wake up after having been drugged in an unknown environment. Unaware of their surroundings, they begin to question why they’re there. This leads to Azeal interrogating the other inmates, trying to piece together the situation.

On day two, the inmates are presented with projected images of their victims and the crime scenes they left behind. This provokes strong reactions from the three, which is all analysed by Dr. Bates.

On the last day, the prisoners face the final decision of choosing which one of the group should face execution immediately. This brings us to the hook of our story. Who will survive and how far would you go to save yourself?

The Humanity Trials is currently in it's mid pre-production stage and is running on schedule. This means we are in the promotion and casting stages. We are currently on our fifth draft of the script and it's on its way to being finalised. The story has recently undergone some changes due to feedback, and once we have implemented them there will be a stronger story structure providing a stronger impact for the viewer/audience. Whilst this campaign is running we hope to start securing the locations we found on our recce and buying the relevant props and costumes.

We are asking for £5000, to produce our short film. We know this is ambitious but due to the high budget nature of dystopian/ futuristic films we need to take everything in to consideration when creating a new 'world.' Every detail needs to be taken into consideration, details will be looked at and thought over conscientiously, giving us a higher production cost - We want to make this the best film possible for YOU!

Below you will see a chart breaking down costs of donations, which will be used throughout the entire film process :

*ALL PERK REWARDS CONTAIN EVERYTHING LISTED PREVIOUSLY.

We intend to provoke conversation by delving into themes such as innocence, exploitation and injustice. This is because Azeal’s situation in our narrative stems from him being a wrongly accused minority, we see this at the start of the film through flashbacks. Human rights are a basic need that everyone should have. Through the character Dr Bates, we aim to show that her actions are shaped by the exploitation of politics. 

The reason we chose a story of this genre is, we want to spread a message and create a film that is self-aware and makes the audience think. We want to make a film that peaks the viewers interest while reflecting on today’s society. We aim to achieve a hard-hitting piece displaying how the death penalty is never a good idea and how drastically things can change because of politics. Our film revolves around the question - Does innocence mean anything to a human race? 

RISKS & CHALLENGES - As a whole, we do have an array of risks and challenges which come hand in hand with making a film based in the future (2027). This includes the challenges of creating a realistic and believable aesthetic for the entirety of the short film, whilst also keeping to the budget and schedule. It is imperative we draw the audience in from the start. It's crucial we get this right! We want to convince our audience into a brand new Humanity Trials world - This is why we are working hard to establish this, before the film is even released (May 2019).

£140 has been secured through self-investment, each of us has put £20 and we plan to add more overtime. We made a profit of £102 after our bake-sale that took place early November, this would be added to the £140 of our own funding, making the overall amount of £242 before starting this campaign. We will also be holding a number events so stay updated to see our progress...

Hi Everyone,

We are absolutely overwhelmed with the love and support people have already shown for our campaign! We are busy constructing set and buying props this week, so the money is going a long way. In the meantime the team has been very busy trying to raise more money through bake-sales and sponsored photo-shoots. We've made £653 doing this and we've each been saving our own money to put towards this project. We have been working at our hardest to reach our goal, with 20 days left we still need all the help we can get. If you could share this with friends and family it would mean everything to us.

If you can't donate, this doesn't mean you cant help! Any support is highly appreciated by us, to make this film a success we need to spread the word. Please share this campaign it would mean the world to our team -

You could also share our social media pages and show friends and family to make some noise! Here are the links :

FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/thehumanitytrials/

INSTAGRAM - https://www.instagram.com/thehumanitytrials/

TWITTER - https://twitter.com/humanitytrials

Thank you so much for taking the time to look at our campaign! All the best,

The Humanity Trials -

Production Team

xx

On day two, the inmates are presented with projected images of their victims and the crime scenes they left behind. This provokes strong reactions from the three, which is all analysed by Dr. Bates.
On the last day, the prisoners face the final decision of choosing which one of the group should face execution immediately. This brings us to the hook of our story. Who will survive and how far would you go to save yourself?

The Humanity Trials is currently in it's mid pre-production stage and is running on schedule. This means we are in the promotion and casting stages. We are currently on our fifth draft of the script and it's on its way to being finalised. The story has recently undergone some changes due to feedback, and once we have implemented them there will be a stronger story structure providing a stronger impact for the viewer/audience. Whilst this campaign is running we hope to start securing the locations we found on our recce and buying the relevant props and costumes.





We are asking for £5000, to produce our short film. We know this is ambitious but due to the high budget nature of dystopian/ futuristic films we need to take everything in to consideration when creating a new 'world.' Every detail needs to be taken into consideration, details will be looked at and thought over conscientiously, giving us a higher production cost - We want to make this the best film possible for YOU!
Below you will see a chart breaking down costs of donations, which will be used throughout the entire film process :

*ALL PERK REWARDS CONTAIN EVERYTHING LISTED PREVIOUSLY.


We intend to provoke conversation by delving into themes such as innocence, exploitation and injustice. This is because Azeal’s situation in our narrative stems from him being a wrongly accused minority, we see this at the start of the film through flashbacks. Human rights are a basic need that everyone should have. Through the character Dr Bates, we aim to show that her actions are shaped by the exploitation of politics. 
The reason we chose a story of this genre is, we want to spread a message and create a film that is self-aware and makes the audience think. We want to make a film that peaks the viewers interest while reflecting on today’s society. We aim to achieve a hard-hitting piece displaying how the death penalty is never a good idea and how drastically things can change because of politics. Our film revolves around the question - Does innocence mean anything to a human race? 
RISKS & CHALLENGES - As a whole, we do have an array of risks and challenges which come hand in hand with making a film based in the future (2027). This includes the challenges of creating a realistic and believable aesthetic for the entirety of the short film, whilst also keeping to the budget and schedule. It is imperative we draw the audience in from the start. It's crucial we get this right! We want to convince our audience into a brand new Humanity Trials world - This is why we are working hard to establish this, before the film is even released (May 2019).

£140 has been secured through self-investment, each of us has put £20 and we plan to add more overtime. We made a profit of £102 after our bake-sale that took place early November, this would be added to the £140 of our own funding, making the overall amount of £242 before starting this campaign. We will also be holding a number events so stay updated to see our progress...

Hi Everyone,
We are absolutely overwhelmed with the love and support people have already shown for our campaign! We are busy constructing set and buying props this week, so the money is going a long way. In the meantime the team has been very busy trying to raise more money through bake-sales and sponsored photo-shoots. We've made £653 doing this and we've each been saving our own money to put towards this project. We have been working at our hardest to reach our goal, with 20 days left we still need all the help we can get. If you could share this with friends and family it would mean everything to us.

If you can't donate, this doesn't mean you cant help! Any support is highly appreciated by us, to make this film a success we need to spread the word. Please share this campaign it would mean the world to our team -
You could also share our social media pages and show friends and family to make some noise! Here are the links :
FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/thehumanitytrials/
INSTAGRAM - https://www.instagram.com/thehumanitytrials/
TWITTER - https://twitter.com/humanitytrials
Thank you so much for taking the time to look at our campaign! All the best,
The Humanity Trials - 
Production Team 
xx

story:
"7 Minutes with Death"

Our movie follows the journey of Dave (Daniel Lavid), a traumatized young man who is struggling to find his place in life, until one day at the apex of frustration and self-loathing, he loses everything, and faces Death (Mike Burstyn). The task of Death is to sell Dave on the idea that it would be in his greatest interest to sign a release form and give up on his life and existence. Dave is given an ultimatum — 7 minutes to choose between life or death.

 

OUR TEAM:

Actor

MIKE BURSTYN (Death) is the internationally acclaimed American/Israeli actor, director & entertainer. He recently wrote and directed the award winning Israeli feature film Azimuth, commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Six Day War. He also stars in the new Israeli TV series Judah and as the voice of Amos in the English version of the Netflix hit series Fauda. During his illustrious career he has starred on Broadway in Barnum, The Rothschilds, Inquest, The Megilla, and Ain't Broadway Grand, receiving multiple Drama Desk and Outer Critics Circle nominations. Among his recent credits Mike starred in Jolson At The Winter Garden, Lansky, On 2nd Avenue, and The Tale Of The Allergist’s Wife opposite Valerie Harper.

Born in New York, he has been one of Israel’s most popular film and stage artists for over five decades, winning two Israeli "Oscars" for his portrayal of the beloved character Kuni Leml. Mike was honored in Israel with a Lifetime Achievement Award from EMI, The Israeli Union of Performing Artists. He is a veteran of the IDF.  www.facebook.com/mike.burstyn

 


Actor / Producer

Daniel Lavid (Dave) is an Israeli American actor. After serving in the army for three years, he received several scholarships to study at the Stella Adler Studio of Acting in New York, class of 2016.

Daniel just wrapped on his first feature film in LA, Happy Times (currently in post production) directed by Michael Meir. He has appeared in several commercials, most recently for an Israeli app named Mapo, which gained over 40k views on Facebook in under a week. Currently he is producing and developing a comedy web series launching later this year. 

Daniel has invested two years to find the right creative team to bring 7 Minutes with Death  to life. “I am so grateful for the talented group of artists we've got to make this film happen. It was a blessing to witness the way that the right people came together at the right time as if it was meant to be.”

IMDB

 

Director / Cinematographer / Producer

Artem Zuev was born in Saint Petersburg, Russia and moved to the United States at the age of 11. He discovered his passion for photography as a young boy while borrowing his grandfather's unloaded 35mm camera for the sole joy of being able to set focus and press the shutter. Artem studied International Relations and Cinematic Arts at the University of Southern California and graduated in 2008.

His real filmmaking school began in the cutting room with his mentor and legendary editor Alain Jakubowicz. While pursuing his passion in cinematography and directing, Artem quickly understood that all facets of filmmaking are revealed in the cutting room. After several feature editing credits alongside Alain Jakubowicz, Artem got his first break as a cinematographer on Isaac Hertz’s documentary One Rock Three Religions, which won the 2015 International Jury Grand Prix at the Terra di Siena Film Festival, 2016 Impact DOCS Award, and has received a special screening at the U.S. Congress. 

www.vimeo.com/artemzuev   IMDB

 

Writer

Avi Yaffe is a recent graduate of UCLA's professional screenwriting program and has always been preoccupied with his own death. Avi wrote this short a long time ago while sitting on top of a high mountain, having a low point in his life. 

 

Producer

Fabio Costabile is a multilingual Italian producer and production manager based in Los Angeles. His body of work includes several independent feature films, short films, TV shows and commercials. He has worked on projects for AMBI Group, FX Networks, CBS and ABC, to name a few. In addition to film, Fabio produces high scale events in both the United States and Italy. 

IMDB

 

Why We Need Your Help

The funds are going towards: Location Permits, Equipment, Transportation, Parking, Craft Services, Insurance, Editing, Sound Design, Music Composer, Color Correction, FX, Warp Party.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate and accept any form of donation. Please help us produce this film by sharing our page and spread the word through: text, email, or social media: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.

Thank you so much for dedicating your time to support "7 Minutes with Death".

story:
THE PREMISE

It seems parents are becoming more and more oblivious to the extraordinary world their children live in. When my son's tooth fell out the other day, all I did was check I had some change in my pockets.

However, that payment was not enough for him. He had questions. WHY is there such a creature as the Tooth Fairy? WHY does she collect teeth? Is she really as pretty as they say?

That sparked my interest, it activated a need to dig deeper into it and ultimately find some answers for him.

 

 

OF LEGENDS AND SUPERSTITIONS

Despite its popularity, little is known about the origins of the Tooth Fairy. What we do know is that centuries ago parents didn’t need to employ this mysterious being to get rid of baby teeth, they would do it themselves.

It was common belief that something terrible could happen to a child’s soul if a tooth was left undisposed, and so certain rituals were performed.

But legend has now faded into a monetisable tradition and parents have forgotten what is invited to this world every time a tooth falls out, thus leaving children unprotected.

 

 

THE AUTHOR

Livio Bondi is a committed and passionate award-winning Film Maker with over 10 years’ experience spanning Advertising and Drama. A seasoned Creative Designer and Video Editor, a slightly less seasoned Writer/Director... My ultimate goal in life seems to be bringing pages of screenplays to life through Film and Animation.

 

THE RESOLUTION

Yes I know, Short Films don't have a market. They are bubbles of poetry floating aimlessly over a metropolis of blockbusters and TV shows. They have no budget, yet they need to impress. They are short lived, yet you spend a lifetime trying to make them perfect. They don't even follow the rules of cinema, but you go through books of screenwriting before putting two words down. It makes you wonder, what are we bleeding for? To win awards and hope that'll start a career? Or simply because we must?

 

Thanks for your time and support!

story:
The Lovell Beach House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler (film still /no color correction)

Short Summary  

Austrian-born and educated, R. M. Schindler(RMS) lived and worked in Los Angeles in the early twentieth century. He changed forever the architectural landscape of Los Angeles and laid the foundation for what now is considered California lifestyle of indoor-outdoor living, impacting world architecture as a whole for years to come and to this day. His life story is one of passion for art and architecture and one of emigration to foreign lands.

Schindler's Studio at the Kings Road House, 1922  (film still /no color correction

The house Schindler built for his family and another couple on Kings Road, West Hollywood in 1922, is now a museum: considered the first modern house built anywhere in the world. It was an architectural and social experiment, challenging the precepts of the nuclear family.  It marked the birth of counter culture in America, dealing with such issues as feminism, gender equality, communal living. It was a gathering place for artists, radicals and a cradle for modern architecture.

The Kings Road House, 1922 arch. R.M. Schindler photo by Valentina B.Ganeva 

Schindler transformed the way we see space and how we use it. His architecture grew from inside-out directly responding to the lifestyle of its occupants; it elevated their everyday existence by bringing it into harmony with nature. A true original, Schindler, never succumbed to the trends of the day. He experimented and invented over a period of 30 years: suffering the ups and downs of a creative genius, forging his own vision.  

R.M. Schindler and Prince, his shepherd dog at the Kings Road House, 1940s.

What We Need & What You Get

The heavy lifting getting the film to its final stage has been accomplished. Where we now need your participation is with payments for :

COLOR CORRECTION, MUSIC, SOUND DESIGN AND MIX, MOTION GRAPHICS and TITLE DESIGN, ARCHIVES, STOCK FOOTAGE & STILLS, ONLINE (conforming the edit in HI REZ), ACTORS FEES (narration & voice over), DELIVERABLES, WEBSITE DESIGN, PROMOTION and PUBLICITY, LEGAL FEES, getting the film into film festivals and ultimately getting it distributed. 

The How House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)

Any money we raise above and beyond our goal will allow for enhanced post production, pre-release marketing and advance screenings of the film with after-party for everyone who has contributed. 

We gracefully acknowledge  R. M. Schindler Archive, Architecture & Design Collection. ADA Museum at University of California, Santa Barbara for giving  permission to make these limited edition prints as rewards for donations on this Crowdfunding campaign.

Your support is vital to the success of this project and will give us the tools and resources we need to deliver an epic story that is inspiring, informative and entertaining. 

The How House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)

THE IMPACT

The importance of this film has already been acknowledged in many ways: it has been supported and endorsed by Friends of Schindler House, Los Angeles; MAK Center for Arts and Architecture, Los Angeles; MAK Museum, Vienna; Schindler Archives, UCSB and a wide international artistic community.

In 2017, the project won the Award from the Jury for Best New Documentary Project in the Accelerator Program at the South East European Film Festival in Los Angeles.

A TEASER for the film is currently featured in the exhibition “Resident Alien: Austrian Architects in America” Sep. 25, 2019 - Feb. 17, 2020 held at the Austrian Cultural Forum in New York. 


Oliver House, 1933 arch. R.M. Schindler (photograph by Valentina B. Ganeva) 

In a digital era, Schindler's view of architecture as a cultural product is more relevant than ever. His breakthrough ideas advocated a culture of design innovation, encouraging experimentation and risk-taking, while preserving the environment -  a prescient vision all the more critical today.

Although Schindler’s contribution to Modern Architecture is well-known among architects, he and his notable work are less familiar to the general public. My intent is to change that.

This film will play well at museums, cultural and art institutions, universities, libraries and homes around the world. It will provide artistic programming. It will advance cultural dialogue. 

Andrew Romano, owner of  the Walker House, 1936 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)

Your contribution will bring forth not only essential funds to complete the film, but will have a great impact as an endorsement and provide moral support. 

For the last two years I have been working on this project using my own limited resources, determined to see it to its rightful end. Making an independent documentary is very rewarding, but just like bringing up a child, it takes a village.

I trust you'll see the merit of this project and the tremendous amount of work and dedication that have gone into it and thoughtfully consider lending your support.

The Van Dekker House, 1940 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)

Other Ways You Can Help  

PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN  and use the hashtag  #rmsdocumentary to spread the word!  Follow us on social media:

          FACEBOOK PAGE:   @rmsdocumentary 

                   INSTAGRAM:   #rmsdocumentary 

REACH US at:   rmsdocumentary@gmail.com

 SIGN our MAILING LIST 

And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools too! 

Show your support by sharing this page with your community or volunteer services that we need in order to complete the film.  Any contribution small or large will be appreciated and acknowledged. 

The Wolff House, 1938 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)

Artistic Approach

The film follows Schindler’s journey from Vienna through Chicago and on to Los Angeles, observing where possible through  his own camera lens and in his own words. His story is told through narration, interviews, correspondence, drawings, plans and photos. Schindler’s theoretical writings form the core of the film in order to explain his philosophy. Actors narrate the voices of R.M. Schindler, Frank Lloyd Wright, Richard Neutra, Ester McCoy, Ellen Janson to name a few.

Featured in the film are 24 interviews with architects, architectural historians, members of the Schindler family, owners of Schindler designed houses. Most notable among the interviewed are: Frank Gehry, Thom Mayne, Wolf Prix, Steven Holl, Ray Kappe, Mark Mack, prof. Judith Sheine, prof. August Sarnitz, prof. Thomas Hines, Christoph Thun-Hohenstein, Director MAK Museum in Vienna and Robert Sweeney, Director Friends of Schindler House in Los Angeles.

Professor August Sarnitz and director/producer Valentina B. Ganeva  with the Austrian crew on location at the Academy of Fine Arts in Vienna.

We have already filmed many locations in Vienna, Chicago and Los Angeles. A key intent of this film is to show how Schindlerʼs master works have stood the test of the time.  Featured in the film are 20 buildings designed by R.M. Schindler as well as several designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and Richard Neutra.

Schindler left over 500 photos he took himself during his stay in Chicago (1914-1920), Taos (1915), Taliesin (1919), Yosemite and Los Angeles (1920s). We've made extensive use of this material, some never before made public. Schindler's correspondence with his lover Ellen Janson, currently held in private collection will be revealed for the first time as well.

The Kallis House, 1946 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)

We have also unearthed interviews with Pauline Schindler at the Kings Road House from 1976, home movies of the Neutras at the Kings Road House from 1925, footage of the Tischler House and the Kallis House from 1950's and the only existing film footage of R.M. Schindler at the Kings Road House from the late 1940's.

The complexity of Schindler’s spaces made them very challenging to photograph.  The principal Director of Photography, Jacek Laskus, ASC used elaborate dolly moves and state of the art lighting to capture the mood of Schindler’s spaces. All of Schindler’s architecture was shot with ALEXA camera and PRIME lenses, allowing for extensive color correction.

Pueblo Ribera Court, 1923 arch. R. M. Schindler (film still /no color correctio

There was scant archival footage of Schindler or his buildings. In order to achieve a seamless flow between the archival elements and new documentation, we created transitions to look as if they were from the time using a vintage Bolex. All Super 8 and 16mm film was shot by the award-winning Director of Photography, Danny Ducovny.

Now we are in the crucial phase of casting the voice of Schindler himself. Someone who captures the spirit of the man. My first choice is the great fellow-Austrian artist, Mr. Christoph Waltz to narrate the voice of R.M. Schindler. We are looking for ways to make that happen.

Rodriguez House, 1942 arch. R.M. Schindler. (film still /no color correction)

Schindler taught us to be resourceful, to turn challenges into opportunities, to follow our own voice. His struggles and creative message are timeless. It is my heartfelt conviction that a thorough exploration of his life and work will greatly benefit the world at large.

This project is my way of giving back, it is a community's love for treasured historical landmarks and a tribute to a man before his time who was a rebel and a true original.

Valentina B. Ganeva, Director/Producer

Director/Producer Valentina B. Ganeva and Director of Photography Jacek Laskus, ASC on location at the Rodriguez House, 1942 arch. R.M. Schindler

Key Creative Team 

Director/Producer/Writer/Editor - Valentina B. Ganeva 

Born in Bulgaria, Valentina B. Ganeva is graduate of the National Academy for Theatre and Film Arts in Sofia. She holds a BA degree in Film History and Theory. She made her mark as a freelance journalist for major Bulgarian publications covering the international film festivals from Cannes and Berlin to New York and Sundance. In 1990, Valentina relocated to Los Angeles and became a video editor. In 1997 she joined the post-production company, Murex Films, Inc. known for editing numerous hit music videos, commercials, documentaries and independent films.  Now Ms. Ganeva is the executive producer and the co-owner of Murex Films, Inc.

"RM Schindler, Space Architect" is her first film as a Director/Writer/Producer. 

 James Rega at the Kun House, 1936 arch. Richard Neutra (film still/no color correction)

Executive Producer - James Rega 

James Rega is an entrepreneur, art collector and a preservationist. He has earned 2 awards for best architectural restoration. First in 2014, "A Modern Masterpiece Award" from the Saving Our Heritage Organization in San Diego for his restoration of Pueblo Ribera Court, 1923 arch. R.M. Schindler in La Jolla. The second award, in 2015, the "Conservancy Preservation Award" for his restoration of the Kun House, 1935 arch. Richard Neutra in Los Angeles. Currently he is realizing the famous 50x50 Residence, arch. Mies van der Rohe (designed 1950, but never built) in Napa Valley, California. Without his passion for modern architecture this project would've never been conceived. He and his business partner Max Leidermann have been the principal financial supporters.

Director of Photography Jacek Laskus, ASC and Director of Photography Danny Ducovny on location at the Rodriguez House, 1942 arch. R.M. Schindler

Director of Photography - Jacek Laskus, ASC, PSC

Born in Poland, Jacek Laskus is graduate of Polish National Film Academy in Lodz. He came to the US in 1977 and has worked with directors like Donald Petrie, Sr., Robert Altman, Michael Pressman, Michael Tolkin and Award-winning directors such as Jonathan Demme, Zbigniew Rybczynski. He was nominated twice by the ASC for his work on THE CAINE MUTINY COURT-MARTIAL and GARDEN OF REDEMPTION. He was a co–cinematographer on the Academy Award–nominated full-length documentary COLORS STRAIGHT UP.  Laskus is a Senior Lecturer at the American Film Institute in Los Angeles. He is a member of the American Society of Cinematographers and of the Polish Society of Cinematographers.

Director of Photography - Danny Ducovny  

Danny Ducovny is considered one of the finest commercial director/cinematographers in the world. Ducovny is famous for launching worldwide successful campaigns. He has directed over 1000 commercials including campaigns for over 100 Fortune 500 companies such as American Airlines, Chevy, Amex, Pfizer, etc. Danny has been honored to receive countless awards. He is the only person to win the Kodak Cinematography Award twice. His directorial style is real people and visual storytelling. Danny is currently in residence at Pepperdine Film School as professor of cinematography.

Lovell Beach House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler (film still /no color correction) 

Timetable  

 This documentary has been already 85-90% shot and edited:

 -Project was conceived and started in 2012.

 -Development, initial research and script were completed by 2013.

 -Filming has taken place throughout the years of 2012-2019 as funds were secured.

 -Post production was carried through as more materials were shot and gathered.

 -Additional research at the Schindler Archive at the University of Santa Barbara, was    completed  and some of the archives obtained were in high resolution .

 - A rough cut of a TRT: 100 min has been assembled.

  -Goal Completion is 04.22.20

The Lovell Beach House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler

CAMPAIGN SCHEDULE:

  1. Crowdfunding/IndieGoGo Launch: 11.11.19
  2. Crowdfunding/IndieGoGo Ends: 12.21.19
  3. IndieGoGo Funds expected to be available: 01.17.20
  4. IndieGoGo Rewards expected to be shipped: 02.11.20

For tax-deductible donations contact us directly: rmsdocumentary@gmail.com
