The Lovell Beach House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler (film still /no color correction)Short Summary  Austrian-born and educated, R. M. Schindler(RMS) lived and worked in Los Angeles in the early twentieth century. He changed forever the architectural landscape of Los Angeles and laid the foundation for what now is considered California lifestyle of indoor-outdoor living, impacting world architecture as a whole for years to come and to this day. His life story is one of passion for art and architecture and one of emigration to foreign lands.Schindler's Studio at the Kings Road House, 1922  (film still /no color correctionThe house Schindler built for his family and another couple on Kings Road, West Hollywood in 1922, is now a museum: considered the first modern house built anywhere in the world. It was an architectural and social experiment, challenging the precepts of the nuclear family.  It marked the birth of counter culture in America, dealing with such issues as feminism, gender equality, communal living. It was a gathering place for artists, radicals and a cradle for modern architecture.The Kings Road House, 1922 arch. R.M. Schindler photo by Valentina B.Ganeva Schindler transformed the way we see space and how we use it. His architecture grew from inside-out directly responding to the lifestyle of its occupants; it elevated their everyday existence by bringing it into harmony with nature. A true original, Schindler, never succumbed to the trends of the day. He experimented and invented over a period of 30 years: suffering the ups and downs of a creative genius, forging his own vision.  R.M. Schindler and Prince, his shepherd dog at the Kings Road House, 1940s.What We Need & What You GetThe heavy lifting getting the film to its final stage has been accomplished. Where we now need your participation is with payments for :COLOR CORRECTION, MUSIC, SOUND DESIGN AND MIX, MOTION GRAPHICS and TITLE DESIGN, ARCHIVES, STOCK FOOTAGE & STILLS, ONLINE (conforming the edit in HI REZ), ACTORS FEES (narration & voice over), DELIVERABLES, WEBSITE DESIGN, PROMOTION and PUBLICITY, LEGAL FEES, getting the film into film festivals and ultimately getting it distributed. The How House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)Any money we raise above and beyond our goal will allow for enhanced post production, pre-release marketing and advance screenings of the film with after-party for everyone who has contributed. We gracefully acknowledge  R. M. Schindler Archive, Architecture & Design Collection. ADA Museum at University of California, Santa Barbara for giving  permission to make these limited edition prints as rewards for donations on this Crowdfunding campaign.Your support is vital to the success of this project and will give us the tools and resources we need to deliver an epic story that is inspiring, informative and entertaining. The How House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)THE IMPACTThe importance of this film has already been acknowledged in many ways: it has been supported and endorsed by Friends of Schindler House, Los Angeles; MAK Center for Arts and Architecture, Los Angeles; MAK Museum, Vienna; Schindler Archives, UCSB and a wide international artistic community.In 2017, the project won the Award from the Jury for Best New Documentary Project in the Accelerator Program at the South East European Film Festival in Los Angeles.A TEASER for the film is currently featured in the exhibition “Resident Alien: Austrian Architects in America” Sep. 25, 2019 - Feb. 17, 2020 held at the Austrian Cultural Forum in New York. Oliver House, 1933 arch. R.M. Schindler (photograph by Valentina B. Ganeva) In a digital era, Schindler's view of architecture as a cultural product is more relevant than ever. His breakthrough ideas advocated a culture of design innovation, encouraging experimentation and risk-taking, while preserving the environment -  a prescient vision all the more critical today.Although Schindler’s contribution to Modern Architecture is well-known among architects, he and his notable work are less familiar to the general public. My intent is to change that.This film will play well at museums, cultural and art institutions, universities, libraries and homes around the world. It will provide artistic programming. It will advance cultural dialogue. Andrew Romano, owner of  the Walker House, 1936 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)Your contribution will bring forth not only essential funds to complete the film, but will have a great impact as an endorsement and provide moral support. For the last two years I have been working on this project using my own limited resources, determined to see it to its rightful end. Making an independent documentary is very rewarding, but just like bringing up a child, it takes a village.I trust you'll see the merit of this project and the tremendous amount of work and dedication that have gone into it and thoughtfully consider lending your support.The Van Dekker House, 1940 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)Other Ways You Can Help  PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN  and use the hashtag  #rmsdocumentary to spread the word!  Follow us on social media:          FACEBOOK PAGE:   @rmsdocumentary                    INSTAGRAM:   #rmsdocumentary REACH US at:   rmsdocumentary@gmail.com SIGN our MAILING LIST And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools too! Show your support by sharing this page with your community or volunteer services that we need in order to complete the film.  Any contribution small or large will be appreciated and acknowledged. The Wolff House, 1938 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)Artistic ApproachThe film follows Schindler’s journey from Vienna through Chicago and on to Los Angeles, observing where possible through  his own camera lens and in his own words. His story is told through narration, interviews, correspondence, drawings, plans and photos. Schindler’s theoretical writings form the core of the film in order to explain his philosophy. Actors narrate the voices of R.M. Schindler, Frank Lloyd Wright, Richard Neutra, Ester McCoy, Ellen Janson to name a few.Featured in the film are 24 interviews with architects, architectural historians, members of the Schindler family, owners of Schindler designed houses. Most notable among the interviewed are: Frank Gehry, Thom Mayne, Wolf Prix, Steven Holl, Ray Kappe, Mark Mack, prof. Judith Sheine, prof. August Sarnitz, prof. Thomas Hines, Christoph Thun-Hohenstein, Director MAK Museum in Vienna and Robert Sweeney, Director Friends of Schindler House in Los Angeles.Professor August Sarnitz and director/producer Valentina B. Ganeva  with the Austrian crew on location at the Academy of Fine Arts in Vienna.We have already filmed many locations in Vienna, Chicago and Los Angeles. A key intent of this film is to show how Schindlerʼs master works have stood the test of the time.  Featured in the film are 20 buildings designed by R.M. Schindler as well as several designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and Richard Neutra.Schindler left over 500 photos he took himself during his stay in Chicago (1914-1920), Taos (1915), Taliesin (1919), Yosemite and Los Angeles (1920s). We've made extensive use of this material, some never before made public. Schindler's correspondence with his lover Ellen Janson, currently held in private collection will be revealed for the first time as well.The Kallis House, 1946 arch. R.M. Schindler  (film still /no color correction)We have also unearthed interviews with Pauline Schindler at the Kings Road House from 1976, home movies of the Neutras at the Kings Road House from 1925, footage of the Tischler House and the Kallis House from 1950's and the only existing film footage of R.M. Schindler at the Kings Road House from the late 1940's.The complexity of Schindler’s spaces made them very challenging to photograph.  The principal Director of Photography, Jacek Laskus, ASC used elaborate dolly moves and state of the art lighting to capture the mood of Schindler’s spaces. All of Schindler’s architecture was shot with ALEXA camera and PRIME lenses, allowing for extensive color correction.Pueblo Ribera Court, 1923 arch. R. M. Schindler (film still /no color correctioThere was scant archival footage of Schindler or his buildings. In order to achieve a seamless flow between the archival elements and new documentation, we created transitions to look as if they were from the time using a vintage Bolex. All Super 8 and 16mm film was shot by the award-winning Director of Photography, Danny Ducovny.Now we are in the crucial phase of casting the voice of Schindler himself. Someone who captures the spirit of the man. My first choice is the great fellow-Austrian artist, Mr. Christoph Waltz to narrate the voice of R.M. Schindler. We are looking for ways to make that happen.
Rodriguez House, 1942 arch. R.M. Schindler. (film still /no color correction)
Schindler taught us to be resourceful, to turn challenges into opportunities, to follow our own voice. His struggles and creative message are timeless. It is my heartfelt conviction that a thorough exploration of his life and work will greatly benefit the world at large.
This project is my way of giving back, it is a community's love for treasured historical landmarks and a tribute to a man before his time who was a rebel and a true original.
Valentina B. Ganeva, Director/Producer

Director/Producer Valentina B. Ganeva and Director of Photography Jacek Laskus, ASC on location at the Rodriguez House, 1942 arch. R.M. Schindler

Key Creative Team  
Director/Producer/Writer/Editor - Valentina B. Ganeva 
Born in Bulgaria, Valentina B. Ganeva is graduate of the National Academy for Theatre and Film Arts in Sofia. She holds a BA degree in Film History and Theory. She made her mark as a freelance journalist for major Bulgarian publications covering the international film festivals from Cannes and Berlin to New York and Sundance. In 1990, Valentina relocated to Los Angeles and became a video editor. In 1997 she joined the post-production company, Murex Films, Inc. known for editing numerous hit music videos, commercials, documentaries and independent films.  Now Ms. Ganeva is the executive producer and the co-owner of Murex Films, Inc.
"RM Schindler, Space Architect" is her first film as a Director/Writer/Producer. 

 James Rega at the Kun House, 1936 arch. Richard Neutra (film still/no color correction)
Executive Producer - James Rega  
James Rega is an entrepreneur, art collector and a preservationist. He has earned 2 awards for best architectural restoration. First in 2014, "A Modern Masterpiece Award" from the Saving Our Heritage Organization in San Diego for his restoration of Pueblo Ribera Court, 1923 arch. R.M. Schindler in La Jolla. The second award, in 2015, the "Conservancy Preservation Award" for his restoration of the Kun House, 1935 arch. Richard Neutra in Los Angeles. Currently he is realizing the famous 50x50 Residence, arch. Mies van der Rohe (designed 1950, but never built) in Napa Valley, California. Without his passion for modern architecture this project would've never been conceived. He and his business partner Max Leidermann have been the principal financial supporters.

Director of Photography Jacek Laskus, ASC and Director of Photography Danny Ducovny on location at the Rodriguez House, 1942 arch. R.M. Schindler
Director of Photography - Jacek Laskus, ASC, PSC

Born in Poland, Jacek Laskus is graduate of Polish National Film Academy in Lodz. He came to the US in 1977 and has worked with directors like Donald Petrie, Sr., Robert Altman, Michael Pressman, Michael Tolkin and Award-winning directors such as Jonathan Demme, Zbigniew Rybczynski. He was nominated twice by the ASC for his work on THE CAINE MUTINY COURT-MARTIAL and GARDEN OF REDEMPTION. He was a co–cinematographer on the Academy Award–nominated full-length documentary COLORS STRAIGHT UP.  Laskus is a Senior Lecturer at the American Film Institute in Los Angeles. He is a member of the American Society of Cinematographers and of the Polish Society of Cinematographers.
Director of Photography - Danny Ducovny  
Danny Ducovny is considered one of the finest commercial director/cinematographers in the world. Ducovny is famous for launching worldwide successful campaigns. He has directed over 1000 commercials including campaigns for over 100 Fortune 500 companies such as American Airlines, Chevy, Amex, Pfizer, etc. Danny has been honored to receive countless awards. He is the only person to win the Kodak Cinematography Award twice. His directorial style is real people and visual storytelling. Danny is currently in residence at Pepperdine Film School as professor of cinematography.


Lovell Beach House, 1925 arch. R.M. Schindler (film still /no color correction) 

Timetable  
 This documentary has been already 85-90% shot and edited:
 -Project was conceived and started in 2012.
 -Development, initial research and script were completed by 2013.
 -Filming has taken place throughout the years of 2012-2019 as funds were secured.
 -Post production was carried through as more materials were shot and gathered.
 -Additional research at the Schindler Archive at the University of Santa Barbara, was    completed  and some of the archives obtained were in high resolution .
 - A rough cut of a TRT: 100 min has been assembled.
  -Goal Completion is 04.22.20

The Lovell Beach House, 1925 arch. R.M. SchindlerCAMPAIGN SCHEDULE:
Crowdfunding/IndieGoGo Launch: 11.11.19
Crowdfunding/IndieGoGo Ends: 12.21.19
IndieGoGo Funds expected to be available: 01.17.20
IndieGoGo Rewards expected to be shipped: 02.11.20
For tax-deductible donations contact us directly: rmsdocumentary@gmail.com

story:
The Project

THAT GOOD NIGHT

“While on a long sleepy drive through the country with her husband Jack, Susan dreams of a farm where they can share their lives together. But when they arrive at a place just like she imagined, her dream morphs into a haunting nightmare. What she discovers as she struggles to know what is ‘real’ changes both their forevers.” 

The Plan

It is already underway! We have lined up our lead actors, a fantastic supporting crew, and our location! We are shooting early November 2018, at a very special place, a horse rescue located in the western Catskill mountains called ‘Rosemary Farm Sanctuary’. This historic farm is thick with atmosphere and mystery, with old barns and ancient trees, and yes, horses, that will be included in our filming. The Hobart Fire Department will be out in full force (and full gear) for a dramatic accident re-enactment.

The Producing Team 

This short is being produced by Rob Figueroa, Valerie Lonigro and Robert Rosenbaum, in a collaboration that resulted after meeting at a film festival earlier in 2018. Rob and Valerie's short film, THE FALLS, was an official selection and Valerie won BEST ACTOR FEMALE!  Robert won BEST CINEMATOGRAPHY for his short film, SUNDAY IN THE PARK WITH DOG.  After the festival, Robert contacted them about a new short film he wrote. This trio is excited about collaborating to bring this haunting, love tale to life.

Cast and Crew

Susan                  Valerie Lonigro
Jack                     Rob Figueroa
Caretaker          Clyde Baldo
EMT                     Nimo Gandhi

Written and directed by Robert Rosenbaum 

Cinematography                              Lars Elling Lunde 
Sound                                                  Carl Welden
Drone Photography                        Jessica Vecchione
Production and Costume             Dawn Robyn Petrlik

The Way to help

Our team is investing considerable personal energy to bring this evocative script to life. We are seeking to raise $10,000 to complete the filming needs, and this is where you come in!

As a supporter of our work at the level of your choice, there are special benefits that can be shared with you.

Here is an initial budget outline for this project.

This is our first outline which will likely have already evolved by the time you are reading this, but it helps to illustrate the costs even for a short film and a lot of donated time and energy. But we can't do it without help! 

Please contact us to confirm your gift! valerie@valerielonigro.com We are so excited about this project, and overjoyed to share it with you.

story:
Calling All Nurses & Nurse Appreciators

to Join Us on This Noble Mission

 

Just one dollar each can make it happen!

Please spread the word to others who care!

 

A Bold Step for Nursing

Nurses are everywhere, in every corner of the world, working day and night, helping others in need. Their impact is immeasurable. As we embark on 2020, the bicentennial year of the birth of Florence Nightingale, who is considered the mother of modern nursing, we are taking the bold step of bringing nursing’s story into the spotlight on the international stage, with a feature film and transmedia campaign called Legacy of Light.

We take this step with the support of countless Nursing Organizations and nurses around the world including: 

     • International Council of Nurses

     • Commonwealth Nurses and Midwives Federation

     • Florence Nightingale Foundation, London, UK

     • Florence Nightingale Museum, London, UK

     • American Academy of Nursing

     • American Nurses Association

     • Florida Atlantic University School of Nursing

     • International Nurse Coach Association

     • Nightingale Initiative for Global Health

     • Rutgers University School of Nursing

     • University of Massachusetts Worcester Graduate School of Nursing

     • University of Virginia School of Nursing

     • Watson Caring Science Institute

     • many others now in progress

A powerful script written by Nurse Researchers and Nightingale Scholars, Barbara Dossey, PhD, RN, FAAN, and Deva-Marie Beck, PhD, RN, Legacy of Light tells the story of the dynamic, trailblazing nursing pioneer, Florence Nightingale, and her continuing impact on the world. The film is currently in development, and has attracted the interest of “A”-list acting and directing talent. The profession of nursing and the life story of Florence Nightingale deserve nothing less!

Our Plan

Feature Film

The plan is to premiere the Legacy of Light movie during 2020, the bicentennial of Nightingale’s birth. Our objective is to reach the 3.4 million nurses in the US and the estimated 22 million nurses and midwives who globally carry the light of healing into the 21st century and advocate for health as a basic human right. As well, we seek to reach those who are considering nursing as a profession. We further want to reach those whose encounter with a nurse has touched their lives. Strategically, we need your help to reach a global audience ready to welcome this true story of an historic feminine leader, visionary, and social change-maker.

Transmedia Campaign

An ambitious transmedia campaign for Legacy of Light is also in preparation to ensure worldwide access to the film and create opportunities for deepening the awareness and experience of audiences. This includes developing educational opportunities that flow from the material.  We are planning to integrate a far-reaching, multi-language commitment to our “Nightingale Declaration for A Healthy World,” as well as developing learning opportunities for K-12 and a broad range of media, events and interactive activities for North American and worldwide audiences. A TV Series, “Light Beyond Borders” is also being developed to complement the feature film —bringing the spirit and legacy of Florence Nightingale into the 21st century with nurses featured on the frontlines of health challenges across the globe.

Expanding and Supporting NIGH

All current contributions will assist the promotion, production, distribution and versioning of the independent feature film ‘Legacy of Light.’  All revenue—beyond these film production and promotion costs—will sustain the further initiatives of the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health (NIGH). 

Meet the NURSES who wrote the Legacy of Light Screenplay and are leading this charge!

 

The force behind this vision — that is quickly becoming a reality — is the work of two nurse researchers/scholars who have devoted decades exploring the life of Florence Nightingale.  They have spent years developing this screenplay, which is based on the award-winning book Florence Nightingale: Mystic, Visionary, Healer by Dr. Dossey. They have both devoted endless energy to promote both the practice and the future of nursing. 

Together they founded the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health (NIGH), a grassroots, nurse-inspired movement to increase global concern for and commitment to human health. In 'Special Consultative Status' with the United Nations Economic & Social Council, NIGH’s Mission is to engage the common values and wisdom of millions of nurses, midwives and concerned citizens, and to act as a catalyst for the transformation of individuals, communities and society for the achievement of a healthy world. Founded in 2004, NIGH has a history of successful initiatives which include the Nightingale Declaration for a Healthy World; At the Heart of It All; Daring, Caring & Sharing to Save Mothers' Lives and co-founding the 2010 International Year of the Nurse / Nightingale Centennial. This Legacy of Light Feature Film & Transmedia Campaign is NIGH's newest project.  

Barbara Dossey, PhD, RN, AHN-BC, FAAN, HWNC-BC / Screenwriter

Dr. Dossey is a leading Florence Nightingale scholar and the world’s only nurse biographer of Nightingale. With meticulous scholarship, Dr. Dossey’s award-winning Florence Nightingale: Mystic, Visionary, Healer (2010) documents the struggles and achievements of a woman who defied the conventions and standards of Victorian England to blaze her own path. Dr. Dossey’s scholarship in crafting this illustrated biography includes numerous archival photographs, drawings, letters, maps, and a riveting narrative that creates a portrait of this complex, larger-than-life woman who lived for 90 years and is still a source of inspiration today. Dr. Dossey serves as an International Co-Director, of the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health (NIGH), and is co-author of the award-winning textbook Florence Nightingale Today: Healing, Leadership, Global Action (2005). She has been the guest editor of a number of nursing journals and author of many articles, chapters and books, all revealing her in-depth study and complex analysis of Nightingale’s life and work. 

Her collaborative global nursing project — NIGH— and the Nightingale Declaration Campaign (NDC) have been developed to strengthen individual commitment toward achieving a healthy world as a priority objective for action by ordinary citizens, by civil society organizations and by all governments, local and national. Dr. Dossey is a Fellow of the American Academy of Nursing (FAAN), Co-Director of the International Nurse Coach Association and is certified in Holistic Nursing (AHN-BC) and Health & Wellness Nurse Coaching (HWNC-BC). She is an 12-time recipient of the prestigious American Journal of Nursing Book of the Year Award and has received  many awards during her remarkable, prolific career — including: Visionary Award by the Academy of Integrative Health and Medicine, Pioneer of Integrative Medicine Award from the Aspen Center for Integrative Health, the Distinguished Alumni Award from Baylor University, TWU 100 Great Nursing Alumni from Texas Woman's University and Holistic Nurse of the Year from the American Holistic Nurses' Association.

Deva-Marie Beck, PhD, RN / Screenwriter

Dr. Beck is a Nightingale scholar, multi-media specialist, author and educator — serving, in all these roles — as an International Co-Director of NIGH, the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health. She has developed numerous multi-media approaches to inform a growing audience concerned with global health. These include online feature articles, videos and photo-essays — coordinating with nurses and media professionals globally. In 2014, she was commissioned by the WHO Health Workforce Department to create 'At the Heart of It All: Nurses & Midwives for Universal Health Coverage’ — premiered at the WHO Global Forum for Chief Nursing/Midwifery Officers in Geneva and featured many times since at WHO conferences regionally and worldwide. In 2008, she  collaborated with WHO and a global array of nursing leaders to co produce a video for WHO’s 60th anniversary — ‘Nurses & Midwives: Now More Than Ever for a Healthy World’ in eight language versions.

Dr. Beck also oversees the development of NIGH’s team of NGO Representatives to the United Nations. She is co-author of the award-winning Florence Nightingale Today: Healing, Leadership, Global Action and has since written many related articles and textbook chapters to pioneer a broader understanding of Nightingale’s relevance to the 21st century — most recently ‘A Brief History of the United Nations and Nursing: A Healthy World Is Our Common Future,’ in the textbook ‘A New Era in Global Health: Nursing & The United Nations 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.’ In addition to her doctoral work in Nursing History & International Development Education, she holds undergraduate degrees in Nursing, Health Sciences and Theatre Arts.

What We Need and How You Can Help

As of this writing, we have verbal commitment for the film’s $15 million production budget. The details are being finalized and we will post updates as progress is made.

Where we need your participations is in helping fund the creation and launch of the transmedia campaign that will help us reach and educate a worldwide audience (see description under the Plan section). We have set a target of $250,000 to help support the enormous amount of work around the film and the creation and launch of the transmedia campaign. While this is significantly smaller than the typical Hollywood budget for worldwide promotion of an important film, it will give us a strong position for a powerful and impactful launch — and, as nurses, we know how to get things done!

This funding will be used to:

  • Launch and maintain a worldwide social media campaign
  • Develop and launch a worldwide marketing campaign
  • Develop educational materials that accompany the film
  • Support speeches and events that promote this work
  • Help fund the resources needed to reach audiences across the globe:
    • Transmedia Campaign Producer
    • Campaign Project Manager
    • Social Media Coordinator
    • Digital and Graphics support
    • Communications Coordinator
    • Strategic Partners Coordinator
    • Legal and Expert Counsel

We believe that — with the support of as little as $1.00 from nurses and $5.00 from those who appreciate what a nurse has done for them — our goal is achievable. 

We plan to expand coordination with nursing organizations, global health organizations, like-minded nonprofits, nursing colleges and universities, foundations, as well as pharmaceutical and healthcare companies — to bring in sponsorships at the same time. Those interested, please contact: info@legacyoflightthemovie.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be in a position to contribute, but you can still participate. Here’s how:

  • Help get the word out. We want everyone knowing and talking about it!
  • Share with friends, family, groups or organizations that might be interested.
  • Take it to your church, temple, mosque, synagogue, school, campus, book club
  • Make use of Indiegogo share tools!

The Impact We Can Achieve Together

Through the Legacy of Light project we can, together, put a global spotlight on Nursing. By engaging audiences everywhere, we are sharing the critical role of nurses throughout the world and are advocating global health worldwide.

The story of Florence Nightingale is a powerful example of the positive impact single individuals can have in meeting the urgent issues of global health.  

By bringing broad exposure to the inspiring story of Florence Nightingale, we celebrate her as a nurse, a visionary, an agent of change, and hero to so many, while opening up the potential to inspire others to make a difference, whether small or large.

“If we can transform—by a few years of persistent effort—the habits of centuries, our progress will not have been slow but amazingly rapid!”   Florence Nightingale

“Health is not only to be well—but to use well—every power we have to use.”   Florence Nightingale

Our Track Record

We are very fortunate to have gathered an extraordinary team and group of advisors, all of whom have extensive, successful track records on both the national and international stage. Please see below.

Our Team

In addition to Barbara Dossey, PhD, RN, FAAN, and Deva-Marie Beck, PhD, RN (Bios above), please be sure to read about these people and their inspiring profiles. 

Cynthia A. Phillips, PhD 

Dr. Cynthia A. Phillips is the Founder & CEO of The Disruptive Factory. She is an economist/agricultural economist as well as a business consultant to for-profit and social enterprises with over 20 years of experience in the areas of strategic planning, marketing, branding, analytics, big data, business development and global expansion.

Former Director of International Marketing & Risk Management at American Express, she currently consults with technology companies and start-ups such as Cisco Systems, Full Cycle Bioplastics, BioSerie, and Riverbed. She currently serves as the interim Chief Marketing and Sustainability Officer for Ascalon, LLC, a disruptive consumer and commercial bio-based products company. Phillips sits on several non-profit boards and advisory boards of start-ups including the Akilah Institute, OROECO, and accelerators such as Think Beyond Plastic. Phillips served as the Founder of GlobalShiftTV, G Media Partners, and Disruptive Spirits. Phillips is serving as the CEO of Good Causes Corp and is the architect of Passport2Good, an engagement app to serve citizens and social enterprises.

Bianca Goodloe

Goodloe Law is a boutique entertainment, intellectual property, film finance, and corporate law practice providing counsel on all aspects of motion picture and television development, financing, production and distribution. They represent writers, directors, producers, actors, investors, strategic financiers, private lenders, insurance brokers and tax credit brokers. Their principal's clients have included Paramount Pictures, New Line Cinema, Universal Pictures, Miramax Films, Warner Bros. Pictures, Endemol Group B.V., and an array of independent producers and passive investors who have been advised on the structuring and allocation of investment into films including the Tomb Raider Franchise, The Harry Potter Franchise, The Lord of the Rings Franchise, I Am Sam, Final Destination, 15 Minutes, Beyond Borders, Abandon, The Wild Thornberrys Movie, The Core, The Fighting Temptations, Marci X, Looney Tunes Back in Action!, Malibu's Most Wanted, Paycheck, Wilde Salome, and Calvin Marshall, among others.

Louise Selanders, EdD, RN, FAAN 

Dr. Louise Selanders is an internationally recognized and award-winning nurse historian who passionately believes that the history of nursing offers answers to current and future issues of nursing education, practice and research. She has identified Nightingale's key contributions to the areas of nursing theory, leadership and to a philosophical development of the profession. Dr. Selanders has co-authored the award-winning volume 'Florence Nightingale Today: Healing, Leadership, Global Action' (2005), which details how the solutions identified and implemented by Nightingale, in her time, can be effective in resolving current issues such as global health, managed care and the nursing shortage. This volume was selected as the 2005 ‘American Journal of Nursing Book of the Year.’ Dr. Selanders has been a full professor at the College of Nursing at Michigan State University in East Lansing, Michigan, where she was the Director of the Master's Program. She is also an honored Fellow of the American Academy of Nurses.

Kathy Douglas, RN, MPH-HA 

Kathy Douglas is a nationally recognized nurse leader, filmmaker and entrepreneur. She wrote and directed the film — NURSES: If Florence Could See Us Now — an intimate look into the world of nursing today. She is co-founder of the production company Wise Women Circles, focused on inspirational media and is COO for the film distribution company Video Project, specializing in cause-based documentaries.

In addition to being a filmmaker, Kathy’s leadership in healthcare technology spans over 20 years. Her entrepreneurial spirit has driven her involvement in multiple successful start-up companies both for profit and not-for-profit.  She continues to consult in the healthcare technology arena with clients ranging from early stage start-up to large established companies. Kathy’s passion over the last decade has been focused on the health and well-being of our healthcare workforce. She is co-author of the new book  The Dance of Caring – A Caregivers Guide to Harmony  and is active in promoting self-care among caregivers. She is the author of  many published articles, had a regular column on nurse staffing in Nursing Economics for several years, as well as sitting on their Editorial Board. Kathy holds a Masters degree from The University of San Francisco in Public Health Administration and is a graduate of Stanford Business School’s Executive Program.

Debbie Brubaker

Debbie Brubaker is a producer and production manager, known for The Diary of A Teenage Girl (2015), On the Road (2012) and Blue Jasmine (2013).

Demetrio Cuzzocrea

Demetrio Cuzzocrea has more than two decades of experience in the interactive and entertainment industries and possesses rare equilibrium in left and right-brained thinking. In the past, between winning awards for his filmmaking and acting, he served as Director of Interactive Client Services and Sales for a tier-1 managed hosting company while also coordinating the group's production pipeline. Following this, Demetrio embraced the entrepreneurial spirit fully and has co-founded at least a half dozen companies, like Whoop, Inc. (a mobile app platform solution), EmergentApps, LLC (an application and platform technology incubation group) , Disruptive Enterprises, LLC (a wine label that gives back), 90/10 Advisors (supporting sustainable products and solutions), and more.  

Clients and partners have included: AOL, Georgia Tech, the American Red Cross, National Lampoon, Disney South America, Hughes Telematics, the Argentinian Football Association (AFA), Reed Exhibitions, Buffalo Wild Wings, National Lampoon, Stan Lee's Superhero Ball Wars, Fireback Movies, Magmo, the Abby Lee Dance Company and Jo Frost. Demetrio has also worked with Warner Brothers, DreamWorks Music, Reuters America, and, for the last 15 years, the Digital Terrorism & Hate interactive CD-ROM report and mobile app released by the Simon-Wiesenthal Center, a UN sponsored NGO, which annually garners international media attention.

Phalakshi Manjrekar, PhD, MSc, RN

Dr. Phalakshi Manjrekar is the distinguished Nursing Director and Member of the Board of Managers (Trustees) at the P.D. Hinduja National Hospital & Medical Research Centre (HHMRC), a major healthcare delivery provider that has, since its founding in the 1950s, served more than 13 million patients in Mumbai, India. She has also initiated responsibility to widen nursing’s outreach through a growing Hinduja Hospital Mobile Health Clinics venture — that was extended, across 2015, to six Mobile Units aimed to provide free primary health care to 1,000 patients per day, among Mumbai’s outlying urban poor. She also volunteers — in an independent capacity — as a nurse leader meeting primary, maternal and child health needs in remote villages. She serves on the Executive Board of 'NIGH World' — the international organization representing the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health (NIGH) — and is a strategic advisor for the Legacy of Light Film and Transmedia Campaign.

Wayne Kines

Wayne Kines is a Canadian journalist and broadcaster who first became a consultant to the United Nations, in 1968, for Paul Hoffman, the founding Administrator of the Untied Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and for Philippe de Seyne, the then Under Secretary General of the UN for Economic and Social Affairs — in preparation for the UN's 2nd Development Decade. He was a strategic contributor to the UN General Assembly's unanimous 1969 Resolution for Mobilization of Global Public Opinion and the adoption, in 1970, for this related 2nd Development Decade.  In 1971, as Director of the European Office for the UN Centre for Economic & Social Information (CESI), based in Geneva, he worked with all Agencies and Organizations of the UN System to advance the multi-media strategy for this 'Decade.' He also served as the founding Director of Communications for the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) in Nairobi. 

Mr. Kines began a professional mass-media career as a journalist at age 15, serving as ‘District Correspondent’ in rural western Manitoba for the Winnipeg Free Press. In the six decades since, he has traveled the world — in many professional communications and strategic roles, including at the United Nations — seeking to share the ideas and information he considers essential for human progress.

From all of these vantages, Mr. Kines has voluntarily served the founding and development of the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health (NIGH) — overseeing the communications and media strategies worldwide. With NIGH’s Founding Board in 2004 — he crafted NIGH’s first foundational document the ‘Nightingale Declaration for A Healthy World’ — beginning with a phrase modeled after the original UN Charter — “We the nurses and concerned citizens hereby dedicate ourselves to achieve a healthy world.” Launched on NIGH’s original website, this Declaration has since achieved 25,000 individual signanatories — officially representing organizations of millions, from 106 nations. Across the years, he has guided NIGH’s growing grassroots-to-global teams to mobilize global public opinion to achieve the UN Millennium Development Goals, to participate in the UN Post-2015 Agenda in New York and to champion public opinion to achieve the UN Sustainable Development Goals — guiding NIGH toward its top-NGO achievement of UN ECOSOC ‘Special Consultative Status’ in 2018 — to gather grassroots knowledge about the UN SDGs to share at global levels.

Our Advisors

Judith Shamian is the past President and President Emerita of the International Council of Nurses (2013 to 2017), a federation of more than 130 national nurses’ associations representing more than 20 million nurses worldwide. Post ICN presidency, she continues to advocate passionately for a broader role for nurses as leaders, political activists, and partners in the policy-making process, and for a multi-disciplinary approach to health care. Dr. Shamian is also the former President and CEO of the Victorian Order of Nurses (VON) and past president of the Canadian Nurses Association (CNA). She is also a professor at the Lawrence S. Bloomberg Faculty of Nursing at the University of Toronto and was the Executive Director of the Canadian federal government’s Office of Nursing Policy for five years. In addition to her wide-ranging international work, she was Vice President of Nursing at Mount Sinai Hospital in Toronto for 10 years and has held various academic positions since 1989.  

Jean Watson, PhD, RN, AHN-BC, FAAN, (LL -AAN) is a Distinguished Professor and Dean Emerita at the University of Colorado Denver, where she held America's first endowed Chair in Caring Science for 16 years. She is a nursing theorist/author of the Theory of Human Caring and a scholar in caring science. As an author/co-author of over 30 books on caring, Dr. Watson's books range from empirical measurements to new postmodern philosophies,  to 'caring science as sacred science,' to global Caring Literacy. She is the recipient of many national and international awards and honors, including 14 Honorary Doctorates. In 2013, she was recognized as a ‘Living Legend’​ by the American Academy of Nursing, its highest honor. She is Founder and Director of the non-profit organization Watson Caring Science Institute.

Ursula Ward is Chief Executive of the Florence Nightingale Foundation — providing leadership programmes for nurses and midwives who seek to progress their career by increasing standards of care and influencing policy and decision making.  The Foundation hosts an annual Nightingale Commemorative Service at Westminster Abbey and supports individuals to undertake research by contributing to the wider body of evidence for patient benefit. A Registered Nurse since 1985, Ursula began her career in cardiology, general medicine, cancer care and research. In 1999, she was appointed Director of Nursing and Midwifery of the Portsmouth Hospitals NHS Trust. During her twelve years as Chief Executive there, she led a complex change agenda toward a significant reconfiguration of services across three hospitals — culminating in a new hospital funded by a Private Finance Initiative.  

Dave Green is the Director of the Florence Nightingale Museum in London, UK, joining that team in July 2017. His previous work experience involves roles in education, marketing and business development, working for heritage organizations including Nottingham Castle, The Natural History Museum and The National Trust.  Dave was inspired to join the Florence Nightingale Museum as he is excited by the opportunities of working with one of the most famous names in British history, particularly preparing for Nightingale’s 2020 Bi-centenary, exploring the many contemporary links to her substantial achievements, and embedding the Museum further in its local community and the London tourist market.

Risks & Challenges

Nurses get things done, they just do. With the strength of nursing leadership and nursing communities across the globe in support of this project, there is very little risk that this vision won’t be achieved. The nurse leaders and film industry professionals who are overseeing this project have a wealth of successful initiatives and vast networks to see this vision through.

Time is probably our biggest challenge. Ideally we would like to premiere this film on or around May 12, 2020 — the bicentennial of Nightingale’s birth. This is possible if many things align and we are holding this intention.
story_txt:
Calling All Nurses & Nurse Appreciators to Join Us on This Noble Mission Just one dollar each can make it happen!Please spread the word to others who care! A Bold Step for NursingNurses are everywhere, in every corner of the world, working day and night, helping others in need. Their impact is immeasurable. As we embark on 2020, the bicentennial year of the birth of Florence Nightingale, who is considered the mother of modern nursing, we are taking the bold step of bringing nursing’s story into the spotlight on the international stage, with a feature film and transmedia campaign called Legacy of Light. We take this step with the support of countless Nursing Organizations and nurses around the world including:      • International Council of Nurses     • Commonwealth Nurses and Midwives Federation     • Florence Nightingale Foundation, London, UK     • Florence Nightingale Museum, London, UK     • American Academy of Nursing     • American Nurses Association     • Florida Atlantic University School of Nursing     • International Nurse Coach Association     • Nightingale Initiative for Global Health     • Rutgers University School of Nursing     • University of Massachusetts Worcester Graduate School of Nursing     • University of Virginia School of Nursing     • Watson Caring Science Institute     • many others now in progressA powerful script written by Nurse Researchers and Nightingale Scholars, Barbara Dossey, PhD, RN, FAAN, and Deva-Marie Beck, PhD, RN, Legacy of Light tells the story of the dynamic, trailblazing nursing pioneer, Florence Nightingale, and her continuing impact on the world. The film is currently in development, and has attracted the interest of “A”-list acting and directing talent. The profession of nursing and the life story of Florence Nightingale deserve nothing less!Our PlanFeature FilmThe plan is to premiere the Legacy of Light movie during 2020, the bicentennial of Nightingale’s birth. Our objective is to reach the 3.4 million nurses in the US and the estimated 22 million nurses and midwives who globally carry the light of healing into the 21st century and advocate for health as a basic human right. As well, we seek to reach those who are considering nursing as a profession. We further want to reach those whose encounter with a nurse has touched their lives. Strategically, we need your help to reach a global audience ready to welcome this true story of an historic feminine leader, visionary, and social change-maker.Transmedia CampaignAn ambitious transmedia campaign for Legacy of Light is also in preparation to ensure worldwide access to the film and create opportunities for deepening the awareness and experience of audiences. This includes developing educational opportunities that flow from the material.  We are planning to integrate a far-reaching, multi-language commitment to our “Nightingale Declaration for A Healthy World,” as well as developing learning opportunities for K-12 and a broad range of media, events and interactive activities for North American and worldwide audiences. A TV Series, “Light Beyond Borders” is also being developed to complement the feature film —bringing the spirit and legacy of Florence Nightingale into the 21st century with nurses featured on the frontlines of health challenges across the globe.Expanding and Supporting NIGHAll current contributions will assist the promotion, production, distribution and versioning of the independent feature film ‘Legacy of Light.’  All revenue—beyond these film production and promotion costs—will sustain the further initiatives of the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health (NIGH). Meet the NURSES who wrote the Legacy of Light Screenplay and are leading this charge!

 
The force behind this vision — that is quickly becoming a reality — is the work of two nurse researchers/scholars who have devoted decades exploring the life of Florence Nightingale.  They have spent years developing this screenplay, which is based on the award-winning book Florence Nightingale: Mystic, Visionary, Healer by Dr. Dossey. They have both devoted endless energy to promote both the practice and the future of nursing. 
Together they founded the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health (NIGH), a grassroots, nurse-inspired movement to increase global concern for and commitment to human health. In 'Special Consultative Status' with the United Nations Economic & Social Council, NIGH’s Mission is to engage the common values and wisdom of millions of nurses, midwives and concerned citizens, and to act as a catalyst for the transformation of individuals, communities and society for the achievement of a healthy world. Founded in 2004, NIGH has a history of successful initiatives which include the Nightingale Declaration for a Healthy World; At the Heart of It All; Daring, Caring & Sharing to Save Mothers' Lives and co-founding the 2010 International Year of the Nurse / Nightingale Centennial. This Legacy of Light Feature Film & Transmedia Campaign is NIGH's newest project.  Barbara Dossey, PhD, RN, AHN-BC, FAAN, HWNC-BC / Screenwriter Dr. Dossey is a leading Florence Nightingale scholar and the world’s only nurse biographer of Nightingale. With meticulous scholarship, Dr. Dossey’s award-winning Florence Nightingale: Mystic, Visionary, Healer (2010) documents the struggles and achievements of a woman who defied the conventions and standards of Victorian England to blaze her own path. Dr. Dossey’s scholarship in crafting this illustrated biography includes numerous archival photographs, drawings, letters, maps, and a riveting narrative that creates a portrait of this complex, larger-than-life woman who lived for 90 years and is still a source of inspiration today. Dr. Dossey serves as an International Co-Director, of the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health (NIGH), and is co-author of the award-winning textbook Florence Nightingale Today: Healing, Leadership, Global Action (2005). She has been the guest editor of a number of nursing journals and author of many articles, chapters and books, all revealing her in-depth study and complex analysis of Nightingale’s life and work. Her collaborative global nursing project — NIGH— and the Nightingale Declaration Campaign (NDC) have been developed to strengthen individual commitment toward achieving a healthy world as a priority objective for action by ordinary citizens, by civil society organizations and by all governments, local and national. Dr. Dossey is a Fellow of the American Academy of Nursing (FAAN), Co-Director of the International Nurse Coach Association and is certified in Holistic Nursing (AHN-BC) and Health & Wellness Nurse Coaching (HWNC-BC). She is an 12-time recipient of the prestigious American Journal of Nursing Book of the Year Award and has received  many awards during her remarkable, prolific career — including: Visionary Award by the Academy of Integrative Health and Medicine, Pioneer of Integrative Medicine Award from the Aspen Center for Integrative Health, the Distinguished Alumni Award from Baylor University, TWU 100 Great Nursing Alumni from Texas Woman's University and Holistic Nurse of the Year from the American Holistic Nurses' Association.Deva-Marie Beck, PhD, RN / ScreenwriterDr. Beck is a Nightingale scholar, multi-media specialist, author and educator — serving, in all these roles — as an International Co-Director of NIGH, the Nightingale Initiative for Global Health. She has developed numerous multi-media approaches to inform a growing audience concerned with global health. These include online feature articles, videos and photo-essays — coordinating with nurses and media professionals globally. In 2014, she was commissioned by the WHO Health Workforce Department to create 'At the Heart of It All: Nurses & Midwives for Universal Health Coverage’ — premiered at the WHO Global Forum for Chief Nursing/Midwifery Officers in Geneva and featured many times since at WHO conferences regionally and worldwide. In 2008, she  collaborated with WHO and a global array of nursing leaders to co produce a video for WHO’s 60th anniversary — ‘Nurses & Midwives: Now More Than Ever for a Healthy World’ in eight language versions.Dr. Beck also oversees the development of NIGH’s team of NGO Representatives to the United Nations. She is co-author of the award-winning Florence Nightingale Today: Healing, Leadership, Global Action and has since written many related articles and textbook chapters to pioneer a broader understanding of Nightingale’s relevance to the 21st century — most recently ‘A Brief History of the United Nations and Nursing: A Healthy World Is Our Common Future,’ in the textbook ‘A New Era in Global Health: Nursing & The United Nations 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.’ In addition to her doctoral work in Nursing History & International Development Education, she holds undergraduate degrees in Nursing, Health Sciences and Theatre Arts.What We Need and How You Can HelpAs of this writing, we have verbal commitment for the film’s $15 million production budget. The details are being finalized and we will post updates as progress is made.Where we need your participations is in helping fund the creation and launch of the transmedia campaign that will help us reach and educate a worldwide audience (see description under the Plan section). We have set a target of $250,000 to help support the enormous amount of work around the film and the creation and launch of the transmedia campaign. While this is significantly smaller than the typical Hollywood budget for worldwide promotion of an important film, it will give us a strong position for a powerful and impactful launch — and, as nurses, we know how to get things done!This funding will be used to:
Launch and maintain a worldwide social media campaign
Develop and launch a worldwide marketing campaign
Develop educational materials that accompany the film
Support speeches and events that promote this work
Help fund the resources needed to reach audiences across the globe:
Transmedia Campaign Producer
Campaign Project Manager
Social Media Coordinator
Digital and Graphics support
Communications Coordinator
Strategic Partners Coordinator
Legal and Expert Counsel


We believe that — with the support of as little as $1.00 from nurses and $5.00 from those who appreciate what a nurse has done for them — our goal is achievable. We plan to expand coordination with nursing organizations, global health organizations, like-minded nonprofits, nursing colleges and universities, foundations, as well as pharmaceutical and healthcare companies — to bring in sponsorships at the same time. Those interested, please contact: info@legacyoflightthemovie.com.Other Ways You Can HelpYou may not be in a position to contribute, but you can still participate. Here’s how:
Help get the word out. We want everyone knowing and talking about it!
Share with friends, family, groups or organizations that might be interested.
Take it to your church, temple, mosque, synagogue, school, campus, book club
Make use of Indiegogo share tools!
The Impact We Can Achieve Together Through the Legacy of Light project we can, together, put a global spotlight on Nursing. By engaging audiences everywhere, we are sharing the critical role of nurses throughout the world and are advocating global health worldwide.The story of Florence Nightingale is a powerful example of the positive impact single individuals can have in meeting the urgent issues of global health.  By bringing broad exposure to the inspiring story of Florence Nightingale, we celebrate her as a nurse, a visionary, an agent of change, and hero to so many, while opening up the potential to inspire others to make a difference, whether small or large.“If we can transform—by a few years of persistent effort—the habits of centuries, our progress will not have been slow but amazingly rapid!”   Florence Nightingale“Health is not only to be well—but to use well—every power we have to use.”   Florence NightingaleOur Track RecordWe are very fortunate to have gathered an extraordinary team and group of advisors, all of whom have extensive, successful track records on both the national and international stage. Please see below.Our TeamIn addition to Barbara Dossey, PhD, RN, FAAN, and Deva-Marie Beck, PhD, RN (Bios above), please be sure to read about these people and their inspiring profiles. Cynthia A. Phillips, PhD Dr. Cynthia A. Phillips is the Founder & CEO of The Disruptive Factory. She is an economist/agricultural economist as well as a business consultant to for-profit and social enterprises with over 20 years of experience in the areas of strategic planning, marketing, branding, analytics, big data, business development and global expansion.Former Director of International Marketing & Risk Management at American Express, she currently consults with technology companies and start-ups such as Cisco Systems, Full Cycle Bioplastics, BioSerie, and Riverbed. She currently serves as the interim Chief Marketing and Sustainability Officer for Ascalon, LLC, a disruptive consumer and commercial bio-based products company. Phillips sits on several non-profit boards and advisory boards of start-ups including the Akilah Institute, OROECO, and accelerators such as Think Beyond Plastic. Phillips served as the Founder of GlobalShiftTV, G Media Partners, and Disruptive Spirits. Phillips is serving as the CEO of Good Causes Corp and is the architect of Passport2Good, an engagement app to serve citizens and social enterprises.Bianca GoodloeGoodloe Law is a boutique entertainment, intellectual property, film finance, and corporate law practice providing counsel on all aspects of motion picture and television development, financing, production and distribution. They represent writers, directors, producers, actors, investors, strategic financiers, private lenders, insurance brokers and tax credit brokers. A Registered Nurse since 1985, Ursula began her career in cardiology, general medicine, cancer care and research. In 1999, she was appointed Director of Nursing and Midwifery of the Portsmouth Hospitals NHS Trust. During her twelve years as Chief Executive there, she led a complex change agenda toward a significant reconfiguration of services across three hospitals — culminating in a new hospital funded by a Private Finance Initiative.  Dave Green is the Director of the Florence Nightingale Museum in London, UK, joining that team in July 2017. His previous work experience involves roles in education, marketing and business development, working for heritage organizations including Nottingham Castle, The Natural History Museum and The National Trust.  Dave was inspired to join the Florence Nightingale Museum as he is excited by the opportunities of working with one of the most famous names in British history, particularly preparing for Nightingale’s 2020 Bi-centenary, exploring the many contemporary links to her substantial achievements, and embedding the Museum further in its local community and the London tourist market.Risks & ChallengesNurses get things done, they just do. With the strength of nursing leadership and nursing communities across the globe in support of this project, there is very little risk that this vision won’t be achieved. The nurse leaders and film industry professionals who are overseeing this project have a wealth of successful initiatives and vast networks to see this vision through.Time is probably our biggest challenge. Ideally we would like to premiere this film on or around May 12, 2020 — the bicentennial of Nightingale’s birth. This is possible if many things align and we are holding this intention.

story:
The Producing Team

Miki Blak, Writer, Producer, Director

Miki Blak is a Northeast Ohio based Writer/Producer/Director and founder of NBlak Productions. She is a storyteller at heart and knows the value of creating an exciting and engaging visual story. She says, “It’s about an emotional connection with the people you see on the screen. Whether you hate them, or you love them, you are vested in what happens to them.” 

Miki’s background includes radio, where she earned an Outstanding DJ Announcer award as an on-air personality; and Television as a camera operator, writer and floor director at several Top 15 Network Affiliate Television stations in Cleveland, Ohio and Atlanta, Georgia. 

She is an Award-Winning filmmaker and has written, produced and directed short films, music videos and short subject videos. Additionally, Miki created an internship program with her production company. The program is designed to jump start the careers of those interested in working in the film industry by giving them an opportunity to work on an actual production. 

Miki holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Mass Media Communications and a minor in Theatre from The University of Akron. 

Tamiko Ruby J, Producer

Tamiko is a successful business woman and entrepreneur for over 20 years. Her career experience includes: Professional Makeup Artist for Television, Film, Theater and Print Media. Her work can be seen in the award-winning film 50Fathers, the film A Fathers Love and the upcoming dramatic series, The Land FAU.

The Production

We are looking to raise an additional $10,000 to complete the funding for this project. We have already raised some investor funds for this low budget film. Please be advised; don't let the words low budget fool you into thinking this project will be low quality. Movies now exist in a time where award-winning films are being shot on consumer cell phones, proving that low budgets can still yield an amazing quality of production.

Our goal is to be able to provide paid jobs for local talent and crew throughout northeast Ohio. The funds will also be used for some equipment purchases, securing locations, wardrobe, props screening and marketing efforts. 

The Story

Dr. Abigail Williams is a Forensic Psychologist who becomes selfishly excited when the case of the City vs. Hettie Dallman lands on her plate.  Hettie Dallman is on trial for brutally murdering both of her parents. She has barely spoken a word since it has all happened. This is the case that Abby has been waiting for.  She dives headstrong into the case, neglecting her husband and causing deep splinters in their already struggling marriage.

As Abby digs deeper into Hettie’s past, she ends up unlocking disturbing secrets in her own. It’s not long before she realizes she may be dealing with more than what she bargained for.

This is a story about family denial. This film examines what happens to a person who has been abused as a child and then forced to pretend it didn’t happen. What does that do to the person’s self-esteem? What type of person does this create? How does a person cope with what has happened to them when they are never allowed to acknowledge it? How do they live with the hurt and self-blame?  

It’s about family secrets and hidden shame that everyone knows about, but no one dare talk about. It doesn’t just go away it festers and simmers just below the surface. The hurt becomes anger, the anger, hate and in Hettie’s case revenge. 

Hush is a gritty family drama that exposes the pain and shame of denial and abuse. It's a challenging topic, but we feel it's necessary to bring a story like this to the audience.  Most likely, you or someone you know has gone through the struggles outlined in this story. You will be entertained, educated and definitely not the same once you experience this emotional tale.

Risks & Challenges

The producers are aware that there all always risks involved with producing a feature film. However, we believe in the story and it's impact on our audience. The producers used their own personal finances to create the concept trailer for the film (seen above) in order to give an idea of the feel and dynamic of the movie (and that's just the first scene!).  These two women have already overcome many challenges and obstacles for this films' production. They have been working on this project since 2012 and now, they are closer to the finish line than ever before and the final funding will help them cross into production by the fall of 2018. One of producer Tamiko's favorite lines is "Teamwork makes the dream work!" We have a great team and we believe it's time for our dream to come into fruition.

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you are not able to contribute financially, we still need your help & support in promoting this campaign to your friends, family and on your social media....maybe they can support our Movie Campaign? Indiegogo has provided plenty of sharing tools to make this really easy via Email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn and other websites, so we encourage you to SHARE this Campaign with everyone you know!

Thank You!

We would like to extend our gratitude for your interest in our Movie project.   We appreciate your time and your support. Thanks again,  from the producers of Hush!

story:
Short Film "Jeff"

Jeff pays a visit to his mother to celebrate the birthday of his father, who had passed one year earlier. During this special visit, he also plans to reveal his true sexual orientation to his mother despite his fear of the possibility of his mother disowning him.

Will Jeff finally be able to tell his mother? Will she accept him? This film is based on a true coming out story and explores the idea of "being true to yourself" versus "family expectations" in the Asian community. 

Why Is It Important?

The coming out process has been quite difficult for many of my Asian American friends in the LGBT community. Some of them contemplated not coming out at all because they didn't want to disappoint their family and they had to live up to certain expectations. I wanted to make this film which focuses on their struggles and their complex emotions formed by expectations, family upbringing, and the community.

How Your Donation Will Be Used

Crew ($1000)

Our filmmakers are all professionals. Great techniques and skills always come with the cost. In order to make this film perfect, we need to gather the best filmmakers we could get.

Equipment ($600)

Filmmaking always needs the large amount of equipment such as camera, lights, and sound deices.

Food ($300)

We need to feed our cast and crew, and this is actually the most important element in the film making. Our cast and crew will need to work almost 12 hours each day. The meal is the only thing that comforts them in this hard-working environment. 

Art Dept and Wardrobe ($500)

The film is "Art." We need to make everything look perfect in front of the camera. For example, we need to dress our set, get outfits for our cast, and prepare props.

Meet Our Amazing Team!

Natsu Shibata (Director)

Natsu was born and raised in Tokyo, Japan. Influenced by her mother who showed American films to her instead of Japanese kid's TV shows, she became to have an interest in directing films. Few years later, she moved to the United State and studied about film making in Southern Illinois University Carbondale. After she graduated the school, She worked in Japanese TV shows and Japanese Commercial production. Then she moved to LA and studied in New York Film Academy MA program.  Her thesis film was selected many film festivals including Seal Beach Film Festival for  "The Best Student Short Film". Recently she is working as a director for web series and commercials.

Shaun Wu (Writer/Actor)

Shaun Wu is an actor based in Los Angeles. He graduated from the Stella Adler Acting Conservatory in New York and the Graduate Acting Program (MFA) at Harvard University (American Repertory Theater). He has performed on the stage in New York, Boston, and Russia. He has an undergraduate degree was in International Business from Sophia University in Tokyo, Japan and he spent several years working in finance prior to becoming an actor. Theater credits include: Macbeth, Three Sisters, Pirate Princess, Dying For It, and many more. He is currently auditioning for various film/TV and commercial projects in Los Angeles. 

Taka Toyama (Producer)

Taka came to the U.S. four years ago from Japan and he found his passion in producing the films. His interest in telling the story had grown as he started performing stand-up comedy in Japan and he keeps creating the comedy scripts as a writer. He also has an experience as a local producer in TV commercial industry in Tokyo. His recent work Matchstick Willie has been selected for The Fatherhood Image Film Festival.

Lastly...

We just want to THANK YOU for reading this campaign! Even if you do not have money to donate, that's totally fine! We are just happy that you have an interest in this film!

story:
Poster

 

 

Story of Film 

A young woman, Valerie, was kidnapped as a child by a pagan witch who attempted to perform a ritual on her in preparation to eat her. However, Valerie escaped and returned to her family. Now fifteen years later, after moving away, returns to her birth town of Mikulov, CZ to visit her estranged Uncle after her parents have died. Although while on her way there she meets her former kidnapper, the witch Julia,  but Valerie doesn't know that it is her. This also triggers strange cannibalistic thoughts within Valerie and she struggles to understand why the thoughts are happening.  So now Julia's goal becomes to lure Valerie into her clutches and finish the job she started all those years ago!

Short Summary

My name is Broncacco Cozzo, I am currently a student at Prague Film School and owner of Masked Lemur Productions, and am working to complete my graduation film. I am a passionate film maker who makes films that are sound oriented, and as well as practical special effects heavy (Meaning no CGI). I believe that these things are the greatest tools in film making so I am determined to create a world with them. We will be posting updates to the campaign and the pre production process as we go. 

 

 

Director of Photography 

Venkatesh Margasahayam is an experienced cinematographer working in Prague, CZ who has worked on countless short films, commercials, and other productions in the film industry. He will be the one helping to create the beautiful shots within the film.

 

Sound Department/ Editor

Our head of sound and editor for the film is Eshaan Rajadhyaksha. Eshaan has worked as a skilled editor and sound recordist for many years. He has done a range of films, commercials, and as well as helping out with student film projects. 

 

 

More Crew will be added as the film pre- production progresses... 

 

What We Need & What You Get

As we all know film making is expensive, even for low budget films. Contributions made will give us the following:

-Equipment

-Better Actors

-Better Visual effects/ Art Direction

-Transportation

-Locations 

-Ect..... 

And what you get is: 

-Credits in movie, and other movie related perks

-The satisfaction of supporting Indie film 

-Helping a student

-A stunning visual and sound oriented film

 

Location 

We will be filming the film in the beautiful town of Mikulov, Czech Republic. The town is famous for its wine and vineyards along the Holy hill of Svaty Kopacek. We will be using a basement for the lair of the witch, and some other fun places around the town. 

 

 

 

The Impact

The film will be on the theme of Animalism and the animal that resides within us all. It will commentate on how as humans deep down there is an animal inside waiting to be unleashed.  

The film will also provide jobs for people outside of school and as well as in school. This is a valuable experience to help propel these people forward in their film making career. 

Plus will give you something to show the grand kids one day... "Hey sonny this was an awesome film I helped create when I was about your age."

 

Risks & Challenges

As we also know the film making industry is full of risks and challenges if not getting enough funded. Some of these risks include: 

-Lower tier actors, better charge more

-Lost locations, due lack of funding or permission 

-Lack of SFX/make up needed for full visual effect

-Less experienced crew, as better and more experienced crew charges more

-Lower quality equipment

-In many cases not even being able to shoot.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If it isn't possible to help us with a contribution you can always help us in these ways:

-Tell your friends and family about the project.

-Send good vibes. 

-Recommend other ways of possibly getting funding. 

-Recommend people in Prague that might want to be apart of the crew. 

-Support Masked Lemur Productions on FB and (Instagram once filming has started), as we will be posting updates there.

story:
A Documentary on Champion Riddick ‘Big Daddy’ Bowe

Help us make this project a reality

A Documentary on World Heavyweight Champion Riddick ‘Big Daddy’ Bowe

HELP US MAKE THIS PROJECT A REALITY
A Documentary on World Heavyweight Champion Riddick ‘Big Daddy’ Bowe
This documentary is more than about boxing, it's a story about unconditional love. A man who loves the world and often has his love abused, mistreated and misused. The champion will share how his draws from his childhood being raised by a single mother with 12 brothers and sisters. How that created his ﬁghting spirit to keep moving forward and persevering through life's adversities. A story of how growing up with a single mother was his greatest motivation and inspiration. Although a public ﬁgure, few people know the heart of this champion and his true personality outside the ring. He is opening up to sharing his story---both his triumphs and his ﬂaws--to the world in a compelling and gripping documentary.
Riddick Bowe has been known by many names and has held numerous titles over the course of his illustrious former career as a boxer. His most well-known legacy is that of the former undisputed Two-Time Heavyweight Boxing Champion and Olympic Silver Medalist Riddick ‘Big Daddy’ Bowe, the ﬁghting great who always sought greatness and was never afraid of achieving it. His love and passion for boxing drove him cement a proud legacy that is still remembered today.
From humble beginnings to great fame, it was a tough climb for Bowe. His epic rivalry with fellow champion Evander Holyﬁeld was the talk back in the day, garnering both champions their fair share of notoriety with Bowe as the ﬁrst ﬁghter to ever knock Holyﬁeld out! There is a lot about their rivalry that the public doesn't know one being their long lasting friendship. 
This documentary will take it's audience on a journey from Brooklyn to Florida as on a bus tour with stops in Atlanta, Washington DC, Philadelphia, Orlando and Tampa. 

 
 

 

What the expenses cover? 

  • Production Equipment,  Bus Tour, payroll for crew(Director, Cinematographer, Set Dressing, Production Office Rental, Legal Fees, Construction, Set Design, Sound, hair, set medic, stock footage, travel, hotels, producer, director, post production,  makeup, wardrobe, grips, security)  locations, insurance, food expenses, health food options, physical trainer, healthcare expenses, covid-19 protocols, 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't help financially doesn't mean you can't help get the word out and make some noise.
