story:
Hello! Get to know us! :)

We are a group of passionate film students crowdfunding our final short film. FAUVE FOREST is an LGBT short film that we couldn't be prouder or more enthusiastic to bring to life.

 

In FAUVE FOREST we meet Rian, a young artist at a crossroads in his life. Late at night, while painting a portrait of his boyfriend Fresco, Rian suddenly finds himself alone in his homemade studio. Fresco mysteriously vanishes from the room as Rian, preoccupied, continues painting to include himself in the image. Time passes, and Rian finds himself in his own painted utopia. Alone, he must navigate the world he created and confront dark secrets within...

Utilizing painted sets to bring the world of FAUVE FOREST to life, we aim to expand our developing skill sets to produce a fantastical LGBT short film full of colour, life and mystery. We aim to create something representative of the struggle for young people of colour to be seen and feel comfortable in their sexuality.

 

The Campaign

To create FAUVE FOREST and make it come to life, we rely on generous crowdfunders. Our target considers all factors of the film's production, from casting, sets, props, and costumes to transport, catering, and accommodation. Every department of our film is vital and your generosity will help make each one a reality.

Backing to our campaign allows you to be apart of FAUVE FOREST's production, and our range of perks will let you receive an array of goodies. Including a Digital Download of the film, Posters and have your name in the film's final credits.

Flexible funding allows us to still receive donations even if we do not achieve the full amount. If this is the case, we will have to make some cut-backs to the film, however, we still aim to make FAUVE FOREST as fully realised as we can for release in April 2021.

 

Who are we?

We are a group of 3rd Year Film students with a diverse range of talents and specialties, all of us passionate about film and telling stories on the big screen.

Having connected together as friends over the three years of our course, our crew have often worked together on other successful short films in the past that also contributed towards our degree.

Your contribution allows us to realise our final degree film and graduate with a film we are proud to have made while pushing us further in our aspiring careers in the film industry.

 

Risks & Challenges

Immediately evident is the challenge put on us by producing this film alongside the COVID-19 pandemic. We understand this as a risk and have all completed on-set COVID safety courses to keep our production running with a low-risk of the virus spreading. Additionally, we will be working with a small cast and crew inside large studio spaces. Working with fewer actors in an accessible and controlled environment ensures both safety and ease of production.
story_txt:
Hello! Get to know us! :)
We are a group of passionate film students crowdfunding our final short film. FAUVE FOREST is an LGBT short film that we couldn't be prouder or more enthusiastic to bring to life.
 
In FAUVE FOREST we meet Rian, a young artist at a crossroads in his life. Late at night, while painting a portrait of his boyfriend Fresco, Rian suddenly finds himself alone in his homemade studio. Fresco mysteriously vanishes from the room as Rian, preoccupied, continues painting to include himself in the image. Time passes, and Rian finds himself in his own painted utopia. Alone, he must navigate the world he created and confront dark secrets within...
Utilizing painted sets to bring the world of FAUVE FOREST to life, we aim to expand our developing skill sets to produce a fantastical LGBT short film full of colour, life and mystery. We aim to create something representative of the struggle for young people of colour to be seen and feel comfortable in their sexuality.

 
The Campaign
To create FAUVE FOREST and make it come to life, we rely on generous crowdfunders. Our target considers all factors of the film's production, from casting, sets, props, and costumes to transport, catering, and accommodation. Every department of our film is vital and your generosity will help make each one a reality.
Backing to our campaign allows you to be apart of FAUVE FOREST's production, and our range of perks will let you receive an array of goodies. Including a Digital Download of the film, Posters and have your name in the film's final credits.
Flexible funding allows us to still receive donations even if we do not achieve the full amount. If this is the case, we will have to make some cut-backs to the film, however, we still aim to make FAUVE FOREST as fully realised as we can for release in April 2021.
 

Who are we?
We are a group of 3rd Year Film students with a diverse range of talents and specialties, all of us passionate about film and telling stories on the big screen.
Having connected together as friends over the three years of our course, our crew have often worked together on other successful short films in the past that also contributed towards our degree.
Your contribution allows us to realise our final degree film and graduate with a film we are proud to have made while pushing us further in our aspiring careers in the film industry.
 

Risks & Challenges
Immediately evident is the challenge put on us by producing this film alongside the COVID-19 pandemic. We understand this as a risk and have all completed on-set COVID safety courses to keep our production running with a low-risk of the virus spreading. Additionally, we will be working with a small cast and crew inside large studio spaces. Working with fewer actors in an accessible and controlled environment ensures both safety and ease of production.

story:
Short Summary

We are looking to raise money for our short film "Godfrey's Light."

In a time where the exposure of racism and historical injustice have brought many to debate and deny, our film begs the question what happens when we are forced to answer to the source of our existence. The film focuses on the concept that we all originated from stardust. We will explore this concept by showing how even though humanity has evolved into human forms, the remnants of who we used to be remain within us. We all come from the same place and are composed of the same particles that didn’t initially have a moral compass to impact the universe, but we have since evolved into more complicated beings. In the film, the characters live in a world where executions of criminals are televised events, complicit in a society that publicizes an immoral code of justice. What happens when that original stardust returns to show all of them who they really are?  

What We Need & What You Get

We are setting a goal of $2,000. We understand that not everyone will be able to contribute but even sharing our campaign would help tremendously! 

If you donate $20 or more we will thank you in the credits of our film. 

The Impact

We feel Godfrey’s Light is a film that needs to be made now since the Black Lives Matter movement has shed light on the numerous accounts of police brutality and unfair treatment of African Americans. Even in today’s age where we are arguably in the most progressive state we have ever been in, black voices are still being silenced.

South Carolina has a longstanding connection to this affliction such as events like the execution in 1939 of George Stinney, an African American child who was denied the right to a fair trial. Through the eyes of our main character Zoey, who is herself preparing to witness such an execution on TV, we are able to see her fear when she realizes she is not that different from the man scheduled to die- and ultimately, neither is anyone else. 

It is our hope that Godfrey’s Light will give a voice to those that feel overlooked and reassure that representation of African American characters in film matters and are needed now more than ever. 

Risks & Challenges

It is difficult enough to make a short film as a student, but COVID-19 presents its own challenges. We are prepared to push through whatever is thrown at us to see that this powerful message is told. 

Our main crew is Director Darian O’Neil, writer Desiree Winns, and Producer Rachel Smith. O’Neil and Smith are students at the University of South Carolina, so our plan to secure equipment is to utilize this resource as we have done for our past student films. Pearl Fryar: the Man with a Green Thumb is one example of our past projects where we utilized the services provided at USC. This film has been in festivals such as Indie Grits, Carrboro Film Fest, and the Josiah Media Festival.

Other Ways You Can Help

To share our campaign you can use the Indiegogo share tools! We also have an Instagram for our film @godfreyslight.

story:
Doctor Peter Chojnowski has a doctorate from Fordham University in NYC. He has taught at 8 institutions of higher learning and has written and lectured around the world concerning the apparitions at Fatima. After finding anomalies in the photographic evidence, he established a non-profit organization to identify and research the actual historical life of Sister Lucy dos Santos of Fatima. In the course of this investigation, it was determined that an impostor took the place of the actual seer. Our purpose is to provide scientific evidence of the imposture, to identify the actual crime, to determine the identity of the impostor, and to expose those involved in the crime.

A film would bring to light what could be the most significant case of an impostor in the history of the Church and the cover up that continues to this day.

Only a film which goes out to the world will bring to the attention of all the magnitude of this crime and its effects on the world.

We at Sister Lucy Truth publicly declare that based on the evidence presented here, we have found it to be morally and scientifically certain that the woman portrayed to the world as “Sister Lucy,” from her first public appearance on May 13, 1967 to her death on February 13, 2005, was not the same person as Sister Lucy, Seer of Fatima and Visionary who predicted the Miracle of the Sun on October 13, 1917.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Sandy De Lisle, lead writer and executive producer of You're OUT!—a comedy feature film that portrays youth sports in all their glory—and excessiveness. As a mom who raised two travel baseball players, I've spent a lot of time watching kids play ball. And after hundreds of hours of observing from the bleachers, I can definitely say this: Youth sports are wacked!

It's not like when I grew up, and kids played multiple sports through high school. Now it's all about choosing one sport by middle school and specializing. For baseball, that means private hitting, pitching, and catching lessons, $200 bats, cross-country travel-team road trips, and the penultimate experience: the college baseball showcase! 

As a writer, I started wondering, "How far would a parent go to get their kid recruited by a D-1 college baseball team?" I reached out to my friend Rick Herrejon (who's in the process of raising a travel baseball kid), and we came up with the concept for the film:  A dad so obsessed with his son playing in the Majors that he loses his job and completely ignores the needs of his wife and daughter.

The film tips its hat to classic 80s movies and filmmakers like National Lampoon's Vacation and John Hughes: It's a good old-fashioned father-son road trip with a modern-day twist. Plus, because I'm all about rescuing dogs, we added a dog hero who's representing for all dogs labeled as "pit bulls."

By contributing to our film you will:

  • Make people laugh (Not just "tee hee." We're talking lose-control-of-bodily-function guffaws.)
  • Help get Chicago creatives back to work (It's been a long freakin' year.)
  • Normalize ALL types of dogs as having the potential to be family pets
  • Score some cool You're OUT! movie perks

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our total budget is $250,000. That's the equivalent of one of Diana Prince's hair scrunchies in Wonder Woman 1984.  We're keeping our costs low by avoiding magic lassos and staying local—we only make it look like a road trip to Arizona. Thank you, green screens!

Plus, since we're so sure this film is going to sell (we already have a distributor, Glass House), our partners Ladie K Productions and Paper Star Video have agreed to film equity as partial compensation.

Our crowdfunding campaign is seeking $56,000 to cover our initial costs. Why $56K instead of $250K? Because 56 is former Chicago White Sox World Series pitcher Mark Buehrle's number, and he loves dogs.   

Seriously, though, we didn't want to overwhelm you. $250K is a lot of baseball bats. We figure $56K is enough to get us through the first phase of the project. And, hey, people kept contributing to Super Trooper 2's Indiegogo campaign after they met their goal. In fact, by promising an additional car chase scene, Super Troopers 2 (ST2) exceeded their goal by $2 million. Now, as much as we love ST2, $2 million is Hollywood pricing. If you all 9th-inning rally behind us,  we'll add a car chase scene too. Only we'll do it for a mere $300K over our goal. Now that's Midwestern values right there.

Here's a breakdown of our budget:

  • Cast–$50,000
  • Post-Production–$100,000
  • Production Crew–$50,000
  • Legal & Insurance–$25,000
  • Catering/Lodging–$15,000
  • Costumes/Makeup–$5,000
  • Cleaning/COVID–$5,000

 

Check out our awesome perks! From social media shout-outs to You're OUT! swag to cameo appearances for you or your dog, there's something for everyone!

Check out our FAQs for more details about perk fulfillment.

And if you'd prefer to contribute without claiming a perk, we're down with that—just click the pink "Back It" button at the top of the campaign page (next to the video) and contribute any amount you'd like (no perks attached).

All the funds we collect from this campaign will be used toward the production or distribution of the film, and we won't stop until we're premiering at Sundance. Or streaming to your living room. Whichever comes first. 

Risks & Challenges

Indiegogo recommended we add this section, but quite frankly, we're making this movie no matter what. Because we're closers. Like Cubs Hall of Famer Lee Smith.

Other Ways You Can Help

No one is a benchwarmer on our team! We'd love your money but would be thrilled if you contribute by sharing our campaign with your friends and family. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools on this page, follow us on Facebook, or share our website.

Meet the Production Team

Sandy De Lisle, Lead Writer & Executive Producer

Rick Herrejon, Cowriter

Katharin (K) Mraz, Director/Producer

John Klein, Director of Photography

 

Meet the Talent

Tom Malloy 

"Rod"

Billy Dec

"Kurt Rock"

Bobbie

"Matterhorn"

Rickie

"Loose Dog/Matterhorn Understudy"

 

 

Nancy Faust

Musical Contributor

story:
Short Summary

Hi. I’m writer and producer Jerry Thompson. I really think we've got a real gem in this proposed film project. I even feel a "calling" to make this happen! After writing, producing and directing a feature film in 2018 that was approved for a national theatrical distribution, I am even more excited about this new project!

I am the writer and producer of the Native American feature film “BRIGHT EYES” (approx. 2 hours).  It’s the true story of a shy, young woman of the Omaha Tribe whose love for her people and other Native Americans helped her overcome her fear. So, she spoke out against injustice and helped bring about the landmark court case of Chief Standing Bear vs. General George Crook where a Native American was first regarded as a “person” with legal rights!

I first heard about Bright Eyes when I was a publicity person for the Native film "Windwalker. " My passion is that this film will not just be “based on a true story”, but unlike in other big films about real people, everything will be true and authentic…no exaggerations or false events.

What also attracted me to this story is that even though many of the white people were bad, Bright Eyes and Standing Bear received a lot of help from good whites….it’s a story where red and white people unite to fight injustice.  I see it as “Dances with Wolves” meets “Amistad.”

Wouldn’t it be great to see the Kickstarter record be broken with the true Native American story with the hero being a woman? We have set our goal at $6 million…that's 300,000 people giving $20 and they will receive a reward too! We all can make it happen!!

Here's a small part of a speech that Bright Eyes actually gave in New York in 1880 which reveals her heart:

"Today Standing Bear has nothing but his blanket and has left his wife and family out on the plains while he comes to you for help. It seems to us at times that the great Government treats us more like dogs than human beings. I believe, however, that we are God’s people, and He will not desert us. It brings Christ nearer to my heart to think that he suffered so when he was on earth. Please believe that we are human beings, and that we can love and hate just as you do.”

"How can we help but be degraded and savage under such a system? I only wonder that any spark of manhood and self-respect has remained in any of my people. Yet I have seen my race as noble men and women as any I have ever seen among your people, or read of in your histories. But, when I began this letter, I did not intend to be led off in this strain, but some of the bitterness would creep out, and perhaps, it is just as well, for I know there are those among you who can understand and sympathize with my feelings."

What We Need & What You Get

The foundation has been laid to begin the “Bright Eyes” movie, but Pathway Films is now seeking the needed funding in order to start filming. 

While we would not turn down individual investors, the beauty of crowd funding on Indiegogo is the grass roots nature of this. Every person who pledges money receives a t-shirt, posters, DVDs, and other rewards. For higher level pledges a role as an extra, tickets to the premieres, or even renting a theater for an exclusive showing with selected guests is available. When the goal is reached and the movie is released for national and international distribution, at least 50% of the profits will go to current pressing Native American needs.The Indiegogo goal for “Bright Eyes” is $6 million. The current crowd funding record is $5.7 million set in 2013 with the movie “Veronica Mars” in 2013.

The Impact

We believe the true story of a young minority woman, her fight for justice, and how she helped make this world a better place is very timely and inspirational. We think “Bright Eyes” will attract not only a large Native audience, but audiences of all ethnicities and ages since it is also a story of how both whites and Natives joined forces to bring justice to Native Americans. We just hope that many thousands will catch the “Bright Eyes” vision and make their Indiegogo pledge so this movie can be made this year.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out by telling others about this movie and the message it will bring to the world.
  • Share the link to our Indiegogo campaign and website on your social media channels.
  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools right here on this page.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

 

  • Hello, my name is Terance Mcleod and I'm the owner and Director of Film Jocks . We are an award winning  film company with monumental aspirations. Originally from South Florida we now reside in Atlanta. Georgia. Our  objective is to produce high quality content regardless of he film type.

  • This particular  film is an uptempo, fast paced and electric documentary telling a factual story of how football in Broward County has become such a dominant force in the game of football. The storyline details how a particular geographical area produces more professional athletes per capita than any other state in America. This film will also highlight the unmatched determination of our youth, which leads to conquering larger obstacles when dealing with life’s challenges. Finally, the film will feature interviews from current and former NFL greats and capture important aspects of history dating back to the 1960’s. 

  • Having this project backed by you guy will allow us to complete this legendary project and produce it a a high level as we are well prepared to do. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The initial budget for this film is estimated at $52,000. However, we are seeking assistance in reaching a goal of $45,000. Production has already begun with one completed session filmed February 19th and February 20th 2021. Six sessions and 12 days of filming remain. Film session cost are estimated at $2,700 per day, which extends the remaining production balance to $32,400. 
  • Our sponsorship perks are really cool for our potential supporters. We invite you to take a peek at our tier levels to see which one fits you the best.

The Impact

  • South Florida is long overdue in receiving its justification as simply the best on the national level. People all over the world have been wondering for years how a single Tri-County area, Palm Beach, Broward and Dade can consistently produce such massive amounts of talent year in and year out with no drop off in sight. This truly is a story that needs to be told and we are here to tell it. 

Risks & Challenges

  • As we all know, lives have been forever turned upside down by the deadly Covid-19 pandemic. Some of the interviews and action scenes will pose significant issues for our film crew. 
  • Film Jocks follows strict Covid-19 guidelines as issued by the CDC and with your help will be more than prepared to handle any adverse circumstances while filming. We always conform by properly wearing masks, using hand sanitizer, washing our hands and keeping safe distances while on set. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • "Sharing is Caring"!!!!!
  • Whether you can contribute or not, sharing this link for this campaign is just as valuable as donating...We understand these current times are hard and not everyone can help out financially, but just by sharing this link you'll help us out tremendously...
story_txt:
Short Summary
 

Hello, my name is Terance Mcleod and I'm the owner and Director of Film Jocks . We are an award winning  film company with monumental aspirations. Originally from South Florida we now reside in Atlanta. Georgia. Our  objective is to produce high quality content regardless of he film type.
This particular  film is an uptempo, fast paced and electric documentary telling a factual story of how football in Broward County has become such a dominant force in the game of football. The storyline details how a particular geographical area produces more professional athletes per capita than any other state in America. This film will also highlight the unmatched determination of our youth, which leads to conquering larger obstacles when dealing with life’s challenges. Finally, the film will feature interviews from current and former NFL greats and capture important aspects of history dating back to the 1960’s. 
Having this project backed by you guy will allow us to complete this legendary project and produce it a a high level as we are well prepared to do. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The initial budget for this film is estimated at $52,000. However, we are seeking assistance in reaching a goal of $45,000. Production has already begun with one completed session filmed February 19th and February 20th 2021. Six sessions and 12 days of filming remain. Film session cost are estimated at $2,700 per day, which extends the remaining production balance to $32,400. 
Our sponsorship perks are really cool for our potential supporters. We invite you to take a peek at our tier levels to see which one fits you the best.


The Impact
South Florida is long overdue in receiving its justification as simply the best on the national level. People all over the world have been wondering for years how a single Tri-County area, Palm Beach, Broward and Dade can consistently produce such massive amounts of talent year in and year out with no drop off in sight. This truly is a story that needs to be told and we are here to tell it. 
Risks & Challenges
As we all know, lives have been forever turned upside down by the deadly Covid-19 pandemic. Some of the interviews and action scenes will pose significant issues for our film crew. 
Film Jocks follows strict Covid-19 guidelines as issued by the CDC and with your help will be more than prepared to handle any adverse circumstances while filming. We always conform by properly wearing masks, using hand sanitizer, washing our hands and keeping safe distances while on set. 
Other Ways You Can Help

"Sharing is Caring"!!!!!
Whether you can contribute or not, sharing this link for this campaign is just as valuable as donating...We understand these current times are hard and not everyone can help out financially, but just by sharing this link you'll help us out tremendously...

story:
Today, our campaign launch day (January 25th) marks the anniversary of the last day of the 2018-2019 U.S. Federal Government Shutdown — when WE as a nation endured 35 days of what seemed like an eternity of political posturing at the expense of hard working Americans like you and I. A time when our nation struggled financially but rent, bills, and STUDENT LOANS were still due.

The producers of “On The Spot” bring you a non-partisan, American political satire that embodies two major issues: the seeming inability of government officials to undertake the most basic levels of governance, and the notorious student loan debt crisis. But we need your help to bring this film to the big screen! 

 

We’ve partnered with our community to create a concept trailer to give you a glimpse of what this film is all about. We have an amazing script and now we need to raise the funding required to attract the attention of financiers and industry professionals that will aid us in producing this one of a kind indie feature. We believe this film needs to be made, but we want it to be made the RIGHT way. We ask that you join our passionate team, so we can make history together by bringing this touching, comedic, and exciting story to life.

 

After being directly affected by the issues highlighted in this film; we’ve decided something needs to be done about it. We joined together to tell your story and ours. After a year of preparation, we are ready to share this unique story that’s never been told before. We’ve utilized every resource we have available, but have only just begun.

 

We've come to the Indiegogo community for two major reasons, fundraising and filmmaking help. We all come from diverse backgrounds but don’t have the Hollywood budget or equipment to make this as it is.

The following is where we would funnel resources into, if we can come together and raise enough money on this campaign:

  • Casting
  • Ongoing storyboard development
  • Host table read events
  • Involve film experts and pitch to industry financiers
  • Retain legal services
  • Hire a manager/publicist to help direct financing efforts and generate publicity
  • Conduct thorough market research
  • All other pre-production costs

 

ON THE SPOT follows the protagonist Alexa, a young African-American woman in Washington D.C. furloughed with no income during a record-breaking government shutdown. Alexa manages to secure an interview at “Forgive Not Forget,” a student loan call center. Things take an unexpected turn for the worse when  someone leaks the news of this open position to a popular radio host, who inevitably broadcasts the opportunity to the ENTIRE city. As a result, a mass of people, some of which are “unprepared”, show up to prove themselves for this position.

 

ALAN ADELEKE - WRITER/DIRECTOR/PRODUCER

Alan is comedy/drama writer, poet, producer and director from Memphis, TN who is now based in the Washington, D.C. area. Alan’s mission is to bring attention to issues that affect our communities such as debt, the inability to adequately provide for our families, and the current political climate. With “On The Spot” he hopes to make his feature directorial debut. 

 

MATT SHERMAN - DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY/PRODUCER

Matt is a film enthusiast and cinematographer from Western Massachusetts. Now based in DC, Matt has delved himself into the Capital’s film scene with aspirations to produce big budget film’s and work with talented and creative teams. As a former government contractor, Matt teamed up with the On The Spot production team after experiencing life in Washington during the government shutdown.

story:
PROJECT SYNOPSIS

“Is This A Date?” is a romantic comedy . The story follows a socially awkward man named Jeffrey who goes out for dinner with the new hottie in the office known as Dave. However during the dinner, Jeffrey begins to wonder whether or not this is a date, or if it’s just two coworkers grabbing dinner. Jeffrey then turns to the waiter (Connor) for advice on what to do, for Dave has given him mixed signals in the past. Connor simply tells him “pay attention to the signs” that Dave puts out. As the night progresses we learn that Dave is actually straight, but the signs in Jeffrey’s head say otherwise. A hilarious night of events, take place as Jeffrey misinterprets Dave’s friendliness for provocative advances.

THE IMPACT

This story is very relatable to anyone who has ever been on a first date. Often, our insecurities get the best of us, and we find ourselves overthinking, and getting tongue tied in everything we say. When we want something very badly such as a relationship with a specific person, our mind often creates false realities of what we want to see, which often leads us to misread the signs that are right in front of us. This short is for anyone who has ever been in a similar situation. Although first dates can be very awkward and uncomfortable, you can always find these humorous moments in them to look back on. We hope that this lighthearted film will make you laugh, and remember that similar to making films, dating can be difficult. But there are always these little special, and humorous moments in them that make it all worth it. 

MY FILMMAKING EXPERIENCES:

After nearly a full year at Vancouver Film School, I am confident in directing this shoot. I have directed many comedies such as the VFS episodic: ROOMIES (episode 2). And have been involved in the pre-production and post production of that as well. I have also directed my own studio shoot on a set I was also art director for, which enhanced my knowledge of directing and production design. I have also made some short music videos, as well as emotional shorts for my demo reel. I believe that to be a great director, you need to know your film to heart from it's core, have every scene bring out an emotion. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP AND WHAT WE DELIVER IN RETURN

Any fundraising we obtain will be going towards production design, sound design, and costuming. Because this film takes place in a restaurant, we need lots of classy decor, tables, and costumes to create that romantic candlelight atmosphere. Sound design is also very important in this film for we may need layers of restaurant ambience, and sounds of people dining. We are also shooting in a studio so we need to make sure the actor’s voices do not sound muffled. We also must include logistics, such as catering. Donations are more than just a gift.  Overall, we are looking to achieve at least $700 in fundraising for the film.

It's a deed to be very grateful for, as not everybody gets those chances. We want to treat donators as part of our crew, and are offering many different perks to you guys. Some of those perks include a credit on the film, lots of our work we've done to achieve this project such as storyboards, a digital copy of the script, a copy of the film, and more! 

Cast 

Mostafa Shaker as Jeffrey

Michael MacAlister as Dave

Beauregard Aubin as Connor

Katie Chapman as Teela

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone!

My name is Chris Malone.

I am a student at George Mason University in Fairfax, VA and am raising funds for my senior thesis film.

The film is called Harra and the Donkey. It is a live-action/animated comedy film about Jonny Harra,  a cartoonist who is famous for creating a popular comic strip series featuring Jacky, a friendly and lovable, yet dimwitted and goofy donkey who loves to make people laugh. For the past two years, Jacky’s success has given Jonny and his wife, Meredith, more fame and fortune than they ever thought possible, However, the constant demand for the Jacky comics has begun to wear heavily on a burnt-out Jonny. So much so that he plans to end the Jacky series so he can return to where his true passion lies, doing professional illustrations. However, even though Jonny may be done with Jacky, Jacky is not quite done with Jonny yet. Late one night, while Jonny meticulously draws the final Jacky comic strip, Jacky mysteriously comes to life and begins to interfere in Jonny’s work to persuade Jonny to continue the comic strip. However, each attempt results in Jonny getting more annoyed and throwing Jacky out of his house. But no matter how many times Jonny throws Jacky out, Jacky always manages to pop back into his life. As Jonny’s sanity and patience continue to deteriorate with each visit from Jacky, will Jacky be able to convince Jonny to keep the comic strip going? Or is th-th-th-that all for Jacky?

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

As you know, filmmaking is not a cheap endeavor. Even student films like this one need to have some financial backing. So that’s where you come in. We’re asking for at least $2000 to cover filming permits, extra equipment, costumes, makeup, and especially the animation. And to show our appreciation for your support, when you contribute to the film, you will receive a lot of cool perks such as your name in the credits, the script, the poster, and even the film on DVD!

The Impact

I want to tell this story because it touches upon subject matter that is relatable to artists and anyone else in a career that requires creative thinking. Sometimes, creators can get tired of working on the same project for months or even years on end, even if they enjoyed working on it in the beginning. During these times, they think about stepping away from it and doing something different, but it’s all a matter of whether to stop the project altogether or simply take some time off from it and come back to it fully revitalized. This is also a story about acceptance; not only of the accomplishments in your career, no matter how insignificant you feel they are, but of the past as well. Only with this acceptance, will you be able to move forward to a better future. Additionally, by supporting this campaign, you will support student filmmaking as a whole and encourage those who are still in school to express their creativity and share it with the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute a monetary donation to the campaign, not a problem! All you have to do is spread the word and share this campaign through social media such as Facebook, Twitter, or any social media site you want.

You can also check out our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages for all the latest on the production!

If you have any further questions or business inquiries, hit us up at harraanddonkey@gmail.com.

story:
We Finished Filming! And It Was Great!

We've completed filming this very ambitious, AUTHORIZED, short film based on David James Duncan's award-winning novel, The Brothers K. Now, we just need a little help to finish it, polish it up, and deliver it to film festivals so it can be seen in all its glory. 

Despite the fire that nearly derailed production, the team rallied and delivered a beautiful looking film. To complete the movie, we need $10,000 for post production. 

How You Can Help

Post production is all the stuff that turns a filmed project into a real work of art. We've hired top-notch professionals for:

  • Editing
  • Music
  • Color grading
  • Sound design

We've been moving forward but to finish the movie, we need your help to pay these folks.

Come Celebrate with Us!

Your donation will make it possible for us to compete in Film Festivals and bring this special film with its powerful message of Grace to the world. And for a donation of $100 or more, you can join us at the special, donor-only screening of the work-in-progress film on March 31st. 

The screening will be held at the Uptown Theater with a special reception beforehand for VIP donors, cast, and crew. 

Please, Donate and Help Spread the Word

Many of you have already donated so we hope you can stretch a little and help us complete these final key pieces - every dollar really does help! 

And whether you can afford to donate or not, forwarding our campaign video or emailing a few key friends can make a huge difference. We appreciate anything you can do. Getting a film made is NOT easy and we are so thankful for the nearly 100 people who have already donated to help us get this far. 

On behalf of the whole KADE team, THANK YOU for your support,

- Devin

story:
The Story

Javed, a television mechanic from Rampur, North India travelled to Karachi, Pakistan in 2001 for a family wedding. In Karachi, he fell in love with Mobina. Their silent romance bloomed for those few weeks, and before departing to India, Javed promised that he will marry her next year after figuring out the logistics, she promised that she will wait for him.

In December 2001 the Indian Parliament was attacked by Pakistani militants. Indo-Pak relationship deteriorated, borders were shut down and travels suspend. Javed kept his romance alive by calling Mobina everyday from a public phone and sending her love letters. One day, under cover agents broke into Javed's shop and arrested him. He was taken to an undisclosed location and tortured for three days. He was accused of being a Pakistani spy.

Javed was imprisoned for 11 years. His skills as a television mechanic, and his love for Mobina helped him survive those brutal years. He never contacted Mobina again on his lawyer's advice. When he was finally pardoned by the court of law, proven to be fully innocent and free of any guilt, he started to get his life back in order. But one thought always haunted him, what of Mobina, what of his promise to her?  

This documentary is made on Javed's request. He wants the film to be his final letter to Mobina, so that she can understand what happened to him, the injustice he had faced for so many years, and how her memories helped him survive. He wants to act out the scenes from his life with his friends and family so that she can feel the essence of his story and ordeal. This film is his final message to Mobina, wishing her well and apologizing for not keeping his promise.

We hope to take the film to international documentary film festivals and then push for a release on the big screens and on popular online streaming platforms for the world to watch.

What We Need & What You Get

Through self financing, we took a leap of faith and shot half the film in April. Drawn by our footage and compelled by Javed's story, a leading Norwegian Producer came on board to finance the post production of the film (Editing + Sound + Color Correction + Final outputs).

Now we need your support to help us raise the finance for the other half of the film. The other half will be shot over 30 days.  100% of your contributions will be spent on camera & sound equipment + team accommodation & living + location permissions +  transport logistics + giving Javed and his friends & family their daily salary so they can take out the time to work on this project (they come from a very modest economical background). Our core technical team has agreed to come on board without any fees, inspired only by the power of the story. 

If you like the story of the film, then you can get various perks for your contribution. From something as simple as a link to watch the film, to a poster, to an invitation to the premiere, to even having your name listed on IMDB! Film Screenings for the backers will be held in New Delhi, Warsaw and Estonia. However, we are open to other cities if we get some support. 

Our motto is 'No money is small enough or big enough to make a film', but we need to raise a sum of $12,000 to complete the film shoot comfortably. Every contribution is valuable. If we fall short, we will shed more blood, sweat and tears and accomplish the shoot, the completion of this project is a matter of life and death for us! Such a compelling story must be told.      

 

The Team

Tushar Prakash: Director

Born into a family of architects and psychologists, Tushar Prakash is a filmmaker based in Delhi, India and a graduate of the prestigious NATIONAL POLISH FILM SCHOOL IN LODZ. His short film JESTEM OK / I AM OK was adjudged the best at his film-school and participated at various film festivals including MONTREAL WORLD FILM FESTIVAL and NEW HORIZONS FILM FESTIVAL. The film won awards at the LODZIA PO WISLE FILM SCHOOL FESTIVAL and KOSZALIN FILM FESTIVAL in Poland. Tushar Prakash co-produced the science fiction short CHUPAN CHUPAI for the 2013 ARCHITECTURE TRIENALLE in Lisbon and co-directed a documentary on the infamous Nithari serial killings in India called KARMA KILLINGS, the first Indian documentary to be acquired by NETFLIX. He also co directed and was the executive producer on UNRAVELLED a short experimental film produced by the London based think-tank UNKNOWN FIELDS DIVISION, the film premiered at CENTRE DE CULTURA CONTEMPORÀNIA DE BARCELONA. Tushar is currently developing his first feature titled LIBERATION and a documentary titled AN ACT OF LOVE. LIBERATION has participated at the PRODUIRE AU SUD workshop 2014, LA FABRIQUE DES CINÉMAS DU MONDE 2015 (CANNES FILM FESTIVAL) where it was mentored by CLAIRE DENNIS. Tushar Prakash was also a participant of the EAVE — European Audiovisual Entrepreneurs workshop in 2016. 

 

Amondo Films: Producer

AMONDO Films is a multinational production house with offices in New Delhi, Warsaw and Mexico city. Formed as a passionate labor of love by three graduates of the prestigious NATIONAL POLISH FILM SCHOOL IN LODZ, Amondo films aspires to tell powerfully cinematic stories through fiction and non fiction films. Amondo films has already directed and produced feature length films that have been showcased at international film festivals like BERLINALE, ROTTERDAM AND WARSAW INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL. Members of Amondo have participated in various professional training, project development and networking workshops hosted by the likes of the CANNES FILM FESTIVAL and the EUROPEAN AUDIOVISUAL ENTREPRENEURS organization. Amondo helps its members to tell powerful stories, and takes them to the world. “Panamericana Maquinaria”, directed by Joaquin Del Paso and produced by Amondo Films was showcased at over 40 festivals worldwide including BERLINALE 2016. “Hel” directed by Pawel Tarasiewicz and produced by Amondo Films, was the first independent film of its time to be released in cinema's in Poland, and was premiered at the WARSAW FILM FESTIVAL 2016

 

Suhail Prakash: Executive Producer

Suhail is a film producer and a musician based out of Delhi. He did his undergraduate in film & sound recording from the SCHOOL OF AUDIO ENGINEERING. He has had working experiences in sound engineering, graphic & product design, architecture and film & music production. Suhail was the executive producer for the short film CIRCUS, directed by TARIQ VASUDEVA, the film was the only Indian film in the competition section of the MOSCOW FILM FESTIVAL 2018. He was the post production supervisor with JAMUN, a prestigious Delhi based production house operated by AYESHA SOOD and UDAYAN BAIJAL. During his time in JAMUN, Suhail was part of over 25 shoots, including clients like WIEDEN KENNEDY, J WALTER THOMPSON, PURPOSE CLIMATE LAB, NIKE, VIU, INDIA ART FAIR, BOMBAY SHAVING COMPANY, ROYSTEN ABEL. As Amondo Films India producer, he has produced and edited videos for clients such as T&T MOTORS and INSTITUT FRANÇAIS INDIA. Apart from films he is a professional musician and plays drums and produces music with his band BLEACHEAD.

 

Paweł 'Hak' Tarasiewicz: Cinematographer 

Born in 1982 in Warsaw, Paweł Tarasiewicz is a director, producer and street photographer. He’s a graduate of the POLISH NATIONAL FILM SCHOOL IN LODZ. His short films received several awards for his visual style. In 2004 he co-founded the Odnowa association, for young Polish and French artists making videoclips and commercials. In 2010 together with Joaquín del Paso and Tushar Prakash he founded Amondo Films, a film collective and production company based in Warsaw, Mexico City and Delhi. His feature film debut Hel, co-directed with Katia Priwieziencew, was premiered at the WARSAW FILM FESTIVAL in 2016 followed by a successful domestic release. The same year he founded the Amondo Kino, a small art-house cinema in the heart of Warsaw, which has become a cultural hub for young filmmakers. Pawel attended the BERLINALE TALENTS and co-produced Maquinaria Panamericana the first feature by Joaquín del Paso (Berlinale Forum 2016).

 

    Why Should You Contribute?

    For many reasons, but more than ever because this is an awesome story that has the power of great fiction, but instead it really happened! This story resonates with positivism, courage, hope, strength, survival and love. Such stories deserve to be told. Javed is a man filled with energy, and his story will give strength to everyone, and teach us how to forgive and live on. Contribute to make this story come alive in cinematic form, so that you can see it and feel proud that you were a part of it.  

    That is why we dedicate our time and energy to this project. Because everyone who has heard this story has felt moved. We have had local people come to us in the middle of our shoots and shake our hands because they felt that finally someone was telling this local hero's story, which voices the angst felt by an entire youthful community.  

    Our Production Company: Amondo Films has offices in India, Warsaw and Mexico. We have already finished two feature length films and our currently working on three more! We finish projects, come what may! This film will get made, through whatever means necessary.

      

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can contribute by sharing the campaign on social media platforms and telling your friends. You can also contribute by writing about the film or blogging about it. Some very new and innovative narrative tools are being used in this film. You may contact the producers at:

    tushar@amondofilms.com

    suhail@amondofilms.com
story_txt:
The Story
Javed, a television mechanic from Rampur, North India travelled to Karachi, Pakistan in 2001 for a family wedding. In Karachi, he fell in love with Mobina. Their silent romance bloomed for those few weeks, and before departing to India, Javed promised that he will marry her next year after figuring out the logistics, she promised that she will wait for him.
In December 2001 the Indian Parliament was attacked by Pakistani militants. Indo-Pak relationship deteriorated, borders were shut down and travels suspend. Javed kept his romance alive by calling Mobina everyday from a public phone and sending her love letters. One day, under cover agents broke into Javed's shop and arrested him. He was taken to an undisclosed location and tortured for three days. He was accused of being a Pakistani spy.
Javed was imprisoned for 11 years. His skills as a television mechanic, and his love for Mobina helped him survive those brutal years. He never contacted Mobina again on his lawyer's advice. When he was finally pardoned by the court of law, proven to be fully innocent and free of any guilt, he started to get his life back in order. But one thought always haunted him, what of Mobina, what of his promise to her?  
This documentary is made on Javed's request. He wants the film to be his final letter to Mobina, so that she can understand what happened to him, the injustice he had faced for so many years, and how her memories helped him survive. He wants to act out the scenes from his life with his friends and family so that she can feel the essence of his story and ordeal. This film is his final message to Mobina, wishing her well and apologizing for not keeping his promise.
We hope to take the film to international documentary film festivals and then push for a release on the big screens and on popular online streaming platforms for the world to watch.
What We Need & What You Get
Through self financing, we took a leap of faith and shot half the film in April. Drawn by our footage and compelled by Javed's story, a leading Norwegian Producer came on board to finance the post production of the film (Editing + Sound + Color Correction + Final outputs).
Now we need your support to help us raise the finance for the other half of the film. The other half will be shot over 30 days.  100% of your contributions will be spent on camera & sound equipment + team accommodation & living + location permissions +  transport logistics + giving Javed and his friends & family their daily salary so they can take out the time to work on this project (they come from a very modest economical background). Our core technical team has agreed to come on board without any fees, inspired only by the power of the story. 
If you like the story of the film, then you can get various perks for your contribution. From something as simple as a link to watch the film, to a poster, to an invitation to the premiere, to even having your name listed on IMDB! Film Screenings for the backers will be held in New Delhi, Warsaw and Estonia. However, we are open to other cities if we get some support. 
Our motto is 'No money is small enough or big enough to make a film', but we need to raise a sum of $12,000 to complete the film shoot comfortably. Every contribution is valuable. If we fall short, we will shed more blood, sweat and tears and accomplish the shoot, the completion of this project is a matter of life and death for us! Such a compelling story must be told.      
 
The Team
Tushar Prakash: Director
Born into a family of architects and psychologists, Tushar Prakash is a filmmaker based in Delhi, India and a graduate of the prestigious NATIONAL POLISH FILM SCHOOL IN LODZ. His short film JESTEM OK / I AM OK was adjudged the best at his film-school and participated at various film festivals including MONTREAL WORLD FILM FESTIVAL and NEW HORIZONS FILM FESTIVAL. The film won awards at the LODZIA PO WISLE FILM SCHOOL FESTIVAL and KOSZALIN FILM FESTIVAL in Poland. Tushar Prakash co-produced the science fiction short CHUPAN CHUPAI for the 2013 ARCHITECTURE TRIENALLE in Lisbon and co-directed a documentary on the infamous Nithari serial killings in India called KARMA KILLINGS, the first Indian documentary to be acquired by NETFLIX. He also co directed and was the executive producer on UNRAVELLED a short experimental film produced by the London based think-tank UNKNOWN FIELDS DIVISION, the film premiered at CENTRE DE CULTURA CONTEMPORÀNIA DE BARCELONA. Tushar is currently developing his first feature titled LIBERATION and a documentary titled AN ACT OF LOVE. LIBERATION has participated at the PRODUIRE AU SUD workshop 2014, LA FABRIQUE DES CINÉMAS DU MONDE 2015 (CANNES FILM FESTIVAL) where it was mentored by CLAIRE DENNIS. Tushar Prakash was also a participant of the EAVE — European Audiovisual Entrepreneurs workshop in 2016. 
 

Amondo Films: Producer
AMONDO Films is a multinational production house with offices in New Delhi, Warsaw and Mexico city. Formed as a passionate labor of love by three graduates of the prestigious NATIONAL POLISH FILM SCHOOL IN LODZ, Amondo films aspires to tell powerfully cinematic stories through fiction and non fiction films. Amondo films has already directed and produced feature length films that have been showcased at international film festivals like BERLINALE, ROTTERDAM AND WARSAW INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL. Members of Amondo have participated in various professional training, project development and networking workshops hosted by the likes of the CANNES FILM FESTIVAL and the EUROPEAN AUDIOVISUAL ENTREPRENEURS organization. Amondo helps its members to tell powerful stories, and takes them to the world. “Panamericana Maquinaria”, directed by Joaquin Del Paso and produced by Amondo Films was showcased at over 40 festivals worldwide including BERLINALE 2016. “Hel” directed by Pawel Tarasiewicz and produced by Amondo Films, was the first independent film of its time to be released in cinema's in Poland, and was premiered at the WARSAW FILM FESTIVAL 2016
 
Suhail Prakash: Executive Producer
Suhail is a film producer and a musician based out of Delhi. He did his undergraduate in film & sound recording from the SCHOOL OF AUDIO ENGINEERING. He has had working experiences in sound engineering, graphic & product design, architecture and film & music production. story:
THE FILM

The Elf In The Room is a twisted but cautionary psychological thriller inspired by the popular holiday family tradition with a similar name. The story provides perspective on the notion that we are a product of our environment, by exploring the themes of parenting and the consequences of neglect. The idea of “present but absent” occurs when parents are emotionally unavailable to nurture their children. Since attention and affirmation are important to a child’s development, this void can lead to low self esteem and a tendency to act out and misbehave in order to get the attention they crave.

The concept of a “spying” elf doll is an intriguing metaphor, because even if exaggerated, it is conceivable to depict the activity as an easy out for parents; allowing them to shift the responsibility of disciplining and nurturing their children to an inanimate object. This isn’t any different than handing a child a smartphone or video game in lieu of quality time and attention.

By way of fable, our story examines what happens when present but absent backfires. What if the elf is really watching? What if he’s able to respond and teach a lesson?

Despite the serious subject matter and themes of the film, on the surface, we are still making a psychological horror film that plays with the folklore of this holiday tradition. We fell in love with the idea of turning the pop-culture icon into a nightmare inducing horror. It is going to be dark. It is going to be creepy. And it is going to be extremely stylized. In that regard, this film requires a much higher commitment to production value than our previous works, which is why we need your help!

THE DOLL

There are two key prop elements that are crucial to the production of our film, the elf doll and the accompanying story book.

We are ecstatic to have the opportunity to partner with an accomplished and world renowned doll maker to bring our stylized vision to life. Of course, designing, modeling, and creating a poseable porcelain doll that is camera ready is no small feat and it is certainly not cheap. The production process for one doll will take over 4 months and will require a significant portion of the budget.

Regardless, the process is extremely fascinating and exciting, so we will be documenting and sharing the progress regularly with donors. In this way, we hope that the doll takes on a life of his own. Stay tuned for updates!

THE STORY BOOK

In order to properly tell our story, we need to produce an illustrated story book that accompanies the elf doll and explains the folklore of the elf. In the film, the stories read from the book provide valuable context to the narrative. Similar to the elf doll, we are partnering with an extremely talented illustrator to create our own stylized interpretation of the book for use in the film. Again, there are unavoidable costs associated with this process, which is why we need your help!

PRODUCTION

We will be shooting on location in Pittsburgh, PA in Q1 of 2019. Our cast and crew consists of film professionals, many of whom are generously giving up their time to help us out with the bottom line. Due to the seasonal relevance of our film, it likely will not be released to the public until the fall of 2019. That being said, contributors will have the exclusive opportunity to see the film before its release, when production is complete.

THE MONEY

We are looking to raise $10,000 through this campaign to pay for production and post-production costs. We can assure you, none of it will be going into our pockets. We extremely appreciate your kindness, generosity, and dedication to supporting art. THANK YOU.

Here is where the money will be allocated.

The Elf Doll

The Elf In The Room story book

Location Permits

Props & Sets

Wardrobe / Costumes / Makeup

Equipment Rentals & Operators

Lighting

Sound

Camera

Hair & Makeup

Production Supplies

Special FX / Post Production

Meals for cast and crew

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Even if you are unable to contribute financially to the goal, there are still other ways that you can help make this project a reality.

Tell all of your friends, family, or anyone that may be interested in our project.

Share the campaign on social media.

Volunteer your time. If you are local to Pittsburgh, we could always use an extra hand with the production.

THE TEAM

We have put together an incredible team so far (with more to be added) of film professionals all with significant experience in the industry. You can view some of our previous works here.

CAST

Jennifer Andrada - Alison

Jennifer Andrada has been a professional actress for over ten years, working in film, theater, television, and commercials. A prolific voice actor as well, she has lent her voice to a host of audiobooks, educational videos, television and radio commercials. She can be seen playing the character Sophia Bennett on WGNs OUTSIDERS and is a series regular on the family comedy web series Jack and Emma.

Allan Snyder - Andrew

Allan Snyder moved to Pittsburgh three years ago from New York, where he appeared on Broadway in Les Miserables (original production, final cast) and off-Broadway in the iconic, long-running The Fantasticks. Allan also traveled the country for two years with the national tour of The Phantom of the Opera, often appearing in the title role. Since moving to Pittsburgh he has performed with the Pittsburgh Public Theater (Hamlet, Daddy Long Legs), the Pittsburgh CLO (The 39 Steps, Titanic) as well as many other local theatres. On camera Allan has appeared in commercials for the Pittsburgh Pirates, UPMC, and Giant Eagle and look for him in the upcoming films Unsinkable and Pickled (starring Seth Rogen).

Payten Fisher - Megan

Payten Fisher is a brilliant young talent who is making her acting debut in The Elf In The Room. Taking influence from Millie Bobbie Brown of Stranger Things', Payten has a flair for the dramatic, so she is very excited to have a serious role in the horror genre. Although cheerleading is her outlet when she wants to get her groove on, Payten also loves to play the sims and fortnight. 

CREW

Darin DiNapoli - Director & Editor

Framing every aspect of his life in cinematic fashion, Darin DiNapoli never ceases to offer an interesting perspective. But, seeing life through his own lense has allowed Darin to develop a style of storytelling that is as intriguing as it is proficient. A creative being by nature, Darin earned his technical savvy over 10 years of working as both a professional editor and director of photography on commercial projects for national brands. In that time, Darin also began receiving major attention for his independent projects, including an Emmy award for a music video produced for his band Identity X. Over the course of the last three years, Darin has been busy collaborating with other industry professionals to make over 9 short films across multiple genres and winning multiple awards; including BEST FILM for the horror flick "Rorschach" at the Pittsburgh 48 Hour Film Festival and a nomination for BEST FILM for “Nakama” at the LA 48 Hour Film Festival. Nakama received continued attention internationally for months following the festival. DiNapoli’s film “Sketch” also garnered attention in the Four Points Film Festival after being honored in the top 25 out of over 200 international entries. Darin’s passion for filmmaking remains strong as he intends to parlay these experiences into a career making movies in Hollywood.

Jonathan A. Joseph - Writer

As a musician and professional web designer, Jonathan Joseph has always been creating. But, it wasn’t until he ‘accidentally’ joined one of director Darin DiNapoli’s projects that he found his passion for filmmaking. When one of his ideas evolved into a major plot point, he suddenly found himself co-writing the award winning and internationally recognized short “Nakama.” Since then, Jonathan has penned six more of DiNapoli’s films, also earning international accolades for “Sketch.” With every project, Jonathan writes with the intention of creating something meaningful. At the very least, he wants the audience to come away thinking.

Amanda Williams - Producer

Amanda Williams is a Pittsburgh native with a 12 year career in professional production, specializing in production management, logistics, and casting. Her highlights include 4 years as the Casting Coordinator and Associate Producer on the Emmy nominated game show Who Wants to be a Millionaire, as well as coordinating production logistics for a shoot in the Oval Office with President Obama. Amanda has a passion for evocative stories and believes in film as a powerful outlet for artistic expression.

Chris Catone - Composer

Chris Catone is a composer, producer and multi-instrumentalist whose music is deeply rooted in the merging of technology and the natural sound. His life and work is a balance between sacred silence and the din of the outside world. As an active composer of chamber and film music, Chris’ work has been performed by Alia Musica Pittsburgh, Trillium Ensemble, A Far Cry Ensemble, The Heinz Chapel Compline Choir, St. Maurice Chamber Singers, Kassia Ensemble and others. His music for film has won awards at prominent film festivals such as the Los Angeles 48 Hour Film Fest, Four Points Film Festival and Filmapalooza. Chris has also assisted on various projects with film composer/producer Junkie XL at Hans Zimmer’s Remote Control Productions in Los Angeles, California.

story:
What We're Doing

As a Junior at Loyola Marymount University, I have worked my way to this point.  This film will be a culmination of all that I have learned and a projection for all that I hope to achieve.  

I hope to create works in the future that bring together all of the art forms that I enjoy and practice.  Thus, this film will feature custom designed fashion pieces, intricate production design, exciting camera work, and haunting sound design and music.

What We Need

To make this dream come true we will need your help! This film will gain us no profit, and all of your donations will go towards the following:

  • Locations & Permits
  • Transportation
  • Production Design & Custom Wardrobe
  • Food for the Cast & Crew
  • Music Licensing

Why It Matters to Me

The inspiration for this film comes from growing up watching horror movies with my mom.  From A Nightmare on Elm Street to Rocky Horror Picture Show, I was enamored by the disruption of our known world by the worlds created in these films.  By making this film, I am creating a space for the cross-pollination for all of the art forms I admire – music, fashion, photography, etc. 

What You Can Do

Any donation that you can offer is greatly appreciated!  However, we acknowledge the fact that not everyone can donate, so please spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or wherever else.  

 

About the Writer/Director

Nate Rynaski

Nate Rynaski is originally from Omaha, Nebraska.  He moved to LA in 2016 to start school at Loyola Marymount University for Film Production.  Now minoring in Studio Arts with a focus in Photography, Nate is working to round out his craft at LMU.  Nate is also a DJ and the Social Media/Web Director at KXLU 88.9 FM Los Angeles, an LA landmark of a radio station.  With all of these elements of music, photography, and his other interests such as fashion, he hopes to find space in film where these all meet and cross-pollinate.
story_txt:
What We're Doing
As a Junior at Loyola Marymount University, I have worked my way to this point.  This film will be a culmination of all that I have learned and a projection for all that I hope to achieve.  
I hope to create works in the future that bring together all of the art forms that I enjoy and practice.  Thus, this film will feature custom designed fashion pieces, intricate production design, exciting camera work, and haunting sound design and music.

What We Need
To make this dream come true we will need your help! This film will gain us no profit, and all of your donations will go towards the following:

Locations & Permits
Transportation
Production Design & Custom Wardrobe
Food for the Cast & Crew
Music Licensing


Why It Matters to Me
The inspiration for this film comes from growing up watching horror movies with my mom.  From A Nightmare on Elm Street to Rocky Horror Picture Show, I was enamored by the disruption of our known world by the worlds created in these films.  By making this film, I am creating a space for the cross-pollination for all of the art forms I admire – music, fashion, photography, etc. 
What You Can Do
Any donation that you can offer is greatly appreciated!  However, we acknowledge the fact that not everyone can donate, so please spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or wherever else.  
 
About the Writer/Director
Nate Rynaski

Nate Rynaski is originally from Omaha, Nebraska.  He moved to LA in 2016 to start school at Loyola Marymount University for Film Production.  Now minoring in Studio Arts with a focus in Photography, Nate is working to round out his craft at LMU.  Nate is also a DJ and the Social Media/Web Director at KXLU 88.9 FM Los Angeles, an LA landmark of a radio station.  With all of these elements of music, photography, and his other interests such as fashion, he hopes to find space in film where these all meet and cross-pollinate.

story:
Short Summary

"The Letter" is a Medieval short film that highlight the importance of loyalty as well as a fathers love for his son.  This Film is Directed by Kevyn Ryan, a young up and coming filmmaker from Texas.

This is the biggest project we have yet to create and in order to get to the finish line we need your help. This is a dream of ours to create something big and magical but we can't do it on our own. We need the help of the community to bring this project to life.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $6000 and this is where those funds are going

Equipment Rentals - $4000

Our goal is to create a piece of art with high quality and production value. Thus, we need to rent lighting as well camera equipment to ensure that this film is worthy of being screened at Film Festivals.

Cast and Crew - $ 2000

It is unfortunate that in this industry many actors and crew members are not paid for their talent and work ethic. We want to change that by being able to pay them for their hard work. This also aids in us ensuring that everyone on set would be giving us their 100%.

Every dollar you donate will help towards allowing the cast and crew to pay their upcoming bills.

Post Production and Distribution  $1000

What is the use of making a film and no one being able to watch it? With this money we will be able to make sure the film is completed to a very high standard as well as cover the cost of submitting this project to film festivals. We want to share this project with the world and you can help us to do that.

The Impact

Like we said before, this is the biggest project we have ever undertaken and we need to communities help to bring it to life. Every donation large or small is greatly appreciated and will get us one step closer to fufilling our dream.

We have made Projects before like "Nails" and "Playtime" which have already been selected into multiple festivals.  So we hope that you would trust us to make a quality product that will reward everyone.

With this project we also hope to bring jobs to those in this industry that dont always get paid. As filmakers we know that actors and crew members struggle to find a way to pay next months rent everyday. With this money we hope to change that one small step at a time.

Risks & Challenges

With every project there are risks. With a project like this, one of the biggest obstacles is creating and authentic looking piece with good production design. We have already solved this issue with finding an amazing castle location in Texas as well as great wardrobe.

We also have a experienced crew members that will ensure we have great production quality and efficiency on set.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute with money but their are other ways you can help. Spread the word about this project on social media and in person. Send them the link to this project and let them know that they can help us. Follow us on social media, Follow our Director Kevyn Ryan Kimak. Anything you can do will be greatly appreciated!

story:
Doll Cemetery is 90% complete. Filming finished 15th July. We are in post-production and now need $3,500 which will allow us to get the following to complete the movie:

  • 3 PICK UP DAYS FILMING

  • CAST AND CREW WAGES

  • EDITING + VFX

  • POST PRODUCTION LOGISTICS FOR USA

  • DCP FILE

OUTLINE

Doll Cemetery

Brendan Cobbs, a famous novelist is struggling with writer’s block. His agent sends him to a remote cottage in rural England with undesirable and unwelcoming locals and no connection to the outside world. This is where he encounters Alfred, a child size doll, who can mysteriously come to life when Brendan isn’t watching him. Brendan thinks Alfred could be a great idea for his new book. But deadly consequences are about to hit Brendan as no matter what he does, he cannot seem to get rid of Alfred or his followers. Something big is coming for Brendan with the intent to kill. 

DOLL CEMETERY stills. Copyright Gaz De Vere.

From the makers of ESSEX BOYS: LAW OF SURVIVAL THE HOWLING, THE DOLL MASTER

 

Perks & IMDB:

Get yourself a Thanks, Associate Producer or Executive Producer credit and it will appear in the film and on imdb. Here is the link to the film on imdb.com

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1953143/

Distribution:

Distribution is secured with 101 Films in USA, Canada, UK, Ireland and Germany which will place the film into stores on Physical DVD and on Sky Store.

http://101-films-store.myshopify.com

Other companies who distribute our films: 

SKY STORE

 

The Team:

 

Steven M. Smith (Writer, Producer, Director)

Steven began his career at 16 working on films such as Four Weddings and A Funeral, and Television like Lovejoy. He produced his first feature film Time of Her Life, which screened at Cannes in 2005 and went on to produce features: Dance Star, Haunted and Tales of the Supernatural. He was the Associate Producer on US horror The Perfect House and Death Walks, which is in Post-Production.  He also co wrote and co directed Hooligans At War: North Vs South He has just completedEssex Boys: Law Of Survival, which is being released through Metrodome Distribution in September 2015.

Jon-Paul Gates (Actor, Producer)

Jon-Paul is an Actor and Producer who has starred in over 55 Film & TV productions as well as produced 5 movies. Jon-Paul got his first break starring as Allan Hindle in the BBC soap Eldorado. After various short films and Channel 4 series Focus North, he starred in his first feature film Cold Fish in 1999 as the lead. In 2001, he secured lead roles in Palm Tree's The Hawk & the Dove and played the antagonist 'Ida' in Winter Warrior. From 2002 to 2006 he accumulated more films in Europe including The Prodigal, Red Rose and Axe Raiders before trying his luck in the USA. After getting his big break in vampire flick Revamped, he starred in The Asylum’s Dragon, Beyond The Ring with Gary Busey and Danny Trejo in Dark Games. Other credits include Messages with Jeff Fahey and Martin Kove, Carmen’s Kiss with Hugo Speer, Disturbance with Bruce Payne, Seven Crosses, Dance Star, Blood Forest, The Stone, Villains and Believe with Brian Cox. He also played the Medium in Haunted 1 (Ghosts). 

As a Producer, his extensive knowledge of EIS is greatly valued: he has been headhunted to be the Commercial Director for 3 EIS PLC companies including Grosvenor Films Plc and Albion Films Plc. 

Greenway Distribution History:

Some of our previous films have been released through: 101 Films, High Fliers and Metrodome, with all our titles getting DVD & VOD in store shop shelf space:

Our previous films have been number #1 in HMV. 

Distribution is always key when it comes to making films, this is why we have it in place already for the UK, guaranteeing release into all major stores in UK, including Asda, Sainsbury's, Tesco's and Morrision's.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Go support us.
