story:
The plan of action

To produce a high end short film, all in one shot. But we need your help! You can contribute for as little as €1 or become an Executive Producer on the film for a €1000 contribution. All you have to do is select your preferred perk, which is our way of saying thank you for the contribution.

  • I'm Patrick McDermott, Writer and Director of this new short film THE LAND OF BANG. Myself and Producer Maria O'Neill (Scratch Films, Cluster Fox Films) expect to start shooting late April early May. We need your support today. We are asking for a small contribution from all backers. Any amount will do.

  • THE LAND OF BANG is a socially engaging short film that depicts the harsh realities of gun crime in the North Inner City of Dublin, more specifically, Sheriff Street.
  • Contributors can look forward to a hyper realistic take on crime drama, told by a local filmmaker.  At Headc8se Films we strive not just to create great movies, we want to share subjective, cinematic experiences with the audience.

Just €15 from a thousand contributors gives us our entire budget! We all love Irish films and at Headc8se Films, we love making them.  You can contribute for as little as €1.  There are a number of perks available, from on screen credits, joining the crew on set to becoming an Executive Producer.  Every amount will help us achieve our goal and enable us to produce an amazing piece of work.

What We Need & What You Get

To break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Although we have won an award through the Screen Directors Guild of Ireland (SDGI) and the Arri Alexa take 2020, we still don't have a green light. We need production insurance, a number of key crew members that are not included in the award, cast, extras and catering during principal photography.  Not to mention props, vehicles and fake blood. We also need to cover post-production that's before even looking at delivery, sales, marketing and festival entry fees.
  • Our target is €15,000 for the production of THE LAND OF BANG. That includes all stages of production from concept to creation.
  • There is a number of gifts a contributor can avail of, depending on the contribution you wish to make. Are you a patron of the arts, an executive producer, do you want tickets, a poster or simply want to observe a film being made? Anything is possible depending on how generous people feel.
  • If we don't reach our goal of €15,000, we will have to make compromises that in turn, will soften the standards we are striving to achieve. But this won't happen, we have a lot of faith in ourselves and we hope you do too.

The Impact

THE LAND OF BANG is a local story that will be shot on location in the community of Sheriff Street, directed by Patrick McDermott. The backdrop adds verisimilitude but most importantly, raises important questions of a young mans struggle when affiliated with a gang. Why must innocent lives end just because of gangland violence? This has happened time and time again. Stopping for a while, then starting all over. What is going on? Although fictional, THE LAND OF BANG could possibly shed light or provoke discussion within reality.

  • I have directed a number of short form projects and still doing it today. I've worked with most broadcasters and numerous production companies, but myself and the team have decided to take Headc8se Films to the next level. We want to produce our own content that strives to test our boundaries.
  • So donate today dudes and we thank you all in advance.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Even share or post our campaign online, and with anyone you think might be able to help
  • As a reminder, please use the Indiegogo share tools. It actually works!
  • feel free to get in touch about the campaign and we can go into more details if necessary

We look forward to presenting our work. So please DONATE TODAY for as little as €1 and we thank you all in advance.

Patrick.

I have directed a number of short form projects and still doing it today. I've worked with most broadcasters and numerous production companies, but myself and the team have decided to take Headc8se Films to the next level. We want to produce our own content that strives to test our boundaries.
So donate today dudes and we thank you all in advance.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Even share or post our campaign online, and with anyone you think might be able to help
As a reminder, please use the Indiegogo share tools. It actually works!
feel free to get in touch about the campaign and we can go into more details if necessary

We look forward to presenting our work. So please DONATE TODAY for as little as €1 and we thank you all in advance.
Patrick.

story:
Short Summary

Public school classrooms are microcosms of the world at large. Their ecosystems are where our students learn to live and learn and work in community with one another. 
 

I'm Melissa Lukenbaugh, documentary filmmaker and photographer having wrestled 15 years of humanitarian stories throughout Africa, Southeast Asia and most favorably Tulsa, Oklahoma.

In 2017, I began working on a historical documentary to celebrate the 100th year of Oklahoma's oldest elementary school, Lee School, founded in 1918. That summer, in Charlottesville, VA, white nationalists marched in protest of the removal of the Robert E. Lee statue standing since 1924 leaving one person dead and dozens injured. 

On the eve of the 100th anniversary of Lee School, the protest came to Tulsa. One of the city's most solid public elementary schools made great by community volunteers for 100 years now underwent an identity crisis. A figure symbolizing the Confederate South also identified a school touting 100 years of public service, education for all, commitment to community and exceptional citizen leadership. The unique and remarkable diversity that Lee School enjoyed for a century is now put to her highest call yet.

This intimate look at how Tulsans grapple with legacy, threats to an already fragile public school system and national political conversation begs the question if our current climate of polarization is as binary as our media outlets portray. 

Does a name change do the real work of equity insurance? Are our divisions really defenses of color lines or class or could it be something else? Are we more tethered and united in unlikely relationships than we realize?

As the name of the school changed, the community and the families who walk through the doors each day are still trying to determine if, in fact, progress was made. 

In this effort, we ask the question. 

To support the completion of this film is to reject the one-liner journalistic approach to this history. To take a fuller, deeper view into the complexities of a misguided debate. To question what polarizes us through the lens of  a public school family wrestling their identity between politics, class, race, and personalities.

As we set out to record each moment of this year, I encouraged crew members to "look for the light" and I believe we did that. We reached for what beauty motivated the intentions of each voice.  

We need $25,458 to complete this film. We have completed the shooting for 95% of the project.  The remaining footage gathered will be a call to the question of progress and we invite you to reach out to us if you'd like to speak to this question. Have we made progress? 

To date, the crew has been paid in full. We'll use the funds raised to conduct the additional interviews, purchase 2 additional hard drives and complete post-production: 2 editors, director, color grade, music/composition, sound mix and insurance. 

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will edit the footage we have and complete the film without proper color grade and sound mix rendering the project short of perspective and quality finish but honest in record. If we do reach our goal, the chronicle of 100 years of Lee School in documentary form will be realized as well as the multiple layered narrative of her 100th year as Council Oak Elementary.

Risks & Challenges

This project has been nearly three years in the making. We have hundreds of hours of BRoll, archival material and interviews with Lee School Alumni from nearly 100 years ago through each generation. It will take the Tulsa community to bring it to the finish line. Traditionally, we have fumbled around when attempting to talk honestly about political challenges, our public school funding record and our past. We simply don't know what or how to say.  This project aims to defy assumptions about who believes and fights for what and why ... to slow division, slow the rhetoric and clarify the narrative enabling us to see each other as individuals with unique experiences rather than classified groups.

Our risks are the vulnerabilities required to tell this story. We simply want to provide a safe place for people to talk about a vulnerable topic in our city.  We can't guarantee cooperation but we promise to seek out the founding good in everyone and promote a heroic tale of hard fought progress.

Our challenges are technical. Time and money. This far, I've sunk personal funds into the project as well as too much business time. I need the help of a team now. It is the only way forward and through. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone can't make a donation. But, we want everyone to be a part of this effort! Please share this campaign on your social media. We can't wait to share the real story of 100 years working for progress.

We need $25,458 to complete this film. We have completed the shooting for 95% of the project.  The remaining footage gathered will be a call to the question of progress and we invite you to reach out to us if you'd like to speak to this question. Have we made progress? 
To date, the crew has been paid in full. We'll use the funds raised to conduct the additional interviews, purchase 2 additional hard drives and complete post-production: 2 editors, director, color grade, music/composition, sound mix and insurance. 
If we don't reach our entire goal, we will edit the footage we have and complete the film without proper color grade and sound mix rendering the project short of perspective and quality finish but honest in record. If we do reach our goal, the chronicle of 100 years of Lee School in documentary form will be realized as well as the multiple layered narrative of her 100th year as Council Oak Elementary.

Risks & Challenges
This project has been nearly three years in the making. We have hundreds of hours of BRoll, archival material and interviews with Lee School Alumni from nearly 100 years ago through each generation. It will take the Tulsa community to bring it to the finish line. Traditionally, we have fumbled around when attempting to talk honestly about political challenges, our public school funding record and our past. We simply don't know what or how to say.  This project aims to defy assumptions about who believes and fights for what and why ... to slow division, slow the rhetoric and clarify the narrative enabling us to see each other as individuals with unique experiences rather than classified groups.
Our risks are the vulnerabilities required to tell this story. We simply want to provide a safe place for people to talk about a vulnerable topic in our city.  We can't guarantee cooperation but we promise to seek out the founding good in everyone and promote a heroic tale of hard fought progress.
Our challenges are technical. Time and money. This far, I've sunk personal funds into the project as well as too much business time. I need the help of a team now. It is the only way forward and through. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We know everyone can't make a donation. But, we want everyone to be a part of this effort! Please share this campaign on your social media. We can't wait to share the real story of 100 years working for progress.

story:
Welcome to the Indiegogo Campaign for Lilith. Lilith is a short, quiet horror movie set in Fredericksburg, VA. It's an adaptation of a short story titled “Prey,” which I published in A Knife in the Back. Here's the logline:

When a freelance reporter is assigned to interview a strange old woman about her corpse flower, she doesn't realize how bad the interview will turn out. For her, at least.

THE TEAM

JAMES NOLL—WRITER, PRODUCER, SOUND

James is an author, a musician, and an educator from Fredericksburg, Virginia. He's written ten books (eight novels, a collection of short stories, and a piece of non-fiction), and he's produced seven audiobooks based on his fiction.  He's been involved in audio production for over twenty years, first as a member of various bands, then on his own. In 2016, he branched out into video, producing a few documentary-style projects, including a short video about one of his favorite bands, Trucker Troy & The Convoy:

 

and In Flight, a  short video about powered paramotoring:

You can check out his work at www.jamesnoll.net.
 
ELISABETH WHITE—DIRECTOR

Elisabeth White is an award winning director/producer of film, TV and music videos and an award winning singer/songwriter. She has worked with many names in the film and music industry, including Elaine Hendrix (The Parent Trap), Sandy Martin (It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia), Jim Tavare (Harry Potter) Snoop Dogg, Lenny Kravitz, Beastie Boys, Simple Minds and Clement Von Frankenstein ( Hail Caesar). She has her own production company RooAndKanga Inc. focusing on producing TV and Film. You can learn more about Elisabeth at www.elisabethwhite.com.

 

 

PETER LUGO—DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Peter is a founder of RooandKanga. He got his start in Cinematography at seventeen shooting skateboarding videos. After learning cinematography technique at film school, on set and the ASC Master Class, he is now sought after as one of the best Cinematographers around. You can learn more about Peter at www.rooandkanga.com

THE BIG ASK

This project will cost $10,000 to produce, but since I'VE ALREADY RAISED 33% of it on my own, I am looking to raise the final $6,000 through this campaign. The budget will pay for the creation of an 8-10 minute professionally-produced short film, including a top-notch cast, crew, post-production, and cinema-grade equipment. 

HERE IS A BREAKDOWN OF THE BUDGET:

 

THESE LEVELS OF SUPPORT WILL PROVIDE US WITH THE CAPITAL TO FUND THE PROJECT!

 


$20- The Corpse Flower- Exclusive download, Social Media and Post-credits thank you.


$50-The Creepy Smile - Corpse Flower perks plus: a signed copy of the Lilith script, a signed picture of the principal actors, AND the OFFICIAL LILITH T-SHIRT!


$100- Lilith's Special Blend - Creepy Smile perks plus: ANOTHER OFFICIAL Lilith T-shirt AND A SIGNED COPY OF THE ILLUSTRATED VERSION OF "PREY," THE SHORT STORY FROM WHICH LILITH WAS ADAPTED.

  
$500-Mulching Room (15)  - Lilith's Special Blend perks plus: Your name or business logo on our premier advertising board, invitation to the premier.


$1,000- The Bloody Finger (8) - Mulching Room perks plus:  IMDB Producer credit, VIP PREMIER premier seating.

Once the campaign is over,  the project will be green-lighted, and I will be able to  produce a high-quality, cinematic short film.

I’m proud to be a part of the State of Virginia creative and film community. With your help Lilith will get made! 

REFUNDS

With a flexible funding campaign, we keep whatever funds we can raise. 

THANK YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about Lilith and this Indiegogo Campaign!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Imagine a new form of web entertainment – an interactive  experience where members can observe the most terrifying sea creatures that ever lived, each housed in the most advanced aquariums ever conceived, and the animals and people react and respond to your presence. Add to that several adventure series set against the same backdrop, independent yet interwoven, written by best-selling authors and supported by motion picture-worthy special effects. 

Welcome to MEG ISLAND & Sea Monster Cove

 

Follow this link and sign up for all the latest News:

https://megisland.com/

story:
What is this? 
 

This is the Indie-A-Gogo for Brooklyn Battle Comedy's short film "Brooklyn Battle Comedy: We Make Movies" 

 

...And what is Brooklyn Battle Comedy? 

Brooklyn Battle Comedy is your stop for locally-sourced, cage-free, ethical comedy and wrestling extravaganza brought to you by two idiot what they're doing. Brooklyn Battle Comedy is real outlaw mudshow bull!@#$. 

 

Uh...

We're a comedy show run by stand-up comedians Benel Germosen and Lawson Leong. Starting in New York in 2019, Brooklyn Battle Comedy is a hybrid comedy and wrestling show that brings together stand-up comedians and professional wrestlers under one roof. Comedians do jokes and then wrestlers wrestle sans ring. It originally started in the back room of a LGBTQ bar, Brooklyn Battle Comedy wishes to continue to expand to greater and greater heights. What better way to do that than a movie?!

 

There are much better ways to do that

Yeah, but this movie is a passion project for us. It is our way of betting on ourselves and our goofy little show. In Brooklyn Battle Comedy, we believe in few things; We believe that stand-up comedy and professional wrestling are both artforms are unfairly maligned by elements within and without our industries. We believe that stand-up comedians and professional wrestlers are both exploited by their respected industries in significant ways that pulls power away from the people who create the art and puts in the hands of people who gatekeep and curate the art. We believe that stand-up comedians and professional wrestlers (as well as other performances artists) are entitled to the fruits of their labor. Brooklyn Battle Comedy is made by artist for artists, to share in their love of art in these two seemingly disperate forms. 

 

Alright, so what do you need? 

We are asking for money to help us fund our project. Our goals are simple and realistic. We only ask for enough money to cover part of the production cost, specifically handling the cost and expenses of hiring the performers. We have budgeted comfortably to afford our director, editor, audio production, sound equipment, props, health and safety, and location. Our need is two fold: We would like to pay our performers as soon as filming is done and we would like to be able to show the film in festivals. For that we need to raise capital to support our two fold plans of paying our artist quickly and submitting to festival. We hope with your help, we'll be able to do that. 

 

Sounds good, but what are the risk

Films are percarious endeavors in the best of time. In the era of Covid, these risks are further compounded by sudden changes in our world state. While we are doing the utmost when it comes to health and safety, we do not know what tomorrow may bring in the shadow of the Coronavirus. In the likelihood that one of our crew is informed, we will be forced to shut-down production. There is no consciousable reason to continue to shoot a film if even one of our six person team get sick. Furthermore, we will be conscious of any and all government effort to stem the tide of Covid infection. Meaning if there is another lockdown in place, it will be unlikely we will be able to finish the film. There is a chance, as with any film, that the project could fall apart. We remain optimistic about these risks and believe in making this film. 

That said, we're not stupid. We're gonna wear masks unless we're in front of a camera for a scene. 
 

Alright bruh, but I'm like v broke. How can I support without giving you money? 

Spread the word out! Let people know that Brooklyn Battle Comedy is making movies and needs help financing. Reach out to us on social media (Instagram: @brooklyn_battle_comedy, Twitter: @battle_comedy,  Facebook: Brooklynbattlecomedy, Email: contact@brooklynbattlecomedy.com). Bring people to this page! Tell people that a small group of performers are putting together a movie and they need help. Every little like, share, subscribe, and retweet goes a long way to helping us towards our goal. 

Okay, I think I'm done with my question. If I think of something else, what do I do? 
 

Drop us a line at contact@brooklynbattlecomedy.com or visit our F.A.Q page on Indie-a-gogo. Don't see a question there? Ask it above!

story:
Short Summary

The beautifully filmed docudrama, The Students of Umberto Primo,  brings to life the stories of nine young Jewish students studying at  the Italian school, Umberto Primo, in Thessaloniki, Greece, during the time of Nazi occupation. The project is the result of a discovery by  Antonio Crescenzi of students’ essays, graduation diplomas, and other  documents of historical importance, that had been long forgotten in the  basement of the Italian Institute of Thessaloniki (formerly the location  of Italian School of Umberto Primo). Sadly, these students never  received their graduation diplomas, or their papers, because of Nazi  persecution. Thanks to Crescenzi's discovery and subsequent work, 157  diplomas were presented to survivors and/or their families in January  2017.

It is so important now, perhaps more than ever, to remember history, and what can happen when fanatic ideology, nationalism, racial and ethnic discrimination overtake societies, and the human tragedy that ensues. By remembering, we not only honor the victims, but also hopefully prevent these events from happening again.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Overall, we need $200,000 in additional funding to complete this ambitious film project. Filming is already underway, and we are now raising funds for post-production work and distribution.
  • Get your name in film credits! Get an all-expenses paid trip to Greece for the premier! Get VIP premier tickets! These are just some of the perks and rewards for certain tiers of backing.
  • All funds raised go directly to support the filming, post-production and distribution of the film.

The Impact

When we think about today's political and social climate, against particularly the backdrop of a global pandemic that should and could have united all of us against a common enemy, the messages and stories of this film become all the more poignant. The film is especially relevant in the US, with our large Greek, Italian and Jewish diaspora.

Our Indiegogo campaign follows a successfully funded Kickstarter campaign, as well as a hard-working team working diligently on private fundraising endeavors and grant-seeking proposals. 

Risks & Challenges

Filming, fundraising and overall continuity during COVID-19 has been particularly challenging, especially considering the profound economic impact the crisis has had on individuals. We are extremely sensitive to this, and in fact are living it ourselves. But....we made the decision to forge ahead anyway. We are a group of hard-working, dedicated and passionate individuals who believe in the power of film to transform, inspire and move people. There are no contributions that are too small. It will take the power of many to be part of this, and we are grateful for every gesture of support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, we understand! But please--show your support by sharing this campaign using the Indiegogo sharing tools. You can also view/share our website link (www.thestudentsofumbertoprimo.com); share the film's trailer, and use your social media networks to spread the word and build our audience.
